vt. 分析；解释；翻译 vi. 作文法性的分析 同义词:analyse, translate Different lawyers may construe the same law differently.对同一法律，不同的律师可以做出不同的解释。

adj. 至上的；完美的；圆满的 vt. 完成；作成；使达到极点 同义词:perfect, ideal, full, accomplish, carry out, achieve, perform, complete His ambition was consummated when he received his doctor's degree from Cambridge.当他从剑桥大学获得了博士学位时，他的抱负实现了。
n. 圆满成功；完成；成就；达到极点 同义词:completion, achievement, effort, execution, success The bold and brilliant dream still consummation .这个勇敢明智的理想仍有待实现。
n. 传染病；蔓延；触染 同义词:infection, epidemic As a result contagion has intensified (see article).结果就是，恐慌蔓延剧烈。
adj. 感染性的；会蔓延的 They also say that a positive or negative attitude contagious .他们经常说一种积极或者消极态度都是会传染的。

n. 沉思；注视；意图 同义词:reflection, intention, meaning, will, offer I am quite content with philosophic contemplation .我非常满足于哲理性的冥想。
n. 轻视，蔑视；耻辱 同义词:despite, defiance He interpreted . the silence as contempt .他把这沉默视为轻蔑。
adj. 可鄙的；卑劣的；可轻视的 同义词:despicable, underhanded Its color and design are marvelous ; its drawing contemptible .它的颜色和图案是惊人的，它的图画却很无聊。
n. 争论，争辩；争夺；论点 同义词:thesis, combat The division of their father's property is their bone of contention .他们父亲财产分配的问题是他们争吵的原因。
adj. 诉讼的；有异议的，引起争论的；爱争论的 同义词:objectionable, litigant But it is still contentious one .但这还是一个颇具争议的做法。
n. 邻近，接触 同义词:touch, neighbourhood The contiguity of the house and the garage was a convenience in bad weather .房屋与车房的接近在坏天气时是一项便利。
adj. 连续的；邻近的；接触的 同义词:adjacent, straight, endless, running, serial Only China , the Soviet Union and Canada surpass Brazil in contiguous land area .只有中国、苏联及加拿大的毗邻大陆面积大于巴西。
n. 自制，克制；节欲（尤指禁欲） 同义词:possession, restraint You can choose as per your continence .您可以选择按您的节制。

n. 偶然性；[安全] 意外事故；可能性；[审计] 意外开支 同义词:possibility, probability, feasibility, potential, chance Now they are falling back on a Plan C , contingency .现在他们又回落到C计划，以防意外事情发生。

adj. 因情况而异的；不一定的；偶然发生的 n. 分遣队；偶然事件；分得部分 同义词:occurrent, chancy, happenchance, detachment Contingent valuation is based on surveys of the " disutility " of death at different ages .条件价值评估是基于不同年龄段的“负效用”死亡的数项调查。
vt. 扭曲；曲解 vi. 扭曲 同义词:distort, misinterpret, distort His face was contorted with anger.他的脸都气歪了。
n. 扭弯；扭歪 同义词:distortedness Their bodies had contortion as a result of malnutrition .由于营养不良他们的躯体都变了形。
vi. 收缩；感染；订约 vt. 感染；订约；使缩短 n. 合同；婚约 同义词:communicate, shrink, affect, catch, communicate, compact, engagement A hedgehog often contracts its body into a ball.刺猬常常把它的身体收缩成一个圆球。
n. 收缩，紧缩；缩写式；害病 同义词:shrinkage, necking down The hormone that stimulates gall bladder contraction was called cholecystokinin .刺激胆囊收缩的激素被称为胆囊收缩素。
vt. 抵触；违反；反驳；否认 同义词:violate, deny A dictatorship contravenes the liberty of individuals.独裁政治与个人自由相抵触。

n. 违反，违背；矛盾；违法 同义词:conflict, breach, infringement As we waited , a truck came out of the reserve piled high with bamboo , in contravention of a court ban on logging .等待时，一辆满载竹子的大货车驶出了保护区，而当地法院早就禁止在保护区内砍伐树木。
adj. 悔悟了的；后悔的；悔罪的 同义词:regretful, repentant The sorrow of a contrite heart .那懊悔的心满是内疚。
n. 痛悔；悔悟 In contrition she expatiated on the beauty of the garden .在后悔中，她反复谈论着花园的美丽。
vt. 设计；发明；图谋 vi. 谋划；设法做到 同义词:design, engineer, style, project, frame, to see that They contrived a mask against poison gas.他们设计了一种防毒面具。
adj. 人为的；做作的；不自然的 同义词:affected, factitious They contrived a mask against poison gas.他们设计了一种防毒面具。
n. 争论；论战；辩论 同义词:combat, debate, dispute The proposed cuts have caused considerable controversy .削减提议引起了很多争议。
vt. 驳斥；就…展开争论 vi. 争论；辩论 同义词:confute, redargue, debate, dispute about, polemize The statement of the last witness controverted the evidence of the first two.最后一个见证人的陈述反驳了前两个人的证词
adj. 不听命令的；反抗法院命令的；顽固的 同义词:resistant, stubborn On his refusal to appear in person or by his attorney , he was pronounced contumacious .由于他拒绝亲自出庭或派他的律师出庭，被宣布为抗传。
n. 拒不服从，抗命；藐视法庭 Contumacy or pertinacity .倔强。甚至顽固。
adj. 傲慢的；侮辱性的 同义词:assuming, arrogant Furthermore, the aggressor wrote contumelious words aft .更有甚者，侵略者在船尾写了侮辱性的话。
n. 侮辱；无礼；傲慢 同义词:importance, despite The oppressor 's wrong , the proud contumely .忍受压迫者虐待、傲慢者凌辱。
vt. 挫伤；撞伤；捣碎 同义词:quash If you think uneasiness is static one year , drive contuse an individual ;假如你想一年不安静，就开车撞伤个人；
n. 难题；谜语 同义词:difficult problem, puzzler The answer to the conundrum is valuation .这一难题的答案在于估值。
vi. 渐愈；渐渐康复 The patient is convalescing nicely.病人正在顺利地康复。
n. 恢复期，康复期；逐渐康复 同义词:recovery phase, decubation Another apparent sign of convalescence is more ambiguous .另一个经济恢复的表面信号更为模糊。
n. 惯例；习俗；老套 同义词:tradition, usage, institution, prescription Conventionality is not morality . Self-righteousness is not religion .习俗不不等于道德，自以为是也不是宗教。
vi. 聚合；集中于一点 vt. 会聚；使聚集；使向一点会合 同义词:group, gather together, cluster These lines converge at a certain point.这些线集中于某一点。
adj. 熟悉的；精通的；亲近的 同义词:familiar, perfect, near, close James is conversant with chronometer and geography .詹姆斯精通天文和地理。

n. 转换；变换；[金融] 兑换；改变信仰 同义词:transformation, reforming, switching, exchange, changing Oregon has one of the best wave climates for wave energy conversion anywhere in the world .俄勒冈拥有可以媲美世界上任何地方、并能转变称能源的海浪气候。
vt. 使转变；转换…；使…改变信仰 vi. 转变，变换；皈依；改变信仰 n. 皈依者；改变宗教信仰者 同义词:transform, shift, idolater, proselytizer Water is converted into steam if it is boiled.水沸腾时转化为蒸汽。
adj. 可改变的；同意义的；可交换的 n. 有活动折篷的汽车 同义词:equivalent, alterable The transferable preference shares refer convertible into ordinary shares .可调换优先股指可换成普通股的优先股。
adj. 凸面的；凸圆的 n. 凸面体；凸状 同义词:gibbous One piece of glass was convex in shape .其中一片玻璃是凸形的。
vt. 证明…有罪；宣告…有罪 n. 罪犯 同义词:criminal offender, culprit He was convicted of murder.他被判为杀人罪。
n. 定罪；确信；证明有罪 同义词:assurance, damningness This was her third conviction .这是她第三次定罪。
adj. 欢乐的；欢宴的；酒宴的 同义词:festive, rollicking St Clare was invited out to a convivial party .圣?克莱亚应邀去赴一个宴会。
n. 召集；集会；教士会议；评议会 同义词:assembly, calling, gathering, meet They regretted agreeing to the convocation of that meeting .他们后悔同意召开这个会议。
vt. 召集；召集…开会 同义词:call together, call in The president of the board of directors convoked a conference to discuss the future of the company.董事长召开了一次董事会讨论公司的前途。

adj. 复杂的；费解的；旋绕的 v. 盘绕；缠绕（convolute的过去分词） 同义词:complicated, sophisticated, involved, detailed, intricate Miners , after all , concede the need for reform of Australia 's convoluted mining tax regime .毕竟，矿商承认，改革让人摸不着头脑的澳大利亚采矿税制是必要的。
n. 护送；护卫；护航队 vt. 护航；护送 同义词:escort This merchant ship was convoyed by a destroyer.这只商船由一艘驱逐舰护航。
vt. 震撼；使剧烈震动；使抽搐 The whole world was convulsed over the passing away of the great man.这位伟人与世长辞，全世界为之震动。

n. [医] 惊厥；动乱；震撼；震动 同义词:trouble, shock Before us was a mighty chasm in the black rock, jagged , torn , and splintered through it in a far past age by some awful convulsion of Nature.我们前面是一道黑黝黝的巨大的深渊，大约很久很久以前一次可怕的大震动将它崩裂撕扯成这种锯齿獠牙般模样。
vt. 把…关进笼子里；限制；拘禁 vi. 值勤警察在警车里打瞌睡 n. 鸡笼；小屋；捕鱼篓 同义词:block, qualify, shed, cottage We have to coop the dog up all day.我们只得把狗整天关起来。
adj. 丰富的；很多的；多产的 同义词:abundant, numerous, productive, full, plenty He did not predict the future in his copious science fiction , he insisted .在他博学的科幻小说中他从没有预言过未来，他坚持这样。
n. 版权，著作权 adj. 版权的；受版权保护的 vt. 保护版权；为…取得版权 同义词:literary property, intellectual property He resigned his claim to the copyright .他放弃了对版权的权利要求。
n. 撒娇；卖弄风骚；媚态 She gave him a coquetry .她给他一个娇嗔。
n. 警戒线；绶带；束带层 vt. 用警戒线围住；包围隔离 同义词:warning line, warning limit The police cordoned off the street.警察用警戒线封锁街道。
n. 短号；圆锥形纸袋 Louis Armstrong was the first important cornet player to appear in jazz .路易斯·阿姆斯特是爵士乐中出现的第一位重要的小号手。
n. 哺乳宙斯的羊角；装满花果及谷穗表丰饶的羊角状物；丰饶的象征 Our cornucopia is the human mind and heart .我们富足是由于人类的智慧和热情。
adj. 谷类的；粗野的；陈腐的；乡下味的 同义词:robust, gross, rough, country, bush It may sound corny , but it has worked for me , every time .可能听起来很过时，但实际上对于我来说，这每次都凑效。
n. [物] 电晕；日冕；冠状物 同义词:sunglow Her hair is a burning corona , her eyes are white-hot flakes .他的头发如燃烧的皇冠，他的眼中放射出白炽的火花。
n. 加冕礼 She was on her way to a coronation , not a campaign .她走的是当选之路，而不是竞选。
adj. 肉体的，身体的 n. 下士 同义词:physical, personal, material, Petty Officer Second Class Today we are going to discuss the pros and cons of corporal punishment .今天我们要讨论「体罚」的正与反论据。
adj. 法人的；共同的，全体的；社团的 同义词:mutual, entire, common, collective, universal Every week , profit forecasts for corporate Japan are slashed afresh.每周日本企业的利润预测都在不断减少。
n. 臃肿，肥胖 同义词:obesity, fatness prevent and remedy corpulence ;防治肥胖；
adj. 肥胖的 同义词:round, obese, fatty Her father is too corpulent to play handball .她父亲太胖以至不能玩手球。
n. [计] 语料库；文集；本金 同义词:collected works Trial by jury and the law of corpus were practically suspended .陪审团审讯和人身保护法实际上都已废除。
n. [解剖] 小体；[光] 微粒；血球 同义词:molecule, microne General view of a corpuscle ( section ).一般认为一个肾小体（科）。
n. 畜栏；环形车阵 vt. 把…关进畜栏；捕捉；把…布成车阵 同义词:stall, poundage, lockon Hundreds of slaves were corralled for sale.数以百计的奴隶被驱入栏中等待出售。
vi. 关联 vt. 使有相互关系；互相有关系 n. 相关物；相关联的人 adj. 关联的 同义词:relative, associated It is interesting to correlate the history of the 20th century with its literature.把20世纪的历史与文学联系起来是很有趣的。
n. 通讯记者；客户；通信者；代理商行 同义词:client server software, client server relationship FALLING ill in Kazakhstan is often a dreadful experience , as correspondent can attest .在哈萨克斯坦生病是很可怕的经历，就如记者能证明的一样。
n. 勘误表，正误表；应改正的错误 同义词:erratum Corrigendum 6 - Information technology - - Coding of audio -visual objects -- Part 4 : Conformance testing .勘误表6---信息技术---音视频对象编码---第4部分：符合性试验。
vt. 证实；使坚固 同义词:favor, make sure, validate, sustain The new theory has been partially corroborated.这个新的理论已部分地被证实。
n. 确证，证实；确证的事实 同义词:authentication, confirmation To refer to ( an authority , for example ) in support or corroboration ; cite .引用（如一个权威）来证实或支持；引证。
vt. 使起皱；成波状 adj. 起皱的；波状的 vi. 起皱；缩成皱状 同义词:pucker, crinkly, ruffly, wrinkle, crease The wind corrugates the surface of the sea.风吹皱了海面。
n. 起皱；皱状；灌水沟；波纹成形 同义词:cockles, creping The combination of corrugation and the circular tube results in an extremely strong structure .波浪纸板和圆筒状两者结合，会成为非常坚固的构造。
vi. 焕发；闪烁 同义词:scintillate, spark His helmet kept coruscating.他的钢盔在闪闪发光。

adj. 宇宙的（等于cosmical） 同义词:universal, mundane If the satellite has a tilted orbit , the result is a series of vertical bending waves , an out - of - plane corrugation —small ripples in a cosmic carpet .如果卫星的轨道是倾斜的，就会有一连串垂直的弯曲波，也就是突出平面的皱纹，好似宇宙地毯的涟漪。
n. 宇宙；和谐；秩序；大波斯菊 同义词:universe, accordance, world, peace, concert Is there any other intelligent life elsewhere in cosmos ?在宇宙的其他星球上还存在别的有智慧的生物吗?。
vt. 宠爱；溺爱；纵容 n. 宠儿；爱畜；供玩赏的小动物 同义词:pet, baby, a favourite son, blue-eyed boy She had been cosseted by her parents all during her childhood.她小时候一直为父母所溺爱。
n. 服装，装束；戏装，剧装 vt. 给…穿上服装 同义词:clothing, wear, garment, apparel The leading role in the film is costumed in medieval armor.影片中的主角穿着中古时代的甲胄。

adj. 舒适的；惬意的 n. 保温罩 同义词:comfortable, pleasant, easy, cozy Some of the biggest hits could come in derivatives , an area dominated by a cosy club of big global banks .受到打击最大的是衍生品，这个领域曾经是被全球大银行舒适的俱乐部所统治。
n. 圈内人；小集团；伙伴；同志 同义词:partner, comrade For , in the imaginations of a coterie of physicists , biologists and engineers , an alternative world is taking shape.在一圈物理学家/生物学家和工程师的想象中，一个可替代能源的世界正在成形。
adj. 相连的；毗连的（等于conterminous） 同义词:adjacent, conjoint The two aeons are overlapping coterminous .两个世代互相重叠。
n. 睡椅，长沙发；床；卧榻 vi. 蹲伏，埋伏；躺着 vt. 使躺下；表达；弯下 同义词:bed, chaise lounge, stay down, crouch, put, voice He couched his demands in very polite terms.他用十分委婉的措辞表达了他的要求。
n. [脊椎] 美洲狮，美洲豹（特指Felis concolor） 同义词:mountain lion, leopard I saw cougar slinking toward its prey .我看到一只美洲狮正在潜随猎物。
n. 面容，表情；支持 vt. 支持，赞同 同义词:holding, face, support, look, adhesion, encourage, second, back, carry, hand We will never countenance violence, however serious the threat against us.不管威胁多么严峻，我们永远不会容忍暴力。
vt. 抵消；中和；阻碍 同义词:offset, kill, slow An air straightener should be placed down stream from propeller to counteract circular air motion in the tube .一种气体直线流动器应该使气流从推进器的反作用中使气体的活动在管内循环。
vt. 伪造，仿造；假装，伪装 vi. 仿造；假装 n. 赝品；冒牌货；伪造品 adj. 假冒的，伪造的；虚伪的 同义词:simulate, doctor, come, act, put on, stumour, shoddy, artificial, false It is a crime to counterfeit money.伪造钱币是犯罪行为。
n. 取消；反对命令 vt. 取消，撤消；下反对命令召回 同义词:cancellation, withdrawal, recall, call it off He countermanded his instructions to his staff officer.他撤回了对参谋的命令。

n. 政变；妙计；出乎意料的行动；砰然的一击 vt. 使…颠倒；使…倾斜 vi. 推倒；倾斜；溢出 同义词:inspiration, good idea, invert, pitch, slope, lean The defeat of the coup gave Russia an historic chance to liquidate the organisation .这次政变失败为俄罗斯扫清克格勃组织提供了历史的机会。
n. 契约，盟约；圣约；盖印合同 vi. 订立盟约、契约 vt. 立约承诺 同义词:compact, agreement. They covenanted that their hostages would be present.他们保证他们的人质将到场。

n. 隐藏处；树丛；蔽覆羽翮基部的羽毛 adj. 隐蔽的；隐密的；偷偷摸摸的；在丈夫保护下的 同义词:bosque, boskage, concealed, secluded Since they are hard to conceal , the study says , noses would work well for identification in covert surveillance .研究显示，由于鼻子很难隐藏，所以它是秘密跟踪监视时重要的认证特征。
vt. 垂涎；觊觎 vi. 垂涎；觊觎 同义词:mouth water, mouth water These old stamps are eagerly coveted by collectors.收藏家们对这些旧邮票都垂涎三尺。
adj. 贪婪的；贪求的；渴望的 同义词:eager, hungry, anxious, desired, sick A covetous man is good to none but worse to himself .贪婪之人不擅长于任何事只是贬损了自己。
n. 奶牛，母牛；母兽 vt. 威胁，恐吓 同义词:dairy cattle, crummie, to threaten, threaten with The teacher cowed the pupils with his hard eyes.老师用严厉的目光吓唬学生们。
n. 怯懦；胆小 同义词:poltroonery, recreancy There is more hypocrisy and cowardice .（现在）有了更多的虚伪和懦弱。
vi. 退缩；抖缩；蜷缩；弯腰屈膝 同义词:shy away from, hold back She cowered at the sight of a snake.她见到蛇就退缩不前。

adj. 腼腆的；忸怩作态的；怕羞的 vi. 忸怩作态 vt. 爱抚 同义词:bashful, cutesy, daut, dawt Mr Pawlenty is coy about his ambitions , but he is plainly looking beyond Minnesota 's borders .普兰提先生羞于展现他的野心，但是很显然他的目光已经越过了明尼苏达州的边界。
vt. 瞒；欺骗 vi. 瞒；欺骗 同义词:sell, fox, kid, pull a fast one A clever lawyer can cozen the prisoner into an admission of guilt .一个聪明的律师能施小计诱使囚犯承认有罪。
adj. 舒适的，惬意的 同义词:comfortable, pleasant, easy Grandma cozied Alice tenderly.奶奶亲切地抚慰爱丽丝。
adj. 暴躁的；难懂的；晦涩的；潦草的 v. 抱怨；侧航（crab的过去分词） 同义词:complicated, fierce to crab the conduct of a neighbour批评邻居的行为
adj. 狡猾的；灵巧的 同义词:designing, knowing, subtle, tricky, neat A crafty knave needs no broker .狡诈的骗子无需中间人。
n. 峭壁；岩石碎块；颈；嗉囊 同义词:krantz, steep On the cliff he dwells and lodges, Upon the crag , an inaccessible place .它住在山岩，以山峰和坚固之所为家。
adj. 崎岖的；多峭壁的 同义词:rugged Smaller ones often have craggy shape ; many of them are basically giant boulders .较小的天体则大多呈现不规则的形状，有许多根本就是巨大的砾石。
adj. 填鸭式学的 vi. 狼吞虎咽地吃东西；死记硬背功课 vt. 填满，塞满；死记硬背；猛吃 n. 死记硬背；极度拥挤 同义词:stuff, be packed with, rote memorization, rotta He crammed all his books into the small bookcase.他把他所有的书都塞进小书橱里。
n. 痉挛，绞痛；[五金] 铁夹钳 vt. 束缚，限制；使…抽筋；以铁箍扣紧 adj. 狭窄的；难解的；受限制的 同义词:fit, spasm, chain, block, narrow, restricted, mysterious, confined, strait Gout is cramping his limbs.痛风使他的手脚抽筋。

adj. 狭窄的；难懂的；难辨的 v. 用夹钳夹；约束（cramp的过去分词） 同义词:complicated, narrow, confined, strait, obliged Once the fish lurched suddenly , pulling Santiago forward on his face and cutting his cheek . By dawn his left hand was stiff and cramped .有一次那条鱼突然一个侧身，把桑提亚哥拉得脸朝下地跌了一跤，老人的颊部也给划破了。黎明时分，他的左手变得僵硬并抽起筋来了。
n. 曲柄；奇想 adj. 易怒的 vt. 装曲柄 同义词:whim, vagary, irascible, passionate It was an old car, and I had to crank it up every morning to get it started.那是辆旧式汽车，我每天早晨得摇动曲柄才能使它起动。

adj. 暴躁的；古怪的；动摇的 同义词:fierce, odd, curious Whether we 're kept awake by our partner 's snoring or we stay up too late watching TV , we wake up tired , groggy , and cranky .不论是因为配偶的打鼾声还是熬夜看电视让我们没有睡觉，在醒来的时候，我们都是感到疲惫，稀里糊涂和易怒。
n. 板条箱；篓 vt. 将某物装入大木箱或板条箱中 Your price is to include packing in crate , and delivery to our warehouse .贵方报价应包括板条箱包装费及到我方仓库的运费。
n. 火山口；弹坑 vt. 在…上形成坑；取消；毁坏 vi. 形成坑；消亡 同义词:volcanic vent, dead hole, destroy, damage, recall His car cratered yesterday.他的汽车昨天坏了。
n. 领带；领巾，领结 同义词:tie, necktie cravat with wide square ends; secured with an ornamental pin .有宽宽的方形尾巴的领巾；上面别着一个装饰性的别针。
vt. 渴望；恳求 vi. 渴望；恳求 同义词:wish, long for, rare, aspire The thirsty man craved water.这个口渴的人迫切希望得到水喝。
adj. 畏缩的；怯懦的 n. 懦夫 同义词:shrinking, shy, chicken, molly Robert Craven , a sales training expert , says there is one big reason they fail .营销学专家罗伯特-克雷文认为这便是他们失败的一个很重要的原因。
n. 渴望；热望 v. 渴望；恳求（crave的ing形式） 同义词:aspiration, longing for, soliciting, longing The thirsty man craved water.这个口渴的人迫切希望得到水喝。
n. 蜡笔，有色粉笔 vt. 以蜡笔作画，用颜色粉笔画 同义词:pastels On the right side there was a wall crayoned with colourful designs.在右边有一面画有五彩图案的墙。
n. 折痕；折缝 vi. 起皱 vt. 弄皱；使起折痕 同义词:fell, fold, wrinkle, crush, crumple A frown creased his forehead.眉头一皱使他的前额出现很多皱纹。

n. 信任；凭证；祭器台（等于credence table，credenza） 同义词:faith, trust, confidence, dependence But once again science gives at least partial credence to something that was once considered only a myth .但是科学至少再一次给了那些曾经被认为只是神话的东西一部分的信任。
adj. 可信的；声誉好的；值得称赞的 同义词:trusted, authentic My son makes very creditable grades in school .我儿子在学校取得的成绩是值得赞许的。
n. 轻信；易受骗 同义词:gullibility, dupability Advertisers like to take advantage of children's natural credulity .广告客户喜欢利用儿童天生轻信的特点。
adj. 轻信的；因轻信而产生的 同义词:naive, gullible She was credulous when she listened to the salesman and bought the car for too much money.她很容易轻信别人，竟然听信那个销售员的话以高价买了那辆车。

n. 信条，教义 同义词:belief, teaching, doctrine, tenet, credo Many of the coalition 's liberals — including Nick Clegg , the deputy prime minister —have thought seriously about their creed .许多执政联盟内部的自由主义分子，包括副首相尼克克莱格，将自己的信条奉为圭臬。
n. 小溪；小湾 同义词:burnie, rivulet Tomorrow would be his last run on the Mill Creek line .明天将是他最后一次在密耳科立克线上行驶。
adj. 黄昏的；朦胧的；拂晓的 同义词:hazy, shadowy Crepuscular now adventure , see have two people vomiting .今日黄昏奇遇，见有两人呕吐。
n. 声音渐增 adv. 渐次加强地 adj. 渐强的 vi. 音量逐渐增强 Characteristic is Berlioz 's frequent use of the crescendo .柏辽兹连续地使用乐队渐强，这是很有特点的。
adj. 垂头丧气的，气馁的 同义词:chapfallen, chopfallen ' He did it awfully well, ' said the crestfallen Rat .“他装得太到家了！”垂头丧气的河鼠说。
n. 裂缝；裂隙 同义词:crack, split Every crevice in these walls has been filled with putty .这几堵墙的每个裂缝都用油灰补塞上了。
vi. 畏缩；奉承；阿谀 n. 畏缩；奉承 同义词:honey, recoil from, court, flattery The dog cringed at the sight of a snake.那条狗看见了一条蛇便畏缩不前。
n. 奉承（的） adj. 谄媚（的） 同义词:court, flattery The dog cringed at the sight of a snake.那条狗看见了一条蛇便畏缩不前。
vt. 起皱；使沙沙作响 vi. 起皱；卷曲 n. 皱纹；波纹；沙沙声 同义词:wrinkle, crease, rugosity, wrinkle Some paper is crinkled.有些纸被弄得起了皱纹。
vt. 削弱；使跛；使残废 n. 跛子；残废 adj. 跛的；残废的 同义词:break, to weaken, disablement, lameness, disabled, spavined He was crippled in the war.他在战争中成了跛子。
vi. 呱呱地叫；发牢骚；死 vt. 用嘶哑的声音说；死亡 n. 呱呱叫声；低沉沙哑的说话声 同义词:complain, whine about, end up, angel of death Frogs began to croak with the rainfall.一下雨青蛙就开始呱呱地叫起来。
n. 钩边；钩针编织品 vt. 用钩针编织 vi. 用钩针编织 Stay home and crochet for the next thirty years ?留在家里，再干三十年的钩织？
n. 任人唯亲；任用亲信 Bringing business people into politics can also produce corruption and cronyism .商人从政也容易带来腐败和任人唯亲。
n. 骗子，坏蛋；弯处，弯曲部分；钩状物 vt. 使弯曲；欺骗，诈骗 vi. 弯曲，成钩形 同义词:fraud, dog, sharp, loop, wind, sell, curve, bend, fox, bend, double up He crooked his arm.他弯起胳臂。
adj. 弯曲的；歪的；不正当的 同义词:curve, winding, flexural These winding and crooked courses are the goings of the serpent .这些曲曲折折的行为可说是蛇走路的方式。
n. 交叉火力；串报 The officer responded to what he thought was an accident but was suddenly caught crossfire .这名警官表示：他本以为这是一次意外，却不料突然被交叉火力击中。
vi. 蹲伏，蜷伏；卑躬屈膝 vt. 低头；屈膝 n. 蹲伏 同义词:stay down, grovel, head drop, drop on one's knees, couching The beggar is crouching in a corner of the room.那个乞丐蜷缩在屋子的一个角落里。
adj. 粗糙的；天然的，未加工的；粗鲁的 n. 原油；天然的物质 同义词:rough, native, robust, raw, coarse Brent crude futures have fallen to 55 dollars a barrel .北海布伦特原油期货收于每桶55美元。
n. 粗糙；简陋；未成熟物 同义词:roughness, granulation Fractured zone has a crudity surface with a pitch .断裂带表面粗糙，并带有斜度。
n. 面包屑，碎屑；少许 vt. 弄碎；捏碎 同义词:little, touch, spall The waiter crumbed the table.服务员清除桌上的面包屑。
vi. 崩溃；破碎，粉碎 vt. 崩溃；弄碎，粉碎 n. 面包屑 同义词:fall apart at the seams, come apart, fall apart at the seams, go to pieces He crumbled his bread.他把他的面包捏碎。

n. 咬碎，咬碎声；扎扎地踏 vt. 压碎；嘎扎嘎扎的咬嚼；扎扎地踏过 vi. 嘎吱作响地咀嚼；嘎吱嘎吱地踏过 同义词:craunch, crush The dog was crunching a bone.那只狗正在嘎吱嘎吱地啃骨头。

adj. 甲壳纲的 n. 甲壳纲动物 It has armor and limbs like a crustacean , but has the massive hinged jaws of other fishes .它有着甲壳类动物一样的甲壳和肢脚，却又拥有鱼类一般的铰合式巨颚。
adj. 神秘的，含义模糊的；[动] 隐藏的 同义词:mysterious, hidden, latent Before the day was over , Henry issued a cryptic memo to top executives .亨利赶着在当天就向高级职员发出了一份使人费解的内部通知。
n. 密码 同义词:password, secret code A government uses a cryptogram or secret code.她成功地破译了密码。

n. 小卧室；小隔间 " In Washington I worked in a cubicle , " says a financial adviser .一位财务顾问报怨：“在华盛顿，我是在一个小间里工作。

n. 烹饪，烹调法 同义词:cooking cuisine and wide selection of drinks .菜肴美味可口，饮料品种齐全。

adj. 有罪的；该责备的；不周到的；应受处罚的 同义词:guilty, sinful Equally culpable is the royalist PAD that Mr Kasit belongs to .甲西所属的保皇主义泰国人民民主联盟（PAD），也应当受到同样的谴责。
n. 祭仪（尤其指宗教上的）；礼拜；狂热信徒 adj. 狂热崇拜的 同义词:church, exercise, worship THE birth of the cult of fine wine can be dated precisely .对名酒佳酿的狂热，可以精确地追溯其诞生的日期。
vt. 培养；陶冶；耕作 同义词:rear, foster, plant, nurse Millet is cultivated on some farms here.这里有些农场种小米。
vt. 阻碍，妨害；使受苦 n. 拖累，累赘；妨害 同义词:slow, incumber, drag, encumbrance His heavy boots cumbered him in walking.他的笨重的靴子使他行走不便。
adj. 笨重的；累赘的；难处理的 同义词:problem, hulking This arrangement cumbersome to manage .如此安排繁琐得难以管理。
n. 贪心，贪婪 同义词:greed, covetousness There was a glimmer of cupidity in those small , cunning eyes of his .他狡猾的小眼睛里露出了一丝贪婪的神情。
n. 杂狗；坏蛋 同义词:dog, tike The earth provides a low resistance conducting path for direct cur -rent.大地提供了低电阻直流导电通道。
n. 馆长；监护人；管理者 同义词:managers, governor curator has mentored a lot of college students .这位馆长教导了很多大学生。
n. 抑制；路边；勒马绳 vt. 控制；勒住 同义词:checking, control, restraint, suppression, inhibition, possess, contain, regulate, bit, bottle I could not curb my anger.我按捺不住我的愤怒。
n. 凝乳；凝乳状物 vt. 使成凝乳 vi. 凝结 同义词:renneting, concrete, to freeze Curd - cheese with fruit , egg , caviar , and hearty bread .豆腐乳酪配水果，鸡蛋，奶酪鱼子酱，面包。
vi. 凝固 vt. 使凝结 同义词:set, set The milk has curdled.牛奶凝结了。
n. 脾气坏的人，乖戾的人；吝啬鬼；存心不良的人 同义词:screw, crosspatch The old curmudgeon found a new scapegoat and that let me out .那个老守财奴找到一个新的替罪羊，这样我就脱身了。
adj. 野狗似的；下贱的；恶意的；爱吵闹的 同义词:malicious, vicious
n. 草书；草书原稿 adj. 草书的；草书体的 同义词:running hand, grass style Some new methods are proposed for on-line cursive handwriting recognition .提出了一些新的方法来解决联机英文手写识别问题。
adj. 粗略的；草率的；匆忙的 同义词:rough, brief Now he has chosen as his running mate, on the basis of the most cursory vetting, a first - term governor of Alaska .现在他未经认真筛选就敲定了首次担任阿拉斯加州州长的佩林。
adj. 简略的；简要的；草率的；简单粗暴的 同义词:brief, compendiary The sick man gave a curt shrug of amusement.那个病人简慢地一耸肩，表示开心。
adj. 曲线美的；肉体美的 Ever wonder why men curvaceous women more attractive ?想知道为什么男人对性感、曲线美的女人更感兴趣吗？

adj. 固执的，顽固的；该诅咒的；乖僻的 同义词:fixed, persistent, resistant, set The coach cussed out the team for losing .教练因球队输球而厉声训斥队员。

n. 管理人；监护人；保管人 同义词:administrator, supervisor Investors are also worried by measures to increase the liability that custodian banks have for the assets they look after.投资者也同样对此表示担忧，该提案增加了受托管的银行对资产管理的负担。
n. 保管；监护；拘留；抚养权 同义词:keeping, detention The team split , each half taking " custody " of one of the couple . The project and term were completed successfully .小组被一分为二，分别“接管”那对情侣中的一人。最后，项目成功完成，学期也圆满结束。

n. 角质层；表皮；护膜 同义词:periostracum, stratum corneum Nails that are white near the cuticle and red or brown near the tip can be a sign of kidney disease .护膜附近的指甲呈白色、指尖附近的指甲呈红色或棕色可能是肾病的征兆。
n. [无脊椎] 乌贼；墨鱼 同义词:inkfish, sea sleeve In fact , cuttlefish hurt very serious .事实上，文花枝伤得非常严重。
n. 旋风；[气象] 气旋；飓风 同义词:windspout, hurricane Two faint hopes flicker in the sodden gloom left by the cyclone .在风暴过后的满目疮痍里闪烁着两线模糊的希望。
n. 小天鹅 The change of Love River in recent years is like a modern Fairy Tale of how Cygnet transforms into Swan .爱河近几年的变化，彷佛是一则丑小鸭变天鹅的现代版童话故事。
adj. 愤世嫉俗的；冷嘲的 From Russia 's standpoint , the pact seemed at first a brilliant coup in the cynical game of power politics .从俄国的立场看，这个条约在开始似乎是这场可耻的政治游戏中的一个非常成功的策略。
n. 玩世不恭，愤世嫉俗；犬儒主义；冷嘲热讽 同义词:misanthropy For now , however , such cynicism is misplaced.但是在目前，冷嘲热讽不太合适。

vt. 溅湿；浸入水中 vi. 涉猎；涉足；玩水 同义词:slush Birds are dabbling in the water.鸟儿戏水。

adj. 美味的；讲究的；秀丽的；挑剔的 n. 美味 同义词:delicious, elegant, particular, deliciousness Gourmet Street , a paradise of dainty snacks .美食街，美味小吃的天堂。
n. 嬉戏；闲混；调情 同义词:larkishness, merriment Easy and pleasant as their life at Paris was, it was after all only an dalliance and amiable trifling.尽管在巴黎的生活表面上安逸舒适，毕竟掩盖不了其无所事事，虚度光阴的本质。
vi. 玩弄；闲荡；轻率地对待 vt. 浪费（时间） 同义词:moon, play fast and loose, lose, spend, waste on, trifle away, hurl away Don't dally over your meal, we don't want to miss our train.你吃饭别再磨蹭啦，我们不想误火车。

adj. 打扮得华丽的；打扮得像花花公子的 v. 打扮时髦；使像花花公子（dandify的过去分词） Chapslee offers a chance to enjoy the dandified life of the English gentry at a price which would barely buy afternoon tea in an English country house .查普斯里向人们提供一个享受英国绅士豪华生活的场所，其费用勉强相当于在一个英国乡村酒店买午后茶的价钱。
adj. 上等的，极好的（口语）；服装华丽的 n. 花花公子；好打扮的人 同义词:wonderful, excellent, famous, super, great, playboy, knut The gay package is only for dandy .这种鲜艳的包装只是为了美观。
vi. 摇晃地悬挂着 vt. 使摇晃地悬挂 The rope dangled in the breeze.绳索在微风中悬荡。
adj. 潮湿的；阴湿的；透水的 同义词:wet, humid Cold , dank , and foul - smelling , it was dangerous by any name .寒冷，潮湿和肮脏的气味，它是危险的。
adj. 短小精悍的；衣冠楚楚的；整洁的；整齐的 同义词:ordered, regular, straight Humphrey was dapper and composed as usual .汉弗莱同往常一样衣着整齐，镇定自若。

n. 镖；飞镖；标枪；猛冲 vi. 突进；投掷；猛冲 vt. 投掷；投射 同义词:javelin, onrush, pitch, throw, cast, toss A mouse darted out of the closet and ran across the room.一只耗子从壁橱窜了出来并跑过房间。

n. 拙劣的画匠；笨画匠
vt. 使气馁，使畏缩；威吓 同义词:dispirit, discourage They were daunted by the amount of work still to be done.他们被 那大量待做的工作吓倒了。
adj. 无畏的；勇敢的；不屈不挠的 同义词:game, tough, brave, intrepid The Chinese people waged a dauntless struggle for one hundred years .中国人民所以要进行百年不屈不挠的斗争。
vi. 混日子；游手好闲；偷懒 vt. 混日子；游手好闲；浪费时间 同义词:spare oneself, goof off, goof off, hell around Stop dawdling and help me with these suitcases.别偷懒了，快来帮我拿这些手提箱吧。
n. 僵局，停顿 vi. 死锁；停顿 vt. 停顿；相持不下 同义词:impasse, logjam, bog down, bog down The employers and strikers had deadlocked over the wage.雇主和罢工者在工资问题上相持不下。
n. 崩溃；灾害；解冻 同义词:crash, disaggregation In recent months , what started as a debacle has turned into a nightmare .近几个月来，金融体系最初的崩溃已成为一个噩梦。
vt. 降低；使…贬值；掺杂 同义词:lower down, bring down They debased the value of the dollar.他们使美元贬值。
vt. 使堕落；使颓废 n. 放荡 vi. 放荡；诱使做不道德的事 同义词:deprave, demoralize, licentiousness, dolce vita, sow one's wild oats, easy virtue Bad companions had debauched the young girl.坏伙伴使这个少女放荡了。
n. 放荡；纵情酒色；堕落 同义词:corruption, degradation, deterioration Because a prairie is wide therefore debauchery is admirable.我想她一定是厌倦了放荡的生活，想要安定下来。
vt. 使衰弱；使虚弱 同义词:devitalize, enfeeble The siege of pneumonia debilitated him completely.肺炎的长期折磨，使他变得很虚弱。
n. 衰弱，虚弱；无活力 同义词:breakdown, enervation Laziness leads to debility .懒则衰。
adj. 高兴的，快活的；温文尔雅的；殷勤的 同义词:happy, pleased, glad, delighted, sunny He strolled about, look debonair in his elegant new suit .他穿了一身讲究的新衣服逛来逛去，显得颇为惬意。
vi. （河川向广阔处）流出；进出于（广阔地方） vt. 使出来；使流注 同义词:discharge, issue, shed The platoon debouched from the defile into the plain.该排前出隘路，进军平原。
vt. 盘问；听取报告 同义词:cross examination, catechize The officers debriefed the pilot after he had flown back from the warfront.飞行员从战争前线飞回之后，军官们听取了他执行任务的情况汇报。
n. 碎片，残骸 同义词:remain, chip He brushed away the debris of leaves and pine needles , webs , cocoons and insect corpses .他掸掉了一大堆枯叶、松针、蜘蛛网、虫茧和昆虫的尸体混成的垃圾。
vt. 揭穿；拆穿…的假面具；暴露 同义词:divulgate, come to light The newspaper debunked the youth cult as the tool of a foreign government.报纸揭穿了此青年派别作为某外国政府的工具的真相。
n. 初次登台；开张 vi. 初次登台 He decided to debut with several other violinists.他决定与其他几名小提琴手一起首次登台演出。
n. 初次参加上层社会社交活动的少女 I will not pay a deceitful man like you , said the debutante .我不会付钱给像你这样的骗子的。倔强的少女说。
n. 堕落，颓废；衰落 同义词:corruption, degradation, deterioration I don 't know , when feel so tired ! I don't know , when feel decadence !不知道什么时候觉得那么的累！不知道什么时候觉得那么颓废！
adj. 颓废的；衰微的 n. 颓废者 同义词:deteriorative, overripe " Most decadent , " he said , and held out his water glass .“最过瘾了，”他一面说，一面把玻璃杯递过去。
vi. 撤营；逃走；逃亡 同义词:tail out, pull foot They decamped before rain began.他们在下雨前撤营。
n. 欺骗；谎言；欺诈手段 同义词:fraud, lie, fiction Intrigue and deceit seem to dog the management of just about every political party .阴谋与欺骗看来尾随着几乎每一个政党的管理。
vi. 减速，降低速度 vt. 使减速 同义词:slow down, speed reduction, skid The boy decelerates the bobsled where he nears a curve.凡是到拐弯的地方，这小男孩总是让大雪橇减速。
n. 分贝 In sound we use the decibel scale.在声学中我们采用分贝标度。
adj. 落叶性的，脱落性的；非永久性的 同义词:semipermanent Deciduous tree style such as maple , oak , elm , dogwood , redbud , etc .落叶类树包括枫、橡木、榆树、茱萸、紫荆等等。
vt. 十中抽一，取十分之一；大批杀害 The population was decimated by a plague.人口中的大部分被一场瘟疫所毁。
n. 密电译文 vt. 解释（过去式deciphered，过去分词deciphered，现在分词deciphering，第三人称单数deciphers，名词decipherer，形容词decipherable）；译解 to decipher a hastily scribbled note辨认一张草草写成的便条
vi. 慷慨陈词；演讲；朗读 vt. 演讲；慷慨激昂地发表 同义词:speak, give a lecture, give a lecture, discourse upon Mark Antony declaimed over the body of Caesar.(古罗马统帅)马克安东尼就(被行刺的)恺撒的尸体慷慨陈词。
n. 雄辩；朗诵 同义词:oratory, eloquence Declamation is a traditional Chinese teaching method .诵读教学是我国传统的语文教学方法。
vt. 从机密表删除；撤销文件等的机密级 to declassify secret information and document对机密情报和文件销密[参较classification]
n. 倾斜；偏差；衰微 同义词:differences, slope, deviation, pitch The location is also noted in the lower right corner in celestial coordinates (Right Ascension and Declination ).这个位置也以天球坐标形式显示在右下角（赤经和赤纬）。
n. 下坡；倾斜 同义词:slope, pitch I looked frontage straightly, declivity one by one.我两眼直视前方，一路下坡又下坡。
vt. [计][通信] 译码，解码 vi. 从事破译工作 同义词:encode to decode data or a message译数据或电文密码
vi. 分解；使腐烂 vt. 分解；腐烂 同义词:resolve, break down, analyze, break down The bacteria decomposed the milk into its solid and liquid elements.细菌把牛奶分解成固态和液态成分。
n. 分解，腐烂；变质 同义词:analysis, dissolution, resolving For that reason , too , they decay at the same rate and go through the same phases of decomposition .也因为这一点，两者腐烂的速度与历经阶段均相同。
adj. 有礼貌的，高雅的；端正的 同义词:elegant, civil, polite, correct, exquisite He gave his wife a decorous kiss .他给了他太太得体的一吻。
n. 礼仪；礼貌；端正；恪守礼仪 同义词:ceremony, protocol Can you cancel a date with decorum ?你能够有礼貌地取消约会吗?。
n. 诱饵；诱骗 vt. 诱骗 vi. 被诱 同义词:inveiglement, gudgeon, inveigle He decoyed the ducks to an area right in front of the blind.他把野鸭群诱至诱饵正前方的地区。

n. 法令；判决 vt. 命令；颁布；注定；判决 vi. 注定；发布命令 同义词:sentence, award, act, ordinance, require, order, command, determine, fate, be doomed to, issue an order The government decreed that a new tax be(或should be)imposed.政府命令征收一项新税。
adj. 衰老的；破旧的 同义词:shot, anile Chopin decrepit health reinforced his emotional trauma .肖邦身体虚弱，加重了他的感情创伤。
n. 衰老，老朽 同义词:senescence, consenescence Is it one of age , of decrepitude ?是上了年纪，还是衰老呢？
vt. 责难，谴责；诽谤 同义词:wrong, impugn He decried the lack of support for the arts in this country.他谴责在这个国家里对艺术缺乏支持。
n. 行动；证书；[法] 契据 vt. 立契转让 同义词:action, letter, certificate, act The property has been deeded to her by her husband.这笔财产已由她丈夫立契约转让给她。
vt. 认为，视作；相信 vi. 认为，持某种看法；作某种评价 同义词:count, feel, find, guess, rate, consider, take for She deemed it wise to refuse the offer.她认为拒绝这个建议是明智之举。
adj. 诽谤的；中伤的；破坏名誉的 同义词:calumniatory, infamatory We do not tolerate abusive , malicious , libelous, defamatory or personal attacks .严禁任何谩骂、不当影射、毁谤、恶意批评或人身攻击。
v. 诽谤；中伤 同义词:speak evil of, stab in the back The newspaper editorial defamed the politician.该报社论诬蔑这名政治家。

vi. 拖欠；不履行；不到场 n. 违约；缺席；缺乏；系统默认值 vt. 不履行；不参加（比赛等）；对…处以缺席裁判 同义词:fall behind, lag behind, shortage, deficiency, need, drought, short of, walk out on sth., unsatisfy to default on(或in)an engagement,claim or obligation不履行约言、主张或义务
n. 缺点，缺陷；不足之处 vi. 变节；叛变 同义词:deficiency, disadvantage, vice, fault, shortcoming, apostatize, rise up The scientist defected to another country.那名科学家叛逃到另一国家了。
n. 背叛；缺点；变节；脱党 同义词:deficiency, vice, fault, disadvantage, shortcoming The successful defection of Lyalin presented MI5 with a unique opportunity .利亚林叛逃成功使军情5局得到了一个难得的机会。
adj. 辩护的；为自己辩护的 n. 被告 同义词:justificatory, vindicative, accused person, indictee And even though defendant was exonerated , he was ultimately victimized by the charges .即使被告被宣告没有过失，他最终还是因诉讼受到了损害。

n. 顺从 同义词:compliance, Friend VS Lover Instinctive deference to authority , paternalism and reluctance to cause others to lose face inhibit overt challenge and criticism .对权威出自本能的顺从、家长作风以及不愿让别人丢脸的心态，抑制了公然的挑战与批评。

n. 缺陷，缺点；缺乏；不足的数额 同义词:defect, shortage, vice, need, fault To control further processing , delivery or installation of nonconforming product until the deficiency or unsatisfactory condition has been corrected .在缺陷或不满意状况被矫正前，控制不合格产品被进一步加工、交货或安装。
n. 赤字；不足额 同义词:red ink Even if the US were to do so, it would not change the size of the US trade deficit , only its composition .就算是美国愿意这么做，也无助于改变美国贸易赤字规模，而只会改变其构成情况。
vt. 污损，弄脏；染污 n. 狭谷；隘路 vi. 以纵队前进 同义词:soil, mud, spot, dirty, narrow, cajon The animals defiled the water.牲口把水弄脏了。
n. 定义；[物] 清晰度；解说 同义词:difinition, sharpness At the time , WHO said it would rewrite its pandemic definition to avoid announcing one.当时，世卫组织说，它将改写流感大流行的定义，回避了宣布大流行。
adj. 泄气的 v. 抽气；使泄气（deflate的过去式和过去分词） 同义词:frustrated, disheartened They deflated the tires slightly to allow the truck to drive under the overpass.他们稍微放掉车胎的气以让卡车在跨线桥下行驶。
vt. 使转向；使偏斜；使弯曲 vi. 转向；偏斜 同义词:wind, curve, swing, turn towards The policeman's badge deflected the bullet.那名警察的徽章使子弹偏转了。
n. 偏向；挠曲；偏差 同义词:differences, deviation The pointer oscillates for some time before setting down to a steady deflection .指针会振荡一段时间然后才静止到一个稳定的偏转角。
adj. 灵巧的；机敏的；敏捷熟练的 同义词:neat, dexterous So both nations are deft at playing with numbers .这两个国家对玩弄数字游戏都很有研究。
adj. 死的；非现存的 n. 死者 同义词:belly-up, dead, decedent A family name defunct when the only heir dies without any son .当唯一的继承人死去了之后没儿子，那这个姓就要绝迹了。

vt. 使退化；恶化 vi. 退化；堕落 adj. 退化的；堕落的 n. 堕落的人 同义词:go ill, exasperate, go to seed, retrogress, fallen, degraded, lost souls The morale of the enemy soldiers degenerated, and they were unable to fight.敌军士气低落，所以他们不能战斗。
vt. 贬低；使……丢脸；使……降级；使……降解 vi. 降级，降低；退化 同义词:lower, bemean, sink in the scale, lower down She felt he was degrading her by making her report to the director.她感到他让她向主管人报告是在侮辱她。
vt. 使成兽性；使失掉人性 Conformity dehumanized her.一味屈服使她丧失了人性。
vt. 使…脱水；使极其口渴；使丧失力量和兴趣等 vi. 脱水；去水 Foods are dehydrated to conserve them for future use.把食物脱水弄干贮藏以备将来食用。
vt. 除冰；防止结冰；装以除冰装置 to deice the ice formation on the wing of an airplane除去机翼上结的冰[亦作de-ice]
n. 神化；奉若神明；祀为神 同义词:apotheosis You created a deification and a miracle .你创造了一个神化，创造了一个奇迹。
vt. 把…奉若神明；把…神化；崇拜 同义词:worship, inshrine to deify a beloved king神化敬爱的国王
vi. 屈尊 vt. 赐予 同义词:condescend, favor She would not deign to speak to us.她认为她不值得和我们说话。
n. 神；神性 同义词:divinity, holy one The lumi worship Light as a concept rather than owing allegiance to any deity .光明们将“光”作为一种理念来敬拜，而非忠实于某一神只。
adj. 沮丧的，灰心的 同义词:blue, disappointed, depressed A dejected woman in the crowd who scare buy new share .抢购新股抽签表人流中的一位沮丧的妇女。
n. 沮丧；粪便 同义词:depression, disappointment I am assailed by disappointment , no one will endeavour to sustain me in dejection .倘若失望向我袭击，也不会有人尽力给我支持、解我忧愁。
adj. 美味的；令人愉快的 同义词:delicious, pleasant, lovely, grateful Customer : Well, it says on the menu here that it is delectable , moist and tasty .顾客：是这样，这里的菜单上面说是美味多汁可口的。
n. 愉快；款待；享受 同义词:sunshine, entertainment, luxury, treat, enjoyment Wish we cooperate the delectation !祝愿我们合作愉快！
vt. 委派…为代表 n. 代表 同义词:representation, deputy, behalf of, ambassador They have delegated him to represent their city at the convention.他们选举他代表他们市去参加代表大会。
vt. 删除 同义词:expurgate, prune away It will be clearer if you delete the last paragraph.如果你删去最后那一段，它将会更清楚。
adj. 有毒的，有害的 同义词:harmful, toxic, evil, poisonous Month after month , reports mount of the deleterious effects of rising carbon levels.月复一月，一篇篇关于碳元素增加、有害环境的报告不断累积。
adj. 故意的；深思熟虑的；从容的 vt. 仔细考虑；商议 同义词:intended, studied, designed, contained, conscious, negotiate, mull over to deliberate a question思考问题
vt. 划界；定界限 A ravine delimited the property on the south.一条沟作为南边那块地产的边界。
vt. 描绘；描写；画…的轮廓 同义词:represent, trace, picture, figure The teacher delineated China on the blackboard with a coloured chalk.老师用彩色粉笔在黑板上勾勒出中国的边界。
n. 行为不良，违法犯罪；失职，怠工 同义词:dereliction of duty, slow-down Juvenile delinquency is a serious social problem in this country .少年犯罪上这个国家一个严重的社会问题。
adj. 有过失的；怠忽的；拖欠债务的 n. 流氓；行为不良的人；失职者 同义词:blameable, peccant, swashbuckler, rapscallion Ask a delinquent college student how often he has wronged others.问一个犯法的大学生多长时间犯罪。
adj. 发狂的；神志昏迷的；精神错乱的 同义词:nuts, distraught She must have been half an hour in this delirious condition.她这么丧魂落魄已有半个钟头了。
n. 精神错乱；发狂，狂热；说谵语状态 同义词:abandon, mental derangement In his delirium the man talked nonsense.他精神错乱时说胡话。
n. （河流的）三角洲；德耳塔（希腊字母的第四个字） But good jobs are hard to come by in the Delta .但是在三角洲地区，想找一份好工作还是很困难。
vt. 迷惑；逃避；使失望 同义词:escape, fail Her conceit deluded her into believing she was important.她的自负诱使她相信是自命不凡的。
n. 洪水；泛滥；暴雨 vt. 使泛滥；压倒 同义词:flood, fresh, flow, inundation, overwhelm, snow under The spring thaw caused the river to deluge the region.春天冰雪融化，使河水泛滥淹没了那地区。
n. 迷惑，欺骗；错觉；幻想 同义词:fraud, befuddlement The disappointment of manhood succeeds to the delusion of youth .壮年期的失望接替青年期的幻想。
vi. 钻研；探究；挖 vt. 钻研；探究；挖 n. 穴；洞 同义词:pick, probe into, tunnel, probe into, cavity, hole, aperture to delve into the issue of economic reform探索经济改革的问题
vt. 划分界线；区别 同义词:to make a distinction, tell from He demarcated a piece of property.他给一块地产划界。
vt. 贬低...的身分；举止 同义词:bear oneself, deport The official demeaned himself by accepting the bribe.这名官员因受贿而辱没自己。
n. 风度；举止；行为 同义词:behavior, dealing, presence, bearing, going Have a friendly , open , demeanor .友善、开朗、专心致志的举止。
n. 私有地；领地；土地之所有 同义词:possession, manor The tenants of the demesne enjoyed certain privileges .领地的占有者享有一定的特权。
vt. 遣散；使复员；使退伍（demobilise） 同义词:deactivate, muster out to demobilize troops or an army遣散军队
n. 人口统计学 同义词:larithmics Second , and more subtly , one can look at demography .第二，更加微妙的是，看看人口统计学方面。
vt. 拆除；破坏；毁坏；推翻；驳倒 同义词:destroy, undermine We are going to demolish the old building.我们准备爆破这座旧大楼。
n. 拆除（等于demolishment）；破坏；毁坏 同义词:destruction, breaking, blasting Croft and a sergeant from the pioneer and demolition platoon stepped up .克洛夫特和工兵爆破排的一个士官走了出来。
vt. 使降级；使降职 同义词:disrate As punishment,the corporal was demoted to private.作为惩罚，这下士被降为士兵。
vi. 反对；抗辩；提出异议 n. 异议；反对 同义词:represent, sit down on, opposition, exception The classmates wanted to make her the monitor,but she demurred.同班同学想推选她当班长，可是她不愿意。
adj. 端庄的；娴静的；严肃的；假装正直的 同义词:serious, modest A few weeks later , she had shed her demure image .几个星期后，她抛弃了假正经的形象。
vt. 诋毁；使变黑；玷污 同义词:black, cloud to denigrate someone's character诋毁某人的品德
vt. 给…居住权；移植 n. 居民；外来语；外籍居民 同义词:to transplant, transfer of culture, liver, resident, dweller, inhabitant In this country children of denizen go to school free .在这个国家外籍居民的孩子免费上学。
vt. 为…命名；把…称作… adj. 有特定名称的 同义词:christen, refer to as to denominate someone a docter称某人为博士(或大夫)
n. 面额；名称；教派 同义词:name, church And within America , by one estimate , Mormonism is the fourth -largest denomination .有人估计，摩门教是美国国内第四大的宗教。
n. 结局；终场 同义词:conclusion, outcome, ending I know the story of the play well, still I was deeply moved by the denouement of the play .我熟悉这出戏的故事情节，但是戏的结局仍然使我深受感动。
vt. 谴责；告发；公然抨击；通告废除 同义词:condemn, denunciate She denounced his drinking.她指责他饮酒。
n. 凹痕；削弱；减少；齿 vi. 产生凹陷；凹进去；削减 vt. 削弱；使产生凹痕 同义词:reduction, loss, decrease, cut down on, cut to the bone, break, to weaken The impact dented our car's fender.碰撞把我们汽车挡泥板给撞凹下去了。
n. 齿列，托牙；一副假牙 a denture anchored to teeth on either side of missing teeth .固定在丢失的牙齿的任何一边的一副假牙。
vt. 剥夺；使裸露 同义词:shear, strip of The storm completely denuded the trees.这场暴风雨扫光了所有树叶。
vt. 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚 同义词:spend, exhaust The fire had depleted the game in the forest.那场大火使森林里的鸟兽濒临绝迹。
n. 消耗；损耗；放血 同义词:consumption, waste, wear Ozone -layer depletion above the Arctic is not as extensive as expected because of unusually warm weather .因为不正常的暖气候，北极上空臭氧层消耗的范围并不像我们预期的那么大。
n. 举止；行为；态度 同义词:behavior, dealing, going, bearing, work His deportment had now for some weeks been more uniform towards me than at the first .最近几个星期，他对我的态度要比开始的时候稳定一点。
vt. 免职；作证；废黜 vi. 宣誓作证 同义词:give evidence, bear witness The people deposed the dictator.人民废黜了独裁者。
n. 沉积物；矿床；革职 同义词:mineral deposit, orebed Sedimentation embodies the processes of erosion , entrainment , transportation deposition , and compaction of sediment .泥沙问题包括泥沙的侵蚀、挟带、输移、淤泥和密度的过程。
n. 堕落；邪恶 同义词:corruption, degradation, evil, deterioration Love saw the depravity of sin , and sought a means of restoration .爱是看见了罪的堕落，就寻找一个复原的载具。
vt. 使贬值；贬低；轻视 vi. 贬值；轻视；贬低 同义词:lower, slight, to devaluate, to become devaluated Runaway inflation has depreciated the Russian currency.(脱缰野马似的)恶性通货膨胀已使俄罗斯的货币贬值。
n. 掠夺；破坏，破坏痕迹 同义词:destruction, breaking, blasting on three days of depredation and one day to escape .埃斯特打算剽掠三天，再用一天时间溜走。
n. 剥夺；损失；免职 同义词:removal, losing, expense, disadvantage, cost Some of it appears in the literature on sensory deprivation .这些在有关知觉剥夺的文学作品里出现过。
vt. 委任；授权给；指定…为代理人 同义词:commission, licensed to The Premier deputed the Foreign Minister to act as his deputy.总理委派外交部长作为他的代表。

n. 代理人，代表 adj. 副的；代理的 同义词:agent, representation, factor, secondary, proxy, acting, vice, agent, auxiliary The prime minister and his deputy want it to last for at least five years .这位新首相和他的副手（克莱格）希望，这种格局至少能维持五年。
n. 精神错乱，发狂 同义词:delirium, abalienation MRI is an ideal method to diagnose internal derangement of TMJ .结论：MRI是诊断关节内紊乱症理想的方法。

adj. 玩忽职守的；无主的；被抛弃了的 n. 遗弃物；玩忽职守者；被遗弃的人 同义词:ownerless, masterless, Ishmael The derelict farm would be plowed one last time , then sown with disappearing and all but unknown prairie seeds , and left to be.废弃的农场将最后一次接受翻梨，然后被撒上行将绝迹的、几乎叫不上名字的草原种子，随后就听之任之了。
vt. 嘲笑；嘲弄 同义词:guy, jeer at They derided the new music.他们嘲笑新乐曲。
adj. 嘲笑的，嘲弄的；可付之一笑的 同义词:sardonic, sneering He wandered through derisive , if desultory , critique of Dick Cheney , then switched gears.奥巴马略带嘲弄，或者可以说是漫不经心地批评了迪克。
n. [化学] 衍生物，派生物 adj. 派生的；引出的 同义词:ramification, offshoot, extracted, descendent Are there other hidden derivative deals out there?是否存在其他秘密的衍生品交易？
n. 皮肤医学，[皮肤] 皮肤病学 The findings are in the May issue of the Archies of Dermatology .研究结果见刊于五月份的《皮肤学文献集》杂志上。
vi. 减损；贬损 vt. 毁损；贬低；诽谤 同义词:preach down, take away from, lower, wrong to derogate from someone's authority and fame有损某人的权威和名声
adj. 贬损的 同义词:uncomplimentary It was a derogatory word after the revolution .在革命后那是一个贬义词。
vt. 除去盐分；淡化海水 The government should desalinize the function of distribution and play the leading and guiding function in the reform of distribution system .政府应该淡化其分配职能，在分配制度改革中发挥着主导和引导作用。
vi. 唱歌；评论 n. 曲调；评论；歌曲 adj. 最高音的 同义词:sing, observe on, song, comment, air, tune, discant to descant endlessly on someone's failings没完没了地谈论某人的过失
vi. 下降；下去；下来；遗传；屈尊 vt. 下去；沿…向下 同义词:decline, go down They descended from the mountaintop.他们从山顶下来。
adj. 下降的；祖传的 n. 后裔；子孙 同义词:falling, downward, child, seed He is a descendant of Confucius.他是一个古老家族的后裔。
vt. 看见；发现；察看 同义词:detect, come in sight The lookout descried land.守望员望见了陆地。
vt. 亵渎；污辱；把（神物）供俗用 同义词:soil, dishallow to desecrate the church by using it as a stable把教堂用作马厩，亵渎神灵

adj. 去湿的，使干燥的 n. [助剂] 干燥剂 同义词:exsiccative, dryer, drying agent, silica fee Obtains the operating performance of a desiccant fresh air handling unit by measuring and analysing its operating condition in winter .测试分析了一种余热驱动溶液调湿新风机组的冬季运行情况，得出了这种机组在冬季工况下的运行性能。
vi. 变干 vt. 使干；干贮 同义词:dry out, exsiccate The bricks were desiccated by the sun.砖块被太阳晒干了。
n. 迫切需要之物；所愿望之物 Her only desideratum was health .她唯一的希望就是身体健康。
n. 指定；名称；指示；选派 同义词:instruction, name, pointing, indication, specifies Golden Horde , or Kipchak khanate , Russian designation for the western part of the Mongol empire .金帐汗国，亦称钦察汗国。俄罗斯人对蒙古帝国西方部分的称呼。
adj. 令人满意的；值得要的 n. 合意的人或事物 同义词:satisfying, fulfilling But it is desirable for any news outfit .对任何新闻团体这都是合理的。
adj. 渴望的；想要的 同义词:eager, hungry, anxious, sick, keen She had come , desirous to know the extent of Mary 's grief for Mr. Carson .她来到这里以前，原想要知道玛丽对卡尔逊到底悲痛到怎样的程度。
vi. 停止；断念 同义词:come to a stop, to stop The shopping centre agreed to desist from false advertising.该购物中心同意不再作假广告。
adj. 荒凉的；无人烟的 vt. 使荒凉；使孤寂 同义词:wild, desert, harshen Many coastal towns were desolated by the hurricane.许多沿海城镇遭到飓风袭击而荒芜。
adj. 卑劣的；可鄙的 同义词:contemptible, underhanded I 'm not that mean , despicable , cowardly , lewd creature that horrible little man sees .我可不是那个令人恶心的小人所见到的下流、可耻、懦弱、淫秽的家伙。
vt. 掠夺，剥夺；夺取 同义词:harry, shear, seize The invaders despoiled the country of all its treasures.入侵者抢夺了该国的全部财富。
adj. 沮丧的；失望的 同义词:disappointed, blue, depressed On the question of who pays for all these drugs , the feeling at the meeting was glum but despondent .谈到谁来为这些药物买单的问题时，会议的气氛阴沉，但还谈不上沮丧。
adj. 暴虐的，暴君的；专横的 同义词:tyrannous, Neronian Investment , even in despotic countries , usually brings benefits to ordinary people .即便是在专制国家，投资通常也能造福于普通人。
n. 专制，独裁；专制政治 同义词:autarchy, dictature Diem , a profound traditionalist , ran a family despotism in the oriental manner .狄姆这个根深蒂固的传统主义者，用东方的方式进行家族专制。

adj. 穷困的；无的；缺乏的 n. 赤贫者 vt. 使穷困；夺去 同义词:lacking, impoverished, carry off, take sth off Two . Boat builders would suffer and towline , whip and harness makers would be destitute .其二，造船工的生计会受影响，制作纤绳、鞭子及马具的工人将会陷入贫困。
n. 破坏，毁灭；摧毁 同义词:breaking, death, blasting, disruption, demolition It is simply a matter of decreasing sequestration and destruction of platelet .这是减少血小板的隔离与破坏这么简单的一个问题。
n. 废止；不用 同义词:avoidance, defeasance Desuetude anew waver know clearly !不用再犹豫了！
adj. 断断续续的；散漫的；不连贯的，无条理的 同义词:loose, intermittent China's record of protecting its rare species has desultory .中国在保护其珍惜物种方面有着令人失望的记录。

adj. 分离的，分开的；超然的 v. 分离 同义词:apart, divided, isolated, separate, keep apart, draw apart Levittown was the original suburbia : a place of identical detached single - family houses with white picket fences.莱维敦是郊区的原型：一栋栋由白色尖桩篱栅分开的完全一样的个体家庭的房子。
n. 分离，拆开；超然；分遣；分遣队 同义词:separation, breakaway Such fault systems , which are known as detachment systems, are common in zones where the crust spreads and thins .这样的断层系统，称为脱底断层，常见于地壳扩张与变薄的区域。
vt. 拘留；留住；耽搁 同义词:hold, delay The heavy traffic detained us for half an hour.拥挤的交通使我们耽搁了半个小时。
n. 侦查，探测；发觉，发现；察觉 同义词:exploration, discovery, occurrence, find The main function of the computer fetal monitoring device is fetal heart rate detection .胎心率的自动检测和监护是电脑胎儿监护仪的主要功能。
n. （国际关系中紧张局面的）缓和 同义词:relaxation, alleviation We could not permit our European associates to claim a monopoly on detente .我们不能让我们的欧洲伙伴自称对缓和拥有垄断权。
vt. 制止，阻止；使打消念头 同义词:dispute, block, restrain The large dog deterred trespassers.那条大狗吓住了擅自进入者。
n. 清洁剂；去垢剂 同义词:cleaner, cleaning media Not only this do we need to know but also why they do or why they don't use our detergent .不仅是要知道这一点，而且我们要搞明白他们为什么用或不用这种洗涤剂。
vi. 恶化，变坏 vt. 恶化 同义词:go ill, change for the worse, go ill, exasperate The patient's condition has deteriorated over the last few hours.几个钟头前病人的病情已恶化。
adj. 遏制的，威慑的；制止的 n. 威慑；妨碍物；挽留的事物 同义词:restraining, suppressing, preventer Hizbullah retorts that it needed all these weapons as a deterrent of its own .真主党反驳说它需要这些武器来作为自己的威慑力。
vt. 厌恶；憎恨 同义词:hate, turn away from I thoroughly detest writing letters to her.我很不乐意给她写信。
vt. 使爆炸 vi. 引爆，爆炸 同义词:spring, shoot, blow apart, to explode The terrorists were killed when their bomb detonated unexpectedly.那些恐怖分子的炸弹意外爆炸时他们被炸死了。
n. 爆炸；爆炸声；爆发 同义词:blast, burst Excessive detonation has caused the porcelain on this plug to break away .过分的爆炸会引起火花塞上的陶瓷头的破裂。
vt. 使…绕道而行 vi. 绕道；迂回 n. 绕道；便道 同义词:go round They detoured around the traffic jam by heading south.他们朝南绕过交通拥挤的人群。
vt. 使解毒，去毒 to detoxicate the bloodstream清除血液中的毒素
n. 贬低者；诽谤者 同义词:slanderer, traducer My son , fear the Lord and the king: and have nothing to do with detractor .我儿，上主和君王，你都要敬畏；对他们二者，皆不可触怒；
n. 损害；伤害；损害物 同义词:harm, damage, lesion Nor is the detriment only to the US industry .受到损害的不仅仅是美国轮胎行业。
adj. 不利的；有害的 n. 有害的人（或物）；不受欢迎的求婚者 同义词:harmful, adverse, against, evil, disadvantageous However , raising such taxes can have detrimental effects on economic activity .不过，增加这些税赋，可能对经济活动产生不利影响。
n. 碎石，[地质] 岩屑 同义词:rubble, crushed stone Detritus usually consists of gravel , sand and clay .岩屑通常是由砂砾，沙和粘土组成的。
vt. 毁灭；毁坏 同义词:destroy, damage The invader de-vastated the whole town.入侵者蹂躏了整个城镇。
adj. 毁灭性的；全然的 v. 摧毁（devastate的ing形式）；毁坏 同义词:fell, destructive, fatal, annihilating, rubbling The invader de-vastated the whole town.入侵者蹂躏了整个城镇。
n. 不正常者；偏移值；变异物 adj. 不正常的；离经叛道的 同义词:deviation value, flooey "Big Love", which got respectable ratings, portrays plural marriage as more demanding than deviant .它关注的并不是一夫多妻婚姻的不合伦常，而是那些人生活的艰辛。
vi. 脱离；越轨 vt. 使偏离 同义词:out of contact, break away, diverge The plane deviated from its normal flight path.飞机偏离了正常航线。
adj. 偏僻的；弯曲的；不光明正大的 同义词:remote, lonely, curve The British can be awkward , selfish and devious players of the EU game .你可以认为在欧盟各方的博弈中，英国人是棘手的、自私的、狡猾的。
adj. 缺乏的；全无的 同义词:lacking, scarce imprisonment that devoids a person of humanity剥夺某人人权的关押
n. 相传，转移；委付；依次；落下 同义词:transfer, falling, drop, diversion And devolution has given a chance to talented local leaders from outside the civil service or army .权力下放也给来自公务部门及部队之外的杰出地方领袖们带来机会。
n. 献身，奉献；忠诚；热爱 同义词:commitment, dedication, loyalty As devotion unites lovers , so perfidy estranges friends .奉献使爱人团结，背信弃义疏离朋友。
vt. 吞食；毁灭；凝视 同义词:devastate, wrack and ruin The hungry man devoured his dinner.那饿汉狼吞虎咽地把饭吃光了。
n. 灵巧；敏捷；机敏 同义词:facility, skillfulness I didn 't quite have the dexterity or the mechanical ability to build a robot , although I wanted to .尽管我想制造机器人，但是我那时不够灵巧，也欠缺机械才能。
adj. 灵巧的；敏捷的；惯用右手的 同义词:sharp, fly, neat, quick, keen I was secretly afraid of him when I saw him so dexterous .看了他那股灵活劲儿，我心里倒是暗暗有几分怕他。
n. 糖尿病；多尿症 同义词:polyuria Now , a large study has linked it to diabetes and heart disease .现在，一个大型研究将其与糖尿病，心脏病联系在一起。
adj. 恶魔的 同义词:demonic, infernal This is an incredibly diabolical trick .这真是恶毒到极点的诡计。

adj. 透明的；精致的；模糊的 同义词:transparent, fuzzy, dark, crystal, sophisticated Hence the rainforest 's high level of humidity, visible from diaphanous cloudlets drifting over the canopy.所以，雨林的空气十分湿润，从观测站望去，山林笼罩着薄薄的云。
n. 腹泻 同义词:trot They can also diarrhoea [ spasm ].它们还可以治泻肚[痉挛]。
n. 诽谤；恶骂 同义词:scandal, personalities He launched into a long diatribe ;他投入到一个长期的诽谤中；
n. 二分法；两分；分裂；双歧分枝 同义词:disruption, fragmentation If this dichotomy is maintained what happens to the rate of interest ?如果保持这种二分法，利率会怎样呢？
vt. 命令；口述；使听写 vi. 口述；听写 n. 命令；指示 同义词:require, order, command, instruction, order, bidding, telling, word The president has dictated some letters to his secretary.总裁已向秘书口授了一些信稿。
n. 独裁者；命令者 同义词:autarch, Big Brother They would filibuster the small country of its dictator .他们将对这个小国的独裁者发动抗争。
n. 格言；声明；法官的附带意见 同义词:statement, profession As dictum , it served him well , but it hardly amounts to a business model .很好的人生信条，但无法成为商业模式。
adj. 说教的；教诲的 同义词:homiletic, moralistic My next- door neighbor is a didactic old lady .我的隔壁邻居是个爱训人的老太太。
n. 教授法，教学法 同义词:pedagogy The defects of research paradigm of chemistry didactics exist , and the reasons are various .化学教学论研究范式的缺陷是客观存在的，其原因是多方面的。
vi. 死亡；凋零；熄灭 vt. 死，死于… n. 冲模，钢模；骰子 同义词:go out, angel of death, join the majority, end one's days, former block, cutting block How many people died in the war?在这次战争中有多少人死亡?
n. 营养学；饮食学 同义词:nutrition, sitology It makes a significant contribution to the theories of materia medica , dietetics and nourishment .对本草学、食疗学、营养学均有贡献。
n. 营养学家；膳食学家（等于dietitian） 同义词:nutritionist It is absolutely not something that should be tried without support from dietician .这绝对不是本应尝试确未得到节食者支持的事。
adj. 弥漫的；散开的 vt. 扩散；传播；漫射 vi. 传播；四散 同义词:divergent, transmit, spread abroad, spread abroad, to disseminate The printing press helped diffuse scientific knowledge.印刷品有助于传播科学知识。

n. 扩散，传播；[光] 漫射 同义词:circulation, propagation, proliferation, spread The development of pressure within a cell as result of the diffusion of water into it is called turgor .由于水扩散到细胞内，使一个细胞内压力上升，被称之为膨压。
vi. 离题；走向岔道 同义词:wander from, get off the subject to digress from the point at issue从论点上岔开
n. 离题；脱轨 同义词:off the point, irrelevance " Please pardon my digression , " said Mary . " I didn't mean to diminish the importance of our conversation .“请原谅我离题了，”玛丽说，“我并不想贬低我们谈话的重要性。
adj. 荒废的，要塌似的；破坏的 v. 变得荒废（dilapidate的过去分词） 同义词:destructive, obsolescent The building had been dilapidated by neglect.这座大楼因失修而圮毁。

n. 破损；崩塌；荒废 同义词:breakage, unrepair Such methods as adjusting the layout of tuyeres and cleaning were adopted , which decreased the dilapidation of tuyeres and improved the status of blast furnace .介绍了广钢通过调整风口布局和洗炉等措施减少风口破损，保持炉况稳定顺行，消除炉缸堆积的生产实践。
vi. 扩大；膨胀；详述 vt. 使扩大；使膨胀 同义词:extend, fill, expand, exaggerate The medicine dilated the blood vessels.药物扩张了血管。
adj. 拖拉的；缓慢的，不慌不忙的 同义词:draggy, slow-motion Cautious or dilatory , as in taking action .谨慎的、保守的，如在采取行动中。
n. 困境；进退两难；两刀论法 同义词:difficulty, corner, fix, predicament This , it is important to say , is not a dilemma that science can solve .这——指出这一点很重要——并不是一个科学能解决的窘境。
n. 业余爱好者；一知半解者 adj. 浅薄的；业余艺术爱好的 vi. （在艺术、科学等方面）浅尝辄止 同义词:hobbyist, amateur, injudicious, unreflecting to dilettante in art在艺术方面浅尝辄止
adj. 稀释的；淡的 vt. 稀释；冲淡；削弱 vi. 变稀薄；变淡 同义词:watery, attenuant, break, deliquate, thin Dilute the ammonia with water before you use it.使用氨之前用水稀释它。
n. 稀释，冲淡；稀释法；冲淡物 同义词:thinning, fluxing Both hygiene and proper dilution are difficult to ensure .奶粉的卫生和恰当稀释很难得到保证。
n. 渐弱；渐弱演奏 adj. 渐弱的 同义词:decrescendo, decrescendo to diminuendo down to a mutter把声音渐渐放低，变成小声嘟哝
adj. 小的，小型的，微小的 n. 爱称；指小词；身材极小的人 同义词:tiny, little, small, micro, minute, hypocorism Maggie is a diminutive of Margaret.“Maggie”(玛吉)是“Margaret”(玛格丽特)的昵称。
vt. 使起涟漪；使现酒窝 n. 酒窝；涟漪；浅凹 vi. 出现酒窝；起涟漪 同义词:wimple, Sparkling Raindrops, lipper, wimple A smile dimpled her face.一个微笑使她脸上露出笑靥。
vt. 喧闹，絮絮不休地说 vi. 喧闹，絮絮不休地说 n. 喧嚣 同义词:whoop up, whoop up, bustle, uproariousness, hurly-burly The protesters were dinning their chants into our ears.抗议者在我们耳旁絮聒不休地发出单调而有节奏的喊叫。
n. 小艇；小船 同义词:boat, tender They will not surrender to dinghy .他们决不会向一只小艇投降。
adj. 昏暗的；肮脏的 同义词:lowering, caliginous Dull dingy ) yellow represents caution , decay , sickness , and jealousy .暗黄色代表警告、衰落、疾病和嫉妒。
adj. 外交的；外交上的；老练的 同义词:foreign, experienced The government recalled its ambassador after the diplomatic row .在外交争吵之后，政府召回了大使。
n. 饮酒狂 I hope it is dipsomania .我希望这就是嗜酒狂。
adj. 悲惨的；可怕的 同义词:terrible, miserable, horrible Gratiano . 'Tis some mischance; the cry is very direful .葛莱西安诺出了什麽乱子啦？这叫声很是凄惨。
n. 挽歌；哀悼歌 同义词:keen, elegy She threw down her basket and intoned a peasant dirge .她撂下菜篮，唱起庄稼人的哀歌。
n. 短剑，匕首 vt. 用短剑刺 同义词:knife, cris You meet a foreign teacher Dirk .你碰见了外籍教师德克。
vt. 使省悟；解迷惑；释疑；矫正 同义词:cure of, castigate Let me disabuse of that foolish prejudices.让我消除那个愚蠢的偏见。

adj. 不满的；有叛意的；愤愤不平的 v. 使疏远；使不友爱（disaffect的过去分词） 同义词:disgruntled, malcontented, estranged As a group , Britain 's Muslims come across as more disaffected than their co-religionists elsewhere .作为同一个团体，英国的穆斯林遭遇比了其他地方更多的不满。
n. 不满；背叛 同义词:dissatisfaction, grievance There is disaffection among the ranks of the party .党员中存在着极强的不满情绪。
adj. 不愉快的；厌恶的；不为人喜的；难相处的；脾气坏的 同义词:sick, vinegarish He found it hard to reconcile himself to the disagreeable state .他发现难以忍受这种不愉快的状况。
n. 无秩序；杂乱；衣冠不整 vt. 使混乱；弄乱；使脱去衣服 同义词:messing, disorderliness, cloud, confuse The naughty pupils disarray the class.顽皮的学生打乱了班上的秩序。
n. 灾难，灾祸；不幸 同义词:tragedy, evil, calamity, grief So far rust has not caused a disaster .到目前为止，锈病并没有造成灾害。
adj. 灾难性的；损失惨重的；悲伤的 同义词:sinister, sorrowful Leaders of the other parties agree that further delay would be disastrous .其它政党的领袖同意进一步的延期将损失惨重。
vi. 解散 vt. 解散；遣散 同义词:dismiss, break up, dismiss, demobilize The government tried to disband the illegal organization.政府企图解散那个非法组织。
vt. 剥夺律师资格 The lawyer was disbarred from practicing again.该律师被取消了再执行律师业务的权利。
n. [法] 取消律师资格 The lawyer was disbarred from practicing again.该律师被取消了再执行律师业务的权利。
vt. 支付；支出 同义词:foot, defray Salaries were disbursed by the paymaster's office.薪金已由工薪出纳员办公室发放。
n. 支出，支付 同义词:expenditure, payment, paying, defrayment T:In most big enterprises , transactions involving the receipt and disbursement of cash far outnumber any others.大多数公司里用现金收入与支付的贸易额超过了任何收付方式。
vt. 识别；领悟，认识 vi. 看清楚，辨别 同义词:recognize, identify, see clearly, tell from We discerned a sail on the horizon.我们看见了地平线上的一张帆。
n. 识别；洞察力；敏锐；眼力 同义词:recognition, identification, vision, insight, perception For her Minerva aided and endowed with courage and discernment .因为密涅瓦帮助她，给了她勇气和洞察力。
vt. 解雇；卸下；放出；免除 vi. 排放；卸货；流出 n. 排放；卸货；解雇 同义词:issue, forgive, issue, shed, firing, dismissal The dockers discharged a ship.码头工人卸下了船上的货物。
n. 门徒，信徒；弟子 同义词:Christian, protege " May I become your disciple "?我能成为您的门徒吗?。
n. 厉行纪律的人；严格的人 adj. 纪律的；训练的 It save time and availability to avoid tummy bug because of not disciplinarian bite and sup .既节省了时间，又有效减少饮食不规律导致胃病的发生。
vt. 否认，拒绝；放弃，弃权；拒绝承认 vi. 否认；放弃；弃权 同义词:yield, desert, negative, refuse, deny, deny, fall out of disclaiming all participation否认与所有参与有关
n. 音乐唱片分类目录；音乐唱片分类学；录音作品目录 Should Kobe 's fans be satisfied with his current discography ?科比的球迷们是否满足于他现在的状态？
vt. 挫败；扰乱，破坏；使…为难；使…破灭 同义词:destroy, defeat, disorder The tricky question about his finances discomfited the minister.一个有关部长的财源方面的微妙问题使他感到很窘。
n. 狼狈；挫败，崩溃 同义词:crash, disintegration Scarlett wanted to giggle at her discomfiture , for Rhett had caught her fairly.思嘉看见她这副狼狈相忍不住要笑出声来，因为瑞德抓住她的要害了。
vt. 使不方便；使为难；使不自由 同义词:put out, perplex My surprise visit discommoded you.我突如其来给你们添了麻烦。
vt. 使烦恼；使不安；使混乱 同义词:trouble, cloud The breeze discomposed her hair.微风将她的头发吹乱了。
n. 不安；心乱；狼狈 同义词:tension, unrest This is my " legal " mentality in the face of society discomposure start .这是我以“法律”心态面对社会的狼狈开局。
adj. 不满的；不满意的 v. 不满意（discontent的过去式及过去分词） 同义词:malcontented, disgruntled He discontented with his present job .他对于现在的工作不满意。
adj. 不和谐的，刺耳的；不一致的 同义词:grinding, sharp, harsh He studied what are known as discordant couples .他对于众所周知的关系不和的夫妇进行了研究。
n. 论述；谈话；演讲 vi. 演说；谈论；讲述 vt. 说出；演奏出 同义词:speech, talk, address, lecture, treatise, orate, speechify, come out with, give voice to They discoursed at the gate for a while.他们在大门口交谈了一会儿。
adj. 失礼的，无礼貌的；粗鲁的 同义词:robust, crude If your thoughts are predominantly self -directed, a discourteous person is what you will be .如果你的主导思想是从个人出发的，那么你不会是一个讲礼貌的人。
vt. 不信；使……丢脸 n. 怀疑；无信用；名声的败坏 同义词:misbelieve, disbelieve, doubt, challenge, suspicion They discredited her good name with ugly gossip.他们用难听的闲言碎语来破坏她的好名声。
adj. 谨慎的；小心的 同义词:careful, cautious, prudent, wary Be discreet about any information you uncover .揭露任何信息都要谨慎。
n. 不符；矛盾；相差 同义词:conflict, unconformity That discrepancy does not presently exist .这种差异目前并不存在。
adj. 离散的，不连续的 n. 分立元件；独立部件 同义词:uncontinuous, incontinuous How about time that comes in discrete steps , as for computers , instead of being continuous ?或者时间并不连续，而是一步步离散分立的，就像电脑一样？
n. 自由裁量权；谨慎；判断力；判定；考虑周到 同义词:care, caution In their rage , the staff have shed all deference and discretion .愤怒之下，职员们已经失去了所有的服从与慎重。
adj. 识别的；有差别的；有识别力的 v. 识别（discriminate的ing形式）；区别对待 同义词:recognizing, identifying The president discriminates in favour of his relatives.总裁优待他的亲戚。

adj. 有辨识力的；差别对待的 They recognized the importance of open and discriminatory government procurement policies and agreed to pursue efforts to increase exchanges in this field .双方认为公开、非歧视的政府采购政策很重要，同意加大力度，增进双方在此领域的交流。
adj. 散漫的；离题的；东拉西扯的；无层次的 同义词:loose, excursive They complained that my writing was becoming too discursive .他们抱怨我的文章变得太散漫的。
n. 蔑视 vt. 鄙弃 同义词:defiance, snotnose She disdained all my offers of help.她鄙弃我要帮助她的所有提议。
adj. 轻蔑的；倨傲的；鄙视的 同义词:scornful, sniffish He disdainful petulance of a rock star ( Annalyn Swan .他假装出摇滚明星般倔傲的任性（阿那林·斯旺）。
adj. 空洞的；无实质的；无实体的 同义词:inane, cavitary Powerful computers birthed the fantasy of a pure disembodied intelligence .功能强大的计算机催生了无躯体智能的狂热幻想。
vt. 使解脱；排除障碍 同义词:extricate, ease of He helped disencumber her of her worries.他帮助她摆脱烦恼。
adj. 空闲的；自由的；已脱离的 v. 脱离（disengage的过去分词） 同义词:available, leisure, free, off, isolated She tried to disengage herself from his grip.她企图挣脱他的牢牢抓住的手。
vt. 剥夺公民权；剥夺推举议员权 to disfranchise someone of the right to vote剥夺某人选举权
vt. 吐出；被迫交出；香槟酒酿制过程中的一道程序，即在插入最后的软木塞前，把沉淀物从酒瓶中取出 to disgorge half-digested food吐出没完全消化的食物
adj. 不满的；不高兴的 同义词:malcontented, grouchy But the message also needs to be conveyed externally before the disgruntled employees do.但也要在不满的员工散布消息之前，向外部传达这一讯息。
vt. 掩饰；假装；隐瞒 n. 伪装；假装；用作伪装的东西 同义词:simulate, come, simulation, acting The president was disguised as a peasant.总统假扮成农民。
adj. 不想的，不愿的 v. 使讨厌（disincline的过去分词） 同义词:laith, disgusted His rareness disinclined me to grant his request.他的粗鲁使我不愿意答应他的请求。
n. 消毒剂 adj. 消毒的 同义词:sterilizing agent, sterilant, sterilizing Light is the best disinfectant for all banks , central no less than private .阳光是所有银行最好的消毒剂，对私人银行如此，对央行也是如此。
adj. 虚伪的；不诚实的；不老实的；狡猾的 同义词:artificial, false, designing, knowing, subtle It is disingenuous of him to flatter me .他对我阿谀奉承，是居心叵测。
vt. 使分解；使碎裂；使崩溃；使衰变 vi. 瓦解；碎裂；衰变 同义词:collapse, dissolve, collapse, chip The old book is gradually disintegrating with age.这本旧书因长年翻阅正在逐渐破损。
vt. 掘出；发掘；显露 同义词:communicate, dig out The corpse was disinterred and re-examined by the coroner.尸体被掘出来，由验尸官重新验尸。
adj. 无私的；公正的；冷漠的；廉洁的 v. 使不再有利害关系；使无兴趣（disinterest的过去分词） 同义词:judicial, distant, just, selfless I am quite sure that he acted in this matter disinterested motives .我十分相信，他在这个问题上这样做是出于无私的动机。
adj. 脱节的；杂乱的；脱臼的 同义词:indigested, mussy The Republic of Turkmenistan disjointed from USSR .土库曼加盟共和国脱离了苏联。
vt. 使脱臼；使混乱 同义词:cloud, confuse A long-protracted strike dislocated the economy.长期罢工打乱了经济秩序。

n. 转位；混乱；[医] 脱臼 同义词:chaos, disorder, confusion, involvement, mix But even with the best G20 financial reform there may be many different triggers for economic and financial dislocation .但即使20国集团（G20）施行最好的金融改革，仍会有许多不同因素引发经济和金融动荡。
vt. 逐出，驱逐；使……移动；用力移动 vi. 驱逐，逐出；离开原位 同义词:cast out, evict, cast out, chase sb./sth. out They needed a bulldozer to dislodge the rock.他们需要一台推土机来挖出岩石。
vt. 蔑视；毁谤 同义词:hold in scorn, contemn You should not disparage good manners.你不应该轻视好的风度。
adj. 不同的；不相干的；全异的 n. 无法相比的东西 同义词:different, diverse, unlike, varying, another There are disparate features that tie the books together in my mind .我印象中有两点特殊性，可以将这两本书维系在一起。
n. 不同；不一致；不等 同义词:difference, inequality, variance Then the question arises . Is this one disparity sufficient to operate as a bar to such a marriage ?那么，问题就来了，只有一点不相称，难道就能作为这么一桩婚姻的障碍吗？
adj. 不带感情的；平心静气的；公平的 同义词:fair, just Has anyone tried approaching the company with a dispassionate attitude ?没人试着以客观冷静的态度与公司交涉吗？
n. 派遣；急件 vt. 派遣；分派 同义词:urgent-mail, mission, send along The president dispatched a messenger to tell the premier what happened.总统派出一名信使向首相禀报所发生的事。
vt. 驱散，驱逐；消除（烦恼等） 同义词:eliminate, avoid The sun dispelled the dense fog.太阳驱散了浓雾。
adj. 可有可无的；非必要的 And a mysterious big - headed role really is dispensable . two sentences on a lens . is estimated to remain a Chaozuo just a gimmick .而那个神秘大当家的角色。真的是可有可无。就一个镜头两句话。估计也就是为了留个炒做的噱头而已。
vt. 使欢娱；使快乐 vi. 娱乐；玩耍 n. 娱乐 同义词:joy, to entertain, recreate, entertainment, pleasure, sport, recreation, amusement The children are disporting themselves in the swimming pool.孩子们在游泳池中戏耍。
adj. 有…倾向的；打算做…的；有某种健康状态的 v. 处理；配置；使适应（dispose的过去分词）；使有倾向 同义词:prone, liable, conditioned He disposed his money in charity.他将自己的钱用于慈善事业。
n. 处置；[心理] 性情；[军] 部署；倾向 同义词:tendency, liability, trend, preference, deployment John resembles his father very much in disposition and appearance .约翰在性格和外表方面都很像其父。
adj. 被逐出的；无依无靠的；失去产业的 同义词:friendless The urban poor , too , came originally from dispossessed peasants .城市贫民本来也是来源于破产的农民。
n. 争论者，辩论者 adj. 争论的 同义词:controversialist, wrangler, gladiatorial, contestable A person engaged in a controversy or debate , especially in public ; a disputant .争论者，辩士：进行争辩或辩论的人，尤指在公共场合；
adj. 爱争辩的 REGRETS were very few in Irving Kristol 's long , happy disputatious life .埃尔文•克里斯托幸福漫长却又充满争议的一生中了无缺憾。
vt. 使不安；使担心，使忧虑 n. 担心，不安；焦虑，忧虑 同义词:concern, discompose, worry, anxiety, tension, fear, care The news disquieted his mother.这则消息令他母亲不安。
n. 探讨，研究；专题论文 同义词:research, study I've even writing a disquisition on the issue.我甚至就这个重难点型写过短篇特别研讨毕业文书。
adj. 声名狼藉的；肮脏的；破烂不堪的 同义词:notorious, infamous He looked disreputable in his gray three days beard .他的灰白胡子三天没有刮，看起来不像样子。
vt. 掩饰，掩盖；假装 vi. 隐藏，掩饰（思想、感情等） 同义词:simulate, come, to hide, mask She tried to dissemble her disappointment with a joke.她用笑话掩盖她的失望。
vt. 宣传，传播；散布 vi. 散布；广为传播 同义词:distribute, publicize, transmit, shed, put about to disseminate seeds播种
vi. 不同意；不信奉国教 n. 异议；（大写）不信奉国教 同义词:to disapprove of, disagree with, exception, demurral Three of the justices dissented from the majority decision.三名法官不同意大多数人的裁决。
n. 持异议者；反对者 同义词:anti, opponent In this way , Galileo is a force for democracy , becomes Galileo the " dissenter . ""这样，作为民主力量的伽利略，便成了“持不同政见者”伽利略。
n. 持不同政见者，意见不同的人 adj. 持不同政见的，意见不同的 DISSIDENT republicans have stepped up their campaign of violence this month .本月，爱尔兰共和军异见分子掀起暴力狂潮。
vi. 掩饰；假装；装糊涂 vt. 掩饰；假装；装糊涂 同义词:act, mask, simulate, come He dissimulated his intentions right up to the moment of the attack.一直到进攻的时刻他仍掩饰自己的意图。
vt. 浪费；使…消散 vi. 驱散；放荡 同义词:lose, spend, to break up, sow one's wild oats The sun dissipated the mist.阳光驱散了薄雾。
adj. 消散的；沉迷于酒色的；闲游浪荡的；放荡的 vt. 消散；浪费（dissipate的过去式） 同义词:gay, ramshackle The sun dissipated the mist.阳光驱散了薄雾。
adj. 放荡的；风流的 同义词:gay, ramshackle Morally unrestrained; dissolute .放荡的；放纵的。
n. 不一致；不调和；不和谐音 同义词:variance, disagreement, disparity, disharmony The result is often a dissonance between a party 's brand and its actual product .其结果通常是一个政党的牌子和实际产品不相符。
adj. 刺耳的；不谐和的；不调和的 同义词:grinding, sharp, harsh His voice is drowned by the dissonant scream of a siren outside .她的声音被外面杂乱刺耳的警报声吞没了。
vt. 劝阻，劝止 同义词:discourage from, dehort Mother dissuaded her from leaving home.母亲劝她不要离家出走。
vt. 使…膨胀；使…扩张 vi. 扩张；膨胀 同义词:fill, swell with Habitual overeating had distended the boy's stomach.习惯性的暴食使这男孩的胃扩张了。
n. 膨胀，扩张 同义词:expansion, inflation The baby cannot consume enough milk to relieve the distension .婴儿不能喝下足够的牛奶以减轻胀气。
n. 蒸馏，净化；蒸馏法；精华，蒸馏物 同义词:essence, purification, elite, flower, prime There exist two physical methods of obtaining very pure wastewater freezing and distillation .有两种达到高纯处理废水的物理方法-冷冻和蒸馏。
n. 区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章 同义词:quality, identity, character, tang, discrimination The first is the thermodynamic distinction between past and future .第一个是过去与未来在热力学上的区别。
adj. 著名的；卓著的；高贵的 v. 区别（distinguish的过去式） 同义词:famous, noted, royal, renowned, celebrated He was very popular, a distinguished fashion figure as well as financier .他是非常有声望的，一位杰出的时髦人物和金融家。
adj. 心烦意乱的；思想不集中的 v. 分心（distract的过去式） 同义词:unglued HE WAS once considered a political magician , with a sleight of hand that distracted from his country 's problems .他曾被认为是一位政治魔术师，他用自己巧妙的手法为国家转移了很多问题。
adj. 发狂的；心烦意乱的 同义词:nuts, delirious Another distraught after an offer of a permanent job was withdrawn.另一名妇女，在申请一份长久工作被拒后，心情烦乱。
n. 危难，不幸；贫困；悲痛 vt. 使悲痛；使贫困 同义词:poverty, disaster, evil, want, grief, aggrieve The news of my mother's death distressed me greatly.母亲逝世的噩耗令我极为悲痛。

adj. 使痛苦的；悲伤的；使烦恼的 v. 使痛苦；迫使（distress的ing形式）；使困苦 n. 破坏处理 同义词:disastrous, sorrowful, necessitating But all that is only limited comfort to those who regard the BNP's breakthrough as distressing and shaming .对认为英国国家党的突破可悲又可耻的人们而言，这只是些许安慰而已。
n. 干扰；骚乱；忧虑 同义词:interference, care, obstacle, disorder, worries The disturbance is sound wave , conforming to the laws of acoustic propagation in solids .这种扰动是种声波，它遵从在固体中声波的传播规律。
n. 发抖；递色；[电子] 高频脉动 vi. 踌躇；发抖；犹豫 同义词:tremulousness, shudder, hesitate, shake She was dithering and wouldn't make up her mind unless forced to .她正在犹豫不决，拿不定主意，除非被迫拿主意。
adj. 白天的；每日的，一日间的 n. 日记账；日报，日刊 同义词:daily, daily paper, daily journal diurnal springs correspond to the semidiurnal neaps and vice versa .全日潮大潮对应于半日潮小潮，反之亦然。
vi. 离题；流浪；漫游 同义词:range, wander from Please divagate from what we're discussing about! We don't need your political opinions .请别从我们所讨论的事岔开话题，我们不需要你政治上的意见。
vi. 分歧；偏离；分叉；离题 vt. 使偏离；使分叉 同义词:stray from, deviate from, deviate The path diverges just after the house.那条道路正好在房子后面分叉。
n. 分歧 同义词:variance, bifurcation, gulf The task of typography is to determine the degree of divergence .字体编排设计的任务同时也是决定分歧的程度。

adj. 不同的；多种多样的；变化多的 同义词:different, unlike, varying, another, dissimilar They then proceed to use this analytical framework to explore subjects as diverse as cancer , pregnancy , mate choice , literature and religion .于是，他们着手利用这一分析框架，探讨癌症、怀孕、择偶、文学和宗教等多种多样的主题。
n. 多样性；差异 同义词:difference, multiplicity And now all three tactics — information , diversity and choice —are looking shaky .现在信息、多元化、以及选择、这三种手段看起来不可靠。
vt. 剥夺；使脱去，迫使放弃 同义词:shear, strip of She divested herself of her coat and sat down.她脱去外套并坐下来。
n. 脱衣；剥夺 同义词:deprivation, despoilment A group of students gathered in front of the administration building to demand divestiture .一群学生聚集在行政大楼前要求被剥夺的权利。
n. 股息；[数] 被除数；奖金 同义词:bonus, stake Dividend swaps allow investors to separate the income from the capital return of equities .股息掉期使得投资者能够将收益从股票资金回流中分离出来。
vt. 泄露；暴露 同义词:reveal, ooze out The boy promised not to divulge the whereabouts of the hiding place.那男孩许诺不泄露隐藏地的所在。
n. 码头；船坞；被告席；尾巴的骨肉部分 vt. 使靠码头；剪短 vi. 入船坞 同义词:landing, pier, crop, bob The pilot docked the ship and cut all the engines.引航员领船进港后并关上了所有发动机。
adj. 教条主义的；空谈理论的 n. 教条主义者；空论家，纯理论家 同义词:dogmatist The world needs a less doctrinaire approach to foreign capital flows .我们需要一种不那么教条的方法来对待外资流动。
n. 轻而易举的事，不费吹灰之力的事 同义词:breeze, pianola That hill 's an absolute doddle (to climb ).（爬）上那座山岗毫不费力。
n. 躲闪；托词 vi. 躲避，避开 vt. 躲避，避开 同义词:subterfuge, escape, stay away from, avoid, shun Jack managed to dodge most of the rocks thrown at him.杰克设法躲过了向他投来的大部分石块。
vt. 脱（衣，帽等）；丢弃，废除；落纱 同义词:reject, abolish to doff clothing脱去衣服
n. 打油诗 adj. 打油诗的 During heartbreak, love is doggerel , caustic and mocking , eloquent and glib.相恨的时候，爱情是一首打油诗，嘲弄讥讽、各逞其能。
adj. 教条的；武断的 同义词:artificial, arbitrary But the vicissitudes of a century of revelations in physics warn us not to dogmatic .但是这一个世纪以来，物理上的发现起起伏伏，我们应该学到教训，不能太武断。
n. 忧郁；赤道无风带 同义词:hyp, cafard The bears think many Western economies will face a similar period in the doldrums .熊市论者认为，许多西方经济体将面临相似的低迷时期。
adj. 寂寞的；悲哀的；阴沉的；忧郁的 同义词:lonely, sad, dark, heavy, blue How to face doleful mood ?怎样面对寂寞的心情？
n. 笨蛋，傻瓜；呆子 同义词:simple, turkey, put, stupid, idiot You dolt ! You can't beat me ! Not even by a fluke of fate !你傻啊！你根本无法打败我！即使你有侥幸的运气。
adj. 愚蠢的 同义词:foolish, stupid, silly, mad, insipient 9 see joke : Son - in-law has doltish reputation .9看笑话： 一家的女婿有呆笨的名声。
n. 领域；域名；产业；地产 同义词:province, territory, world, industry, kingdom, universe, field I can't answer your question about photography . It 's not in my domain .我不能回答你关于摄影的问题，这不在我所学的范围内。
n. 圆屋顶 vi. 成圆顶状 vt. 加圆屋顶于…上 同义词:cupola His forehead domed out in a curve.他的前额呈半球形凸起。
vt. 驯养；教化；引进 vi. 驯养；使习惯于或喜爱家务和家庭生活 同义词:introduce, to teach She was fully domesticated by then,washing the dishes and taking out the garbage.从那以后她非常习惯于家务，刷碗碟和清除垃圾。
n. 家庭生活；专心于家务；对家庭的挚爱 同义词:family life, domestic life Immolate domesticity for aspire after career galvanization.为追求事业发展而牺牲家庭生活。
n. 先生，阁下；指导教师，大学教师 vt. 穿上 同义词:sir, gentleman, academic, Mister, attire in, to put on to don one's clothes穿上衣服
adj. 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的 同义词:still, resting A dormant volcano may explode at any time .休眠火山可能在任何时间爆发。
adj. 背部的；背的，背侧的 同义词:neural, tergal They also dorsal horn neurons less able to respond to pain signals .此外，鸦片类物质也会降低脊髓背角神经元对疼痛讯息的反应。
n. 剂量；一剂，一服 vi. 服药 vt. 给药；给…服药 同义词:dosage, potion, take medicine, physic Feverish patients were dosed with quinine.给发高烧病人服用了奎宁。
n. 档案，卷宗；病历表册 同义词:file, record As well as the census , 2010 will see another attempt to tackle the immigration dossier .除了人口普查，另一项解决移民问题的努力将在2010年展开。
n. 溺爱；老耄；老迷糊 同义词:fondness, maternalism His dotage simply made him more sadistic .再加上年老糊涂，他就更是个虐待狂了。
vi. 溺爱；昏聩 vt. 溺爱 同义词:overindulge, overprotect, spoil She dotes on her youngest daughter.她溺爱她最小的女儿。
adj. 溺爱的，偏爱的 v. 宠爱（dote的ing形式） 同义词:partial, caressing She dotes on her youngest daughter.她溺爱她最小的女儿。
n. 欺骗行为 vt. 欺骗；出卖 vi. 进行欺骗 同义词:cheating, imposturing, sell, fox, kid They say that he would even double-cross his own mother.他们说他甚至会欺骗他自己的母亲。
vt. 插入水中；弄湿；弄熄；急速收帆；脱掉（衣鞋等） vi. 浸泡 n. 泼洒 同义词:get wet, wet up, dip in, soak, splashing Mother doused the clothes in soapy water.母亲把衣服浸入肥皂水中。
adj. 懒散的；过时的；寒酸的 n. 懒散的女人；邋遢女人 同义词:ancient, slouchy, malkin, callet The dowdy fellow is quite unlike the general run of my wife 's guests .这个邋里邋遢的家伙完全不象我妻子的客人那一流人。

adv. 向下，下去；在下面 adj. 向下的 n. 软毛，绒毛；[地质] 开阔的高地 prep. 沿着，往下 vt. 打倒，击败 vi. 下降；下去 同义词:below, under, descensive, pubescence, fur, along with, defeat, floor, fell, decline, descend He fell down the stairs.他从楼梯上摔了下来。
adj. 沮丧的；低垂的；气馁的 n. 倒台；俯视的目光；向下转换 同义词:blue, disappointed, depressed But God , who comforts the downcast , comforted us by the coming of Titus .但那安慰丧气之人的神，借着提多来安慰了我们。
vt. 不予重视；将...轻描淡写 The press has downplayed the president's role in the foreign affairs.报界贬低了总统在外交事务中所起的作用。
adj. 被践踏的，被蹂躏的；受压迫的 同义词:oppressed It took the slaves and the downtrodden .它吸收奴隶和被蹂躏的人。
adj. 单调的；土褐色的 n. 浅褐色；无生气；邋遢；小额 vt. 使无生气 vi. 嫖妓 同义词:flat, blank, monotonous, sandy beige, cafe au lait, lethargize Within Cuba life had settled into a drab routine .在古巴国内，生活已变成一套干巴巴的公式。
n. 单调乏味 同义词:tedium Amid this drabness , though, was a surprising little oasis .在这令人乏味的市场里，却还是有令人惊奇的小绿洲。
adj. 严厉的，苛刻的 同义词:severe, tight, hard, harsh, rigorous In practice , though, America is unlikely to impose draconian price controls .实际上，美国不太可能实施严格的价格控制。
n. 排水；排水系统；污水；排水面积 同义词:wastewater, bailing They do best in sun tolerate some shade and need good drainage .他们最不能容忍太阳光，一些阴影和需要好的排水系统。
n. （可开闭的）吊桥 同义词:suspension bridge, hanging bridge, pontlevis That 's a drawbridge which is swing but not falling.那是摇曳而不墬的吊桥。
vi. 慢吞吞地说 vt. 慢吞吞地说 n. 慢吞吞拉长调子的说话方式 He drawled a greeting to her.他慢吞吞地对她说声问候。
adj. 沉闷的，枯燥的 同义词:tedious, dreich The rainy day drearied the football match.雨天使足球赛变得索然无味。
vt. （用挖泥船等）疏浚；（用拖捞网等）捞取；（在食物上）撒（面粉等） vi. 疏浚，挖掘；采捞 n. 挖泥船，疏浚机；拖捞网 同义词:dust, desludge, to dig, tap into to dredge the sand,silt and mud from the river bottom从河底挖掘砂石、泥沙和淤泥
n. 挖泥船；疏浚机；挖泥机；撒粉器 同义词:custer, couloir As the ponds are quite small and not very deep , it has been proposed that a single grab dredger be used for the operation .由于池塘面积较小而且水不太深，已建议在操作时使用单抓斗挖泥机。
n. 渣滓；少量；沉淀物（dreg的复数） 同义词:offscourings, dribs He made me drink the cup of humiliation to the very dregs .他叫我一滴不剩地饮干了耻辱之酒。
adj. 湿透的；充满的 v. 浸湿；强使服药；覆盖（drench的过去分词） 同义词:full, consumed, covered, overlaid A heavy rain drenched the travellers.一阵大雨把游客都淋得湿透了。
vt. 连击；使滴下；运球 vi. 滴下；流口水 n. n. 点滴；运球 同义词:sprinkling, ball handling, run at the mouth, drip down A little milk dribbled onto the floor.一些牛奶滴落在地板上。
vi. 下毛毛雨 vt. 下毛毛雨 n. 细雨，毛毛雨 同义词:mizzle, drow It drizzled off and on all day.毛毛雨已经时停时续地下了一整天。
adj. 下毛毛雨的，毛毛雨似的 That region drizzly in winter .那个地区冬天常下小雨。
adj. 滑稽的；好笑的；逗趣的 n. 小丑，滑稽可笑的人 vi. 开玩笑 同义词:funny, comical, clow, jester, fool, kid around, to play a joke, to joke He screwed up his mouth in a droll fashion.他扭着嘴装出一副可笑的样子。
n. 笑话；诙谐；喜剧作品 同义词:joke, humor We all enjoyed his drollery .我们都很欣赏他的“诙谐”。
n. 雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者 vi. 嗡嗡作声；混日子 vt. 低沉地说 同义词:do-nothing, goof off, hell around, rumble Don't drone away the precious years of youth.别虚度青春年华。
vi. 流口水；胡说 vt. 从嘴淌下；散漫地说 n. 口水；梦话，胡说 同义词:run at the mouth, slobber, horsefeathers, somniloquence The dog drooled in anticipation of his dinner.那条狗期待着狗食而口水直流。
n. 渣滓；浮渣；碎屑 同义词:leaving, dreg Frequent skimming or improper skimming can cause a much dross loss .撇渣过频或操作不当会使浮渣损失很大。
n. 畜群；牛群、羊群等；移动的人群或大批的东西 v. 驾驶（drive的过去分词） 同义词:herd to drove a herd of cattle赶一群牛
vi. 做苦工，干苦力 vt. 强迫做苦工 n. 做苦工的人 同义词:swink, dogsbody, galley slave He drudges daily with no hope of bettering himself.他每日做苦工，而毫无改善自己境遇的希望。
adj. 双的；双重的 n. 双数；双数词 同义词:double, two-tier The road was already dualled.那条路已改成了双车道。
adj. 柔软的；易教导的；易延展的 同义词:soft, tender "The valve body material shall be shock resistant ductile iron with extended neck for 2 " of insulation .阀体材料是抗冲击的球墨铸铁，可在密封状态下将阀颈延长2英寸。
n. 决斗；斗争，抗争 vi. 决斗 同义词:war, conflict, battle They had been dueling for hours and finally called a draw.他们一直决斗了数小时，最后打成平局。
n. 二重奏 同义词:duo Mary sang very well when duetting with Jane.在和简表演二重唱时，玛丽唱得非常好。
adj. 美妙的；悦耳的；怡人的 同义词:harmonious, sweet, musical The inmost happiness is the most dulcet in the world .内心深处的幸福是世界上最美妙的。
n. 傻瓜；劣学生 同义词:stupid, fool What a donkey , dolt and dunce !真是个笨驴，呆子，兼傻瓜！
n. （由风吹积而成的）沙丘 同义词:sowback, dene The information may be useful for a dune restoration project .这个信息对沙丘治理项目可能有所帮助。
n. 上当者；易受骗的人 vt. 欺骗；愚弄（等于duplicate） 同义词:greenhorn, sell, fox, kid to dupe someone into doing something哄骗某人去做某事
n. 口是心非；表里不一；不诚实 同义词:dishonesty, perfidy The duplicity of the double-dealers reignited the hatred of the people .两面派的欺骗性重新激起人民的仇恨。
n. 持续 同义词:standing, persistence, abidance, continuance So the duration of shaking is a very complex topic .因此震动持续时间是一个非常复杂的话题。
n. 强迫；监禁 同义词:prison, imprisonment Most Iranians are aware of the duress people suffer in jail .大多数伊朗人都知道，在监狱里犯人是屈打成招。
vi. 变矮小 n. 侏儒，矮子 vt. 使矮小 adj. 矮小的 同义词:homuncle, mannikin, scrubby, runty She dwarfed all her rivals in athletic ability.她在体育运动方面的才能使她的对手相形见绌。
vi. 减少；变小 vt. 使缩小，使减少 同义词:to cut down, fall off, shrink, astrict Their vast fortune has dwindled away.他们的大笔财产已逐渐减少。
adj. 动态的；动力的；动力学的；有活力的 n. 动态；动力 同义词:vital, actional, trends, momentum, impetus This reflects the dynamic growth of the physics discipline during this century .这反映出物理学这个学科在本世纪的茁壮成长。
n. 炸药；具有潜在危险的人（或物） vt. 炸毁 adj. 极好的 同义词:explosive material, blasting agent, bomb out, blow to pieces, wonderful, excellent, famous, super, great Terrorists dynamited the dam.恐怖分子炸毁了堤坝。
n. 发电机；精力充沛的人 同义词:electrical machine, electric generator I'm afraid the trouble is in the dynamo .恐怕毛病出在直流发电机上。
n. 难语症；[医] 诵读困难；阅读障碍 同义词:mogilalia, reading disability Dyslexia can also affect a person emotionally .诵读困难还会影响人的情绪。

n. [内科] 消化不良；胃弱 同义词:indigestion, maldigestion The incidence of functional dyspepsia for many reasons , but the mental factors are more common as the incidence of incentive .功能性消化不良的发病原因有很多，但精神因素作为发病诱因比较常见。
n. 耳环，耳饰 v. 抽穗；听见（ear的ing形式） 同义词:eardrop, dangler, hearing Throw some light on this corner to see if the lost earring is there .把灯往这个角落照照，看看丢失的耳环是否在那儿。
n. 屋檐；凸出的边缘 The rain drummed on the eaves of her garden flat at Cuffe Parade .雨水打在卡费广场旁她的花园住宅的屋檐上叮咚作响。
n. 屋檐上流下来的水 vi. 偷听，窃听 同义词:listen in on, happen to hear to eavesdrop on a conversation偷听谈话
n. 衰退；退潮；衰落 vi. 衰退；减少；衰落；潮退 同义词:recession, decline, fail, flag, decline I waded farther out as the tide ebbed.退潮时我涉水出去得更远。
n. 奔放；兴高采烈；沸腾；冒泡 同义词:elation, bubbling She burst into the room with her usual ebullience , and immediately started talking to everyone .她像往常一样兴高采烈地冲进了房间，立刻跟大家攀谈起来。
adj. 热情洋溢的；沸腾的 同义词:boiling, young-eyed But the ebullient Mr Ma is not letting such lack of faith get him down.但总是那么精神抖擞的马云是不会那么容易就丧失信心的。
adj. 古怪的，反常的 n. 古怪的人 同义词:abnormal, odd, curious, fantastic, weirdo She cannot just be written off as an eccentric recluse .不能仅仅把她当成一个古怪的隐居者。
n. 古怪；怪癖；[数] 离心率 同义词:oddity, quirk If wear , taper , or eccentricity is not too great , only honing will be required .如果磨损造成锥度或偏心度不是很严重，仅需要进行衍磨即可解决问题。

n. 换羽毛；（蛇等的）[昆] 蜕皮 同义词:deplumation, exuviae The peptides eclosion hormone (EH) and ecdysis \| triggering hormone ecdysis behaviors and other physiological changes which occur at the end of the molt.羽化激素与蜕皮触发激素诱发昆虫蜕皮行为及蜕皮末期的其它生理变化。
n. 梯形；梯次编队；梯阵；阶层 vi. 形成梯队 vt. 排成梯队 同义词:degree, layer, strata The army was echeloned along the river.部队沿河排成梯队。
adj. 折衷的；选择的；折衷学派的 n. 折衷派的人；折衷主义者 同义词:preferential, selectional Germany , as an example of Eclectic Principle , is drawing close to Universaity Principle too.以德国为例说明了折衷主义原则向普遍主义原则靠拢的趋势。
n. 折衷主义，折衷说 University academic degree, majoring in machinery manufacture or integrated eclecticism .要求大专以上学历，机械制造或机电一体化专业。
vt. 使黯然失色；形成蚀 n. 日蚀，月蚀；黯然失色 The moon eclipses the sun.日食(或：月球遮住太阳)。
n. 牧歌；田园诗 同义词:idyll, pastoral Comedy , eclogue with the prototype of reunited poem .喜剧、牧歌和团圆诗的原型。
vi. 节约，节省；有效地利用 vt. 节约，节省；有效地利用 同义词:save, spare no effort, save on, spare no effort to economize time, money,or energy节省时间、金钱或精力
n. 狂喜；入迷；忘形 同义词:transport, extasy be ecstasied with joy欣喜若狂
adj. 狂喜的；入迷的 n. 狂喜的人 同义词:rapturous, enrapt ' Yes , ' said Bertha , with a smile that was almost ecstatic .“对”。伯莎带着一种差不多是入迷的微笑说。
n. 涡流；漩涡；逆流 vi. 旋转；起漩涡 vt. 使…起漩涡 同义词:gulf, vortex flow, wheel, circle, spin The wind eddied around the tower.风在塔周围回旋。
n. 法令；布告 同义词:notice, act, ordinance edict to rein in lending is the first tool at China's disposal .下令控制贷款投放是中国手头的第一个工具。
n. 启迪；教诲；精神修养 同义词:enlightenment And now , you can listen edification from them .而今，你却可以凝神倾听他们的教诲了。
n. 大厦；大建筑物 同义词:mansion, large building It is an edifice of the transition period .巴黎圣母院是一种过渡性的建筑物。
vt. 熏陶；启发；教诲 同义词:suggest, enlighten religious paintings that edify the viewers诲诱教化观众的宗教画
adj. 可怕的；怪异的 同义词:terrible, horrible, awesome, fearful, dire In the eerie silence of the cavern , the only sound that could be heard was made by water .洞里有一种可怕的寂静，唯一的可以听见的声响是水的嘀嗒声。
vt. 抹去，抹掉；使自己不受人注意 同义词:erase from, sponge Time effaced the memory.时间抹掉了记忆。
adj. 柔弱的；女人气的 n. 女子气的男人 vt. 使柔弱；使无男子汉气概 vi. 变得无男子汉气概；变得柔弱 同义词:female, sybaritic, emasculate It will not effeminate the boy's mind.它不会使这男孩的心灵柔弱。
vi. 泡腾；冒泡；兴奋 同义词:bubble, get it on Ginger beer effervesces frothily.姜汁啤酒泡沫多。
adj. 衰老的；疲惫的；（土地）贫瘠的；（动植物）不育的 同义词:exhausted, decrepit TYPICAL USE:Duing the middle ages , Greek civilization declined and effete .中世纪期间．希腊文明衰微且枯竭。
n. 雕像，肖像 同义词:image, statue, portrait, icon A message to progressives : By all means , hang Senator Joe Lieberman in effigy .给进步人士提个醒：利用各种手段搞臭参议员乔·利伯曼。
adj. 容易的；不费力气的 同义词:easy, light, easiest But the dream of effortless prosperity was shattered by the global financial crash .不过，全球金融危机打碎了“轻松创造繁荣”的梦想。
