vi. 供应；供给 vt. 供应；供给 同义词:provide with, go around, serve, accommodate butchers who have purveyed meat to the royal household for generations世世代代向皇室供应肉食品的肉商
n. 伙食；供给；供应；承办伙食 同义词:supply, lay sth on
adj. 胆怯的；懦弱的；优柔寡断的 同义词:chicken, lily-livered The pusillanimous man would not defend his own family .软弱无力的人不会保卫他自己的家。
n. 腐败；腐败物 同义词:corruption, rottenness This proteolysis and anaerobic breakdown of proteins that yields foul - smelling amine compounds is called putrefaction .蛋白水解及厌氧裂解会产生具有恶臭气味的胺类化合物的反应叫做腐败。
vi. 化脓，腐烂；堕落 vt. 腐烂，化脓；堕落 同义词:gather head, suppurate, rot away, fall into decay Flesh is not putrefied.肉没有腐烂。
adj. 腐败的；腐烂的；令人厌恶的 同义词:ugly, corrupt Why did you paint the room that putrid colour ?你怎麽把房间刷成那麽难看的颜色?。

n. （德）起义；暴动；叛乱 同义词:intifada, insurgence Beer Putsch : In Munich , Adolf Hitler leads the Nazis in an unsuccessful attempt to overthrow the German government .德国纳粹党领导人希特勒率领冲锋队在慕尼克的酒馆里扣押了数名巴伐利亚的官员，啤酒馆政变发生。
n. 布绑腿，皮绑腿；裹腿 同义词:legging
vt. 使…困惑；使…为难；苦思而得出 vi. 迷惑；冥思苦想 n. 谜；难题；迷惑 同义词:baffle, discomfit, contemplate, enigma, difficult problem I am puzzled by his failure to reply.他不给我回信使我感到困惑。
n. [内科] 侏儒；俾格米人（一种身高不满五英尺的矮小人种）；微不足道的人 adj. 矮小的；俾格米人的 同义词:manikin, mannikin, scrubby, dwarfish Sales assistant: Well , you could get that pygmy warrior over there.呃…你可以买那边的侏儒武士像。
n. 桥塔；指示塔；高压线铁塔 同义词:bridgehead The A- pylon harmonizes with the tall spires of the adjacent cathedral .形塔架同附近教堂的高耸尖塔十分协调。
n. 火葬用的柴堆 Yet year after year leaders strap themselves to the stake and wait for the Olympic torch to light the pyre beneath them.然而，年复一年，政治领袖们却心甘情愿地把自己绑到申奥桩子上，等着奥运圣火点燃身下的柴堆。
n. 放火狂；纵火癖 同义词:firebug The Fourth of July pyromania is followed by community pyrotechnics .七月四日，人们在家里食完人间烟火，接下去就是社区的烟花会。
n. 巨蟒；大蟒；丹舌 同义词:constrictor An old woman narrowly escaped python that attacked her in her bathroom .一名老妇人在浴室受到一条巨蟒的攻击，老妇人侥幸逃过攻击。

n. 庸医；鸭叫声 vi. （鸭子）嘎嘎叫；吹嘘；大声闲聊 adj. 骗人的；冒牌医生的 同义词:barber-surgeon, empiricist, crow about, brag about, fallacious, deceptious The old duck quacked and quacked so I hardly slept a wink last night.老鸭子呱呱直叫，吵得我昨晚几乎一夜没合眼。
n. 四边形；方院 We walked all over the campus from the quadrangle to the athletic grounds.我们从方庭到操场，走遍了整个校园。
vt. 大口地喝，痛饮 vi. 狂饮，痛饮 同义词:drink hard, get a bag on, drink hard to quaff (off ) a glass of beer将一杯啤酒一饮而尽
n. 沼泽，沼泽地；无法脱身的困境 同义词:wetland, cienaga Your ideal scene serves as a map that can guide you through the quagmire of options.你理想的场景就像是地图一样让你走出困住你的现实的沼泽地。
vi. 畏缩，胆怯；感到恐惧 n. 鹌鹑 同义词:recoil from, shrink back from The coward quai- led before the enemy.这个懦夫在敌人面前畏缩不前。
n. 疑虑；不安 同义词:tension, unrest They never know that exam make us qualm and dissatisfaction .他们永远也不会知道，考试令我们感到忐忑不安及不满。
n. 困惑；窘境；为难 同义词:corner, confusion Theorists have proposed ways of resolving this quandary .理论家提出了一些方法来解释这个问题。
n. 量子论；额；美国昆腾公司（世界领先的硬盘生产商） 同义词:forehead, frons In the quantum world , objects are described by wave functions .在量子的世界中，物体都是以波函数来描述。
vt. 检疫；隔离；使隔离 n. 检疫；隔离；检疫期；封锁 vi. 实行隔离 同义词:insulate, segregant, investment, insulation, isolation Mary was quarantined for several weeks when she had scarlet fever.玛丽得猩红热时被隔离了几个星期。
n. 采石场；猎物；来源 vi. 费力地找 vt. 挖出；努力挖掘 同义词:source, provenience, dig up, scoop out They are quarrying the hillside for marble.他们正从山坡上采大理石。
n. 四重奏；四重唱；四件一套 We are shown a small profit for the first quartet .我们在第一季度有少量的盈利。
vt. 撤销；镇压；宣布无效；捣碎 同义词:suppress, rat on They quashed the indictment against the manager.他们撤销了对经理的起诉。
adj. 呕吐的；不稳定的；催吐的 同义词:unstable, volatile Some insiders are said to queasy about tinkering with a winning formula .据称一些内部人士对于修补一个成功模式感到不安。

adj. 奇怪的；同性恋的；不舒服的；心智不平衡的 vt. 搞糟；使陷于不利地位 n. 同性恋者；怪人；伪造的货币 同义词:strange, uncomfortable, make a mess of, foul up, put, gay His cheating on the final examination queered his chances of graduation.他在期终考试中作弊使他失掉了毕业的机会。
vt. 平息；镇压；减轻；消除 同义词:eliminate, avoid, moderate, suppress The police quelled the disturbances in inner-city areas.警察平息了市中心区的骚乱。
vt. 熄灭，[机] 淬火；解渴；结束；冷浸 vi. 熄灭；平息 同义词:conclude, go out, die, cool, go out He quenched the fire with water.他用水将火扑灭。
adj. 易怒的，暴躁的；爱发牢骚的，抱怨的；爱挑剔的 同义词:fierce, critical, curious He was also petty, unreasonably querulous , and mean.他并不是爱吹毛求疵的人。
n. 疑问，质问；疑问号 vt. 询问；对……表示疑问 vi. 询问；表示怀疑 同义词:doubt, question, question, inquire about, question, inquire about Query, is this true?请问这是真的吗?
n. 追求；寻找 vi. 追求；寻找 vt. 探索 同义词:pursuit, looking for, pursue / pursuit, go after, explore, search after Our hunting dogs are questing for small wild animals in the woods.我们的猎狗正在树林中搜寻小的野兽。
n. 队列；长队；辫子 vi. 排队；排队等候 vt. 将…梳成辫子；使…排队 同义词:train, alignment, tail, rank, line up for, stand in a line They queued to get into the cinema.他们排队等候进入电影院。
n. 谬论；双关语；遁辞 vi. 诡辩；挑剔；说模棱两可的话 vt. 对…诡辩 同义词:fallacy, idola, prove that black is white and white black, carp at She always quibbles about household affairs with her mother.她总是为了家庭琐事跟母亲争论不休。
n. 匆匆做成的东西；粗制滥造的影片；快饮 adj. 速成的；简短的；匆匆的 同义词:brief, crash The reality is that there are plenty of places at Nightclubs quickie " if they want to.事实是如果人们想要即兴做爱，夜总会里有的是地方。
adj. 静止的；不活动的；沉寂的 同义词:still, resting Those " oligarchs " not in prison or exile are indeed politically quiescent .那些没有身陷囹圄和流亡海外的“寡头”的确在政治上都选择了“沉默是金”。
n. 大翎毛；羽茎；（豪猪、刺猬的）刚毛 vt. 刺穿 同义词:seta, chaeta, cut through, transpierce The first time James Quill was told he had cancer , he was stoic.第一次被告知自己身患癌症时，詹姆斯·奎尔表现得很冷静；

n. 精华；典范；第五元素（被视为地、水、火、风以外之构成宇宙的元素） 同义词:essence, elite, flower, ideal, prime Argand 's mobilism thought as to the dynamical evolution process of the tectonics in On Major Tectonic Forms of China . Then, he quintessence of A.在《中国主要地质构造单位》中，他运用阿尔冈活动论的思想，阐述了中国大地构造的动力演化过程。
n. 怪癖；急转；借口 同义词:excuse, blind She quirked her mouth at me.她冲着我撇一撇嘴。
n. 卖国贼；内奸 v. 卖国；叛国（quisle的ing形式） 同义词:traitor, agent provocateur Jiang Qing said : "Deng Xiaoping is a quisling and a fascist ! ""江青说：邓小平是个一个卖国贼，法西斯。
n. 轻易放弃的人；懒人 同义词:dawdler, lazyboots I have never been a quitter .我从未是半途而废的人。
n. 颤抖；箭袋；震动 vi. 颤抖；振动 vt. 使…颤动；抖动 同义词:shock, flesh-creep, quake, judder, thrill He quivered all over with rage.他气得浑身发抖。
adj. 唐吉诃德式的；狂想家的；愚侠的 Or was he backing down from a quixotic effort that he now knows will cost him too much support back home ?还是准备放弃堂吉诃德式的努力——现在他知道，这种努力会让他在国内失去太多的支持？
adj. 古怪的；引人发笑的；探询的；嘲弄的 同义词:odd, curious Spruance and Pug Henry exchanged quizzical looks near the end .快结束时，斯普鲁恩斯和帕格·亨利交换了一下探询的眼色。
adj. 每日的；平凡的；每日发作的 n. 每天发生的事；日发疟 同义词:daily, ordinary, stock Most solutions to the problem of global warming are tediously , almost oppressively , quotidian .大多数应对全球变暖的措施都是冗长乏味，几近压制，以及司空见惯的。
n. 乌合之众；暴民；下层社会；（搅炼用的）长柄耙 vt. 聚众闹事；用长柄耙搅拌 同义词:sheep without a shepherd, tagraggery The clergymen of the Christian Church were often rabbled in the civil war.内战期间基督教教士常常受到袭击。
adj. 激烈的；狂暴的；偏激的；患狂犬病的 同义词:angry, acute, extreme, furious Even the survey 's most rabid critics acknowledge the utility of this kind of data .连该调查最狂热的批评者也承认这类数据的用处。

n. [机] 齿条；行李架；拷问台 vi. 变形；随风飘；小步跑 vt. 折磨；榨取 同义词:toothed bar, baggage holder, become deformed, to morph, harry, extract, milk, worry, trouble He racked all the bottles of wine after dinner.饭后他将一瓶瓶酒都放在酒架上。
n. 健谈者；善谈者；擅长讲故事的人 同义词:schmoozer, conversationist Charles Dickens was a raconteur par excellence .查理斯·更斯是一位非常卓越的健谈者。
n. 辐射；光辉；发光；容光焕发 同义词:flame, brilliance Her mortal frame could not endure the splendors of radiance .她那世人的肉身禁不住炽热的神光。

vt. 辐射；传播；流露；发射；广播 vi. 辐射；流露；发光；从中心向各方伸展 adj. 辐射状的，有射线的 同义词:release, send, broadcast, beam, project, shine on, light emission, spokewise Heat radiates from the heating radiator and spreads to every corner of the room.热从暖气片散发出来并传播到室内各个角落。
n. 辐射；发光；放射物 同义词:irradiation, Geigers But , it really can absorb in radiation .但是，它真的能吸收辐射啊。
adj. 名誉不好的；卑鄙的；无赖的 同义词:poor, mean, base, dirty He was drinking cheap champagne with a raffish air .他喝着廉价的香槟酒，样子十分放荡。
n. 椽；筏夫（等于raftsman） vt. 装椽于 同义词:viga The police had searched the house from cellar to rafter .警察已把那座房子“上上下下”搜遍了。
n. 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动 vi. 大怒，发怒；流行，风行 同义词:anger, wrath, obtain, anger She raged against her husband for some household affairs.她为一些家庭琐事对丈夫大发雷霆。
adj. 衣衫褴褛的；粗糙的；参差不齐的；锯齿状的；刺耳的；不规则的 同义词:grinding, crude, abnormal, rough, sharp She is always ragging Tom about his stammer.她总是拿汤姆的口吃开玩笑。
n. 袭击；突袭；搜捕；抢劫 vi. 对…进行突然袭击 vt. 袭击，突袭 同义词:robbery, assault, hit, descend on They were going to raid Warsaw the next day.他们将于次日袭击华沙。
n. 铁轨；扶手；横杆；围栏 vi. 抱怨；责骂 vt. 铺铁轨；以横木围栏 同义词:pen, rider, rate, beef about The police railed the spot where the accident happened.警察将事故发生的地点用栏杆围起来。
n. 逗趣；开玩笑 同义词:gaggery, borak He was gifted , on occasion , with a gentle raillery .他一有机会，总爱说一些温和的讥诮言词。
n. 衣服 同义词:clothes, garment, array, thread, wearing apparel raiment and elegant surroundings , men seemed to be contented .衣着华丽、环境优雅，人们似乎都很心满意足。
n. 葡萄干 同义词:rasin I 'd like to buy some raisin cookies , please.我要买些葡萄干夹心点心。

vi. 团结；重整；恢复；（网球等）连续对打 vt. 团结；集合；恢复健康、力量等 n. 集会；回复；公路赛车会 同义词:league, restore, assemble, fall in, assembly, feedback, meet, gathering, congregation The company commander rallied his defeated and dispersed troops.连长把他的打了败仗的溃散部队重新召集起来。
n. 漫步；漫游；随笔 vt. 漫步于… vi. 漫步；漫游；闲逛；漫谈；蔓延 同义词:essay, travel, range, wander off He rambled in the park every morning.他每天早晨在公园中遛弯儿。
adj. 难控制的；喧闹的；粗暴的；骚乱的 同义词:turbulent, noisy Their rambunctious son always got into trouble .他们那个不受“管束”的儿子老是惹麻烦。
n. 衍生物；分枝，分叉；支流 同义词:branch, derivative Main compositions : Pomegranate , Aloe , Sun blocking elemental complex , White lily extract , Quiet type VC ramification .主要成份：红石榴素、防晒元素复合物、白百合、芦荟精华、安定型VC衍生物。
vi. 分枝，分叉；成网状 vt. 使分叉，使分枝；成网状 同义词:branch off, tee off, arborize Their descendants ramified.他们的后代支系蔓生。
n. 斜坡，坡道；敲诈 vi. 蔓延；狂跳乱撞；敲诈 vt. 敲诈；使有斜面 同义词:hill, slope, creep, to spread, shark up, extort They ramped and raged like a pack of trapped beasts.他们像一群被围困的野兽，张牙舞爪，暴跳如雷。
n. 暴怒；暴跳；乱闹 vi. 狂暴；乱闹；发怒 同义词:fury, rough house, anger, chafe at A group of lawbreakers are rampaging around in the centre of the city.一群不法之徒正在市中心为非作歹。
adj. 猖獗的；蔓延的；狂暴的；奔放的 同义词:angry, rude Meanwhile , official corruption is rampant throughout the Communist party and bureaucracy .与此同时，官员腐败之风在整个党政机关蔓延。
n. 壁垒；垒；防御土墙 vt. 用壁垒围绕；防卫 同义词:base, vallum, protect, defend against Were we in a tin cup on top of rampart .我们是否在坍塌墙顶的一只锡杯中呆过。
adj. 腐臭的；令人作呕的，讨厌的 同义词:evil, rank The salad greens were wilted and I think the chicken might 've rancid .沙拉的青菜都黄了，我想鸡肉可能也腐坏了。
n. 深仇；怨恨；敌意 同义词:spite, hatred He has no rancor at heart against you .他心中对你并无怨恨。
adj. 怀恶意的；深恨的 In the past four years , Spanish politics has been characterised by a rancorous bitterness .在过去的四年中，西班牙的政坛被刻画成了仇恨与苦难的交织。
adj. 好色的；喧闹的；粗俗的 n. 莽汉；粗鲁悍妇 同义词:low, coarse Randy and Tara have just seen their grade for their team project .兰迪和塔拉刚刚看到他们小组报告的成绩。
vi. 化脓；怨恨；发炎 vt. 使怨恨；使疼痛；使痛苦 同义词:gather head, be down on, hurt, embitter The boil on my right arm rankled whenever I wrote.每当我写字的时候，右臂上的疖子就使我感到疼痛。
vt. 洗劫，掠夺；遍寻 同义词:harry, despoil They ransacked the whole classroom for their basketball.他们翻遍了整个教室寻找他们的篮球。
vt. 赎回，赎；勒索赎金；救赎；得赎金后释放 n. 赎金；赎身，赎回 同义词:redeem, atone for, redemption He was a slave ten years ago and was ransomed later by an old rich woman.十年前他是个奴隶，后来被一位有钱的老太太用钱赎了出来。
vt. 抢走；轻敲；敲击致使；使着迷 vi. 敲击；交谈 n. 轻敲 同义词:tap, reave, strike, knock on, bob, peening They rapped the door, but there was no answer .他们敲了敲门，但没人答应。
adj. 贪婪的；掠夺的 同义词:greedy, grasping I have a recollection of large, unbending women with great noses and rapacious eyes .我记得我遇见不少身材壮硕、腰板挺得笔直的女人。这些女人生着大鼻子，目光炯炯。
n. 贪婪；掠夺 同义词:greed, avarice Some people think most criminals are attributed to rapacity of money .有些人认为大多数犯罪可归咎于对金钱的贪婪。
n. [水文] 急流；湍流 同义词:rush, whitewater The boat shot rapids .那条船穿过急流。
n. 掠夺；劫掠 同义词:plunderage, depredation For thus saith the Lord God: Bring a multitude upon them , and deliver them over to tumult and rapine .因为吾主上主这样说：我要使许多人来攻击她们，叫她们饱受虐待并遭受抢掠。
n. 密切关系，交往；和谐一致 同义词:relations, society, affinity Ms Bachelet 's rapport with voters made her a good campaigner .巴切莱特同选民的亲密关系曾使她成为一个表现卓越的竞选者。
n. 友好；恢复邦交；友善关系的建立 同义词:goodwill, amity Political commentator have noted the rapprochement which have is take place since the old president die .政治评论家们注意到老总统去世以来发生的友好关系。
adj. 全神贯注的；入迷的 同义词:concentrated, preoccupied I had never before been listened to with such rapt intensity.我以前从来不曾拥有过如此全神贯注的受听者。
n. 兴高采烈 vt. 使…狂喜 同义词:elation, gaiety It passed and he was left with troubled joy , and echo of rapture .它转眼就消失了，剩下的只是几分不安的喜悦，一丝心醉神迷的回味。
adj. 狂喜的；兴高采烈的；欢天喜地的 同义词:enrapt, entranced He was given a rapturous welcome in his home town .在家乡一开起舞会来，我是第一号的活跃人物。
n. 轻率；皮肤上短暂出现的疹子 同义词:giddiness, indiscretion His rashness led ultimately to his ruin .他的急躁鲁莽最终导致辞了他的完蛋。
n. 鼠；卑鄙小人，叛徒 vi. 捕鼠；背叛，告密 同义词:traitor, betrayer, mouse, inform Have you ever heard about dogs going ratting?你听说过狗拿耗子吗?

n. 推理；推论 同义词:conclusion, reasoning, inference, consequence Day Yeong-tri asked that if the book referred to training in addition to cerebral memory , for example , ratiocination .戴永禔先生问，书中是否提及大脑记忆以外的训练，例如推理？
n. 基本原理；原理的阐述 同义词:fundamental, basic principle Such a rationale enables even professionals to pretend that it is always someone else who is paying too much .这样的理论基础使得即便是职业人士也会假装出好像一直是别人在支付过高费用的样子。
adj. 沙哑的；刺耳的；粗声的 同义词:grinding, sharp, harsh Nothing swaggered with a raucous noise to disarrange the perfect harmony .没有任何东西以粗哑刺耳的噪音扰乱这完美的和谐。
n. 咆哮；胡言乱语；热烈赞美 vi. 咆哮；胡言乱语；狂骂 vt. 咆哮；语无伦次地说 adj. 赞扬的 同义词:roar, riddlemeree, gnar, full of bull, huff and puff, bark While he had the fever,he raved all night long.他在发高烧的时候，说了一夜的胡话。
adj. 贪婪的；渴望的；狼吞虎咽的 同义词:eager, hungry, desired, anxious, sick Bagels ! But , I ravenous ! I'm not a baby whining for a teething ring !只有面包圈！但我快饿死了，不像婴儿只想找“磨牙饼”而已！
n. 沟壑，山涧；峡谷 同义词:canyon, quebrada I'm going to check on the driver . he told Kelly , racing ravine .“我去看看驾车人，”他对凯丽说着，往隘谷疾跑下去。
vt. 强夺；强奸；使着迷 同义词:take by storm, spoliate Julius Caesar was ravished by Cleopatra's beauty.克娄巴特拉的美貌使恺撒一见倾心。
adj. 引人入胜的；令人陶醉的 v. 使陶醉；强奸（ravish的ing形式） 同义词:engrossing, spellbinding, charming She has no make-up on but she is ravishing .她没有化妆，但也很迷人。
n. 强夺；销魂；陶醉，狂喜 同义词:transport, spoliation Julius Caesar was ravished by Cleopatra's beauty.克娄巴特拉的美貌使恺撒一见倾心。

n. 生皮；生皮鞭 vt. 用生皮鞭抽打 adj. 生牛皮的 同义词:peltry ECCO is one of the World's top 5 rawhide processing manufacturer , well known as the supplier of high- quality leather for shoe industry .ECCO集团为世界五大原皮生产制造商，以高质量的鞋类皮革供给商闻名于世。
vt. 剃，用剃刀刮 n. 剃刀 同义词:shave, shiv He razors his beard every morning.他每天早晨刮胡子。
n. 旋转木马；喧闹 同义词:carousel, carrousel He razzle - dazzled girls in basketball .他打篮球时，使姑娘们''。'眼花缭乱'。''。
adj. 反动的；反动主义的；反对改革的 n. 反动分子；反动派 同义词:retroactive, counterrevolutionary The Republicans may have co-opted religion for reactionary political ends .共和党人或许是借宗教实现其保守政治目的。
vt. 使恢复活动；使恢复现役；使再开工 vi. 再度活动；使恢复活力 They are trying their best to reactivate the old coal cutter.他们正在尽最大的努力使这台旧截煤机重新运转。
n. [试剂] 试剂；反应物 同义词:reactant, agentia Objective : Methodological evaluation of serum reagent kit made in China.目的：对国产血清果糖胺（FMN）试剂盒进行方法学评价。
vt. 榨取（果汁等）；扩展；挖 n. 令（纸张的计数单位）；大量 同义词:milk, extract, tunnel, grow, lots of, wealth, ocean, sea, body Do you have mint chocolate ream in mints.你们有卖盒装的薄荷巧克力冰淇淋吗？
n. 收割者；收割机；收获者 同义词:harvester, cropper The reaper will bring change in both places soon.死神即将给这两个地方带来变革。
n. 使安心，再保证 Children may worry about cancer being contagious and may need reassurance that they cannot catch it.他们可能会担心癌症会有传染性，因而需要确认他们不会被传染。
vt. 使…安心，使消除疑虑 A kind reader wrote to reassure me that I needs't lose any sleep, because the planes were making the journey anyway .一位好心的读者写信来安慰我说，我不用为此失眠，因为飞机无论如何都是要飞完那段行程。
adj. 令人讨厌的；难看的 同义词:terrible, geeky Am I a rebarbative person ?我是一个令人讨厌的人吗？

vt. 减少；打折扣 vi. 退还部分付款，打折扣 n. 折扣 同义词:discount, shorten, water sth. down, discount, agio Government measures to cool economic growth and the removal of an export rebate have hit steel production .政府旨在为经济增长降温的举措和取消出口退税的做法，打击了钢铁生产。
adj. 反抗的；造反的；难控制的 同义词:resistant, mutinous The captain and two loyal crew members are sent ashore by a rebellious crew .船长及两名忠实的水手被闹事的水手们遗弃在岸上。
n. 断然拒绝；回绝；漠不关心 vt. 断然拒绝 同义词:indifference, apathy, slap on All their proposals were rebuffed.他们的建议全被断然拒绝了。
vt. 指责，非难；制止；使相形见绌 n. 非难，指责；谴责，鞭策 同义词:charge, restrain, reprehension, impugnment The manager rebuked the salesgirl sharply for being rude to customers.经理严厉斥责女售货员的对顾客无礼。
n. 画谜；（以画为提示的）字谜 同义词:logogriph A picture of a cat on a log is a rebus for catalog.谜画中有一只猫(cat)站在一根木头上，谜底是catalog。
n. 反驳；辩驳；反证 同义词:contradiction, refutation Bringing a fourth country into the mix, it provoked a rebuttal from Barack Obama 's White House.而这种拉第四方国入浑水的做法也激起了白宫方面的反驳。
n. 反抗，顽抗；固执，不听话 同义词:resistance, rebellion Your recalcitrance obliges firmness on my part.你不服从，迫使我这方面更坚定了。
adj. 反抗的；反对的；顽强的 n. 顽抗者；不服从的人 同义词:anti, resistant The ministry of justice has purged the courts of recalcitrant judges , too.司法行政部还撤掉了由桀骜不驯的法官组成的法院。
vi. 宣布放弃；公开认错 vt. 放弃；撤回 同义词:desert, yield, quit We should recant all opinions which are in conflict with those proclaimed by the central leadership.我们应当放弃所有与中央领导所宣布的有抵触的意见。
n. 改变论调；取消前言 We should recant all opinions which are in conflict with those proclaimed by the central leadership.我们应当放弃所有与中央领导所宣布的有抵触的意见。
vi. 概括；重述要点；摘要 vt. 概括；重述要点；摘要 同义词:sum, gather up, abstract, brief He recapitulated the resolution demanding better conditions which had been passed in the conference.他简单扼要地说明了会议中通过的改善环境的决议。
vi. 后退；减弱 vt. 归还 同义词:lower, rein back, replace, return, restore, give again The floods gradually receded from the fields.洪水从田野里逐渐退去。
n. [植] 花托；容器；插座 同义词:container, vessel, jack, pocket A cone - shaped ornament receptacle .心脏是一个圆锥形的器官。
adj. 善于接受的；能容纳的 Her mind was receptive .她的头脑是敏感的。
n. 休息；休会；凹处 vt. 使凹进；把…放在隐蔽处 vi. 休息；休假 同义词:break, cavity, rest, relax, vacation to recess a window把窗开在墙壁的凹进处
n. 衰退；不景气；后退；凹处 同义词:depression, downturn, decline, cavity What did you do in recession , Daddy ?在经济衰退时你会怎么做，爸爸？
adj. 隐性的；逆行的；后退的 n. 隐性性状 同义词:regressive, antidromic The kind of mating , using as one parent a known homozygous recessive , is called a test cross .这种杂交即利用一个已知的纯合的隐性作为一个亲本的杂交，称为测交。
adj. 精心设计的；异国风味的；精选的；矫揉造作的 同义词:precious, picked, choice, chosen, select I think this Dao stalk is quite recherche ! ! What about you?觉得这个刀茎是很讲究的！！不知大家怎么看！！！??。
n. 再犯，累犯 同义词:recommitment, jailbird Angiogenesis is the basis of tumor growth , invasion , metastasis and recidivism .血管生成是肿瘤生长、侵袭、转移、和复发的基础。
adj. 互惠的；相互的；倒数的，彼此相反的 n. [数] 倒数；互相起作用的事物 同义词:mutual, au pair That is because the second parameter is actually the reciprocal of the first.那是因为第二个参数值实际上与第一个参数值是可以互换的。
vt. 报答；互换；互给 vi. 往复运动；互换；酬答；互给 同义词:return, requite, to and fro motion, alternate motion The representatives of both sides reciprocated formal expressions of goodwill.双方代表相互表达了礼节性的友好意愿。
n. 相互作用（复数reciprocities）；相互性；互惠主义 同义词:interaction, mutual effect What exactly is the reciprocity mechanism ?换言之，互惠的机制是什麽？
n. 朗诵，吟诵；独奏会；背诵；独唱会 同义词:oral reading, repetition The recital party is coming soon .朗诵会很快就开了。
adj. 鲁莽的，不顾后果的；粗心大意的 同义词:indiscretionary, temerarious Most southern towns have suffered from the reckless depredation of the armed gang .大多数南方城镇都遭受过这帮武装匪徒的鲁蛮掠夺。

vt. 开拓；回收再利用；改造某人，使某人悔改 vi. 抗议，喊叫 n. 改造，感化；再生胶 同义词:exploit, carve out, protest against sth, exclaim at, reconstruction, influence New China has reclaimed many men from a life of crime.新中国把许多人从犯罪的道路上挽救了回来。
n. 隐士；隐居者 adj. 隐居的 同义词:hermit, anchorite, cloistered The old recluse secluded himself from the outside world .这位老隐士与外面的世界隔绝了。
vi. 畏缩；弹回；报应 n. 畏缩；弹回；反作用 同义词:rebound, shrink back from, reaction, backwardness She recoiled hastily at seeing a snake in the path.她见到小路上有一条蛇就赶紧往后退。
vt. 赔偿；酬谢 vi. 赔偿 n. 赔偿；报酬 同义词:make good, indemnify, make good, compensate for, compensation, satisfaction, payment, consideration, reward You will be recompensed for your kindness.你的好意将会得到回报。
vt. 使一致；使和解；调停，调解；使顺从 同义词:accord, unify They were reconciled after a quarrel.他们吵架之后又重归于好。
n. 和解；调和；和谐；甘愿 同义词:coordination, accordance, harmony, concert Its emergence from the gruesome era of apartheid is a miracle of reconciliation .她在可怕的种族隔离时代的异军突起是调解的一个奇迹。
adj. 深奥的；隐藏的；默默无闻的 同义词:hidden, unknown, abstract, deep, latent We hear from mathematicians that bees have practically solved a recondite problem .我们听到数学家说，蜜蜂已实际解决了一个深奥的数学问题。
n. [军] 侦察；勘测（等于reconnoissance）；搜索；事先考查 同义词:scanning, searching Do a reconnaissance before you start work . This will not be time wasted .在开始工作前先进行侦察，这可不是浪费时间。
vt. 叙述；重新计算 n. 重算 同义词:relate, narrate, roll-back He recounted his experiences to the pupils.他向学生们讲述他的经历。
vt. 收回；恢复；偿还；扣除 vi. 获得补偿；请求扣除 同义词:replace, restore, repair, tender, withdraw They are trying to recoup themselves for their losses.他们正在设法挽回他们的损失。
n. 懦夫；叛徒 adj. 胆小的；怯懦的；不忠的 同义词:chicken, rat, molly, timid, harehearted Then Gemma , the girl Arthur loved , mistook Arthur for the recreant .琼玛，亚瑟所爱的女孩，误以为亚瑟是懦夫。
n. 娱乐；消遣；休养 同义词:entertainment, pleasure, sport, occupation, amusement My only recreation has been watching TV .我惟一的娱乐就是看电视。
vi. 反责；反唇相讥 They criticized him that he often told lies,and he recriminated by saying that anyone living in the world had told lies.他们批评他常常说谎，他反唇相讥说世人都说过谎。

n. 招聘；新兵；新成员 vt. 补充；聘用；征募；使…恢复健康 vi. 复原；征募新兵；得到补充；恢复健康 同义词:hands wanted, big john, supply, to replenish, be cured of, pull round The wartime cabinet first recruited men into the forces from non-essential industries.战时内阁首先从非重点工业中招募人员补充武装力量。
n. 改正，矫正；[化工] 精馏；[电] 整流；[数] 求长 同义词:correction, reform, switching, amendment To review and verify the reports on the rectification of related financial institutions .负责审核有关金融机构整改报告的具体工作。
vt. 改正；精馏；整流 同义词:correct, straighten up You should rectify your error before it is too late.你应当及时改正你的错误。
n. 公正；诚实；清廉 同义词:equity, truth, integrity, honesty, righteousness They worry that he has strayed from the path of fiscal rectitude .他们担心卢拉已经偏离了财政廉洁的轨道。
adj. 斜倚的；休息的 If the axial plane of a fold is essentially horizontal . Then we call it recumbent fold .如果褶皱构造的轴面基本上是水平的，那么我们称它为平卧褶皱。
vi. 恢复，复原；挽回损失 vt. 恢复，使恢复健康 同义词:restore, recover from, restore, repair He has recuperated his health.他已恢复健康。
adj. 复原的；恢复的；有恢复力的 同义词:restoring, rehabilitative Health. You take good care of yourself and have recuperative ( recuperation ).你可以很好的照顾自己，并有很强的恢复能力。
n. 再发生；循环；重现；重新提起 同义词:circulation, revolution, rotation, cycle, round This would prevent a recurrence of the abuses which contributed to the 2008 crash .这将防止在一定程度上导致2008年崩盘危机的滥用行为再现。
n. 拒绝服从的人 adj. 不服从权威的 The recusant electors … cooperated in electing a new senate .叛逆的竞选者……在选举新议员问题上进行了配合。
vt. 赎回；挽回；兑换；履行；补偿；恢复 同义词:fulfill, turn, restore, pay, repair She is going to redeem her diamond ring.她将赎回她的钻石戒指。
n. 赎回；拯救；偿还；实践 同义词:payment, practice, retrieval, salvation, repayment The deal provides a measure of redemption for Ms Gillard .此项协议在一定程度上拯救了吉拉德。
adj. 芬芳的；有…香味的；令人想起…的 同义词:aromatic, odoriferous Their own yard is redolent with lilacs .他们家自己的院子里散发着丁香花的芬芳。

adj. 可怕的；令人敬畏的 同义词:terrible, august, horrible, awesome, fearful The Redoubtable , the Paris , and the Coral Sea , with their larger engines , had moved ahead in the Slipstream wake.勇敢者号，巴黎号，还有珊瑚海号，用它们更大的引擎，在断层空间激发时就跑到了前头。
vi. 有助于；报偿，报应；被转移 vt. 带来 同义词:play to, conduce to, bring along, to bring about Her success will redound to the fame of Beijing University.她的成功将提高北京大学的声誉。
vt. 救济；赔偿；纠正；重新调整 n. 救济；赔偿；矫正 同义词:repair, make good, relief, satisfaction King Arthur tried to redress wrongs in his kingdom.亚瑟王设法纠正他国内的弊端。

n. [计][数] 冗余（等于redundance）；裁员；人浮于事 同义词:layoffs, excessiveness Right now many are facing redundancy , so there may not be any salary coming in anyway – what have you got to lose ?目前许多人面临着裁员，因此不管怎么样，你可能不会有任何薪水进账——那你还能失去什么呢？

adj. 多余的，过剩的；被解雇的，失业的；冗长的，累赘的 同义词:spare, unnecessary, surplus, waste, superfluous Meanwhile , concerns are weighing that the business model may be redundant in the internet age .与此同时，人们日益担忧，在互联网时代，这种商业模式或许是多余的。
vi. 散发；冒烟；放出臭气 n. 臭气；水蒸汽；烟 vt. 散发；用烟熏 同义词:smoke, fume, smoke, malodor, steam, shed His breath reeked of garlic.他满口蒜味。
n. 裁判员；调解人；介绍人 vi. 仲裁；担任裁判 vt. 为…当裁判；调停 同义词:judge, pacifier, go between, reconcile He refereed a basketball game yesterday.他昨天为一场篮球赛作裁判。

n. 精制；文雅；[化工][油气][冶] 提纯 同义词:cultivation, purification Bill Venners : You say , "Don't spoil a perfectly good program by over- embellishment and over- refinement . " How do I know when to stop ?比尔·凡纳斯：你们说：“过度修饰或者过度精炼会毁掉一个足够好的软件。”我怎么才能知道何时该停止？
vt. 反映；反射，照出；反省 vi. 反射，映现；深思 同义词:glass, image, give back, flash back The high wall reflects sounds.这面高墙将声音反射回来。
n. 反射；沉思；映象 同义词:meditation, contemplation In telephony , an interference due to reflection of the transmitted signal from the receiving end .在电话技术中，由于发送信号从接收端反射回来而引起的干扰。
adj. 反射的；反映的；沉思的 同义词:catoptric, repercussive Physicists also think that such clouds would be brighter and more reflective than normal clouds .物理学家们也认为这类云层比起普通云层更明亮、反射性更强。
adj. 难治的；难熔的；不听话的 n. 倔强的人；耐火物质 同义词:intractable, naughty, diehard The reason this matters is that 95% of dissolved organic matter seems refractory .难降解的物质很重要，因为溶化的有机物中95%都难以降解。
vi. 节制，克制；避免；制止 n. 叠句，副歌；重复 同义词:deny oneself, forbear from, repeat, iteration It is difficult for us to refrain from laughing when we are seeing a comedy.在我们观看喜剧时，很难忍住不笑。
n. 辉煌；光辉；灿烂 同义词:flame, resplendency We firmly believe that in the New Year , new hopes and new efforts must help us achieve a new leap and new refulgence !我们坚信，新的一年、新的希翼、新的耕耘，定能实现新的飞跃、新的辉煌！
adj. 辉煌的；灿烂的 同义词:brilliant, splendid, glorious Force the creation of updates , later refulgent , let us work together to have a better tomorrow !力创造更新，更高的辉煌，让我们共同拥有更美好的明天！
vt. 刷新；再磨光 同义词:repolish, do up She refurbished all the pots and pans.她将所有的锅碗瓢盆都擦拭一新。
vt. 反驳，驳斥；驳倒 同义词:disprove, redargue I refuted his claim that he was innocent.他说他清白无辜，我对此进行了驳斥。
adj. 帝王的；王室的；豪华的；庄严的 同义词:household, grand, purple, sacred It was a regal banquet .那是一个豪华的宴会。
vt. 盛情款待 vi. 享用；享受 n. 款待 同义词:do proud, feast, entertainment, treat She regaled the guests with the best dishes she could offer.她以她最拿手的菜款待客人。
vt. 使再生；革新 vi. 再生；革新 adj. 再生的；革新的 同义词:reform, revivify, innovate, innovative, reproductive They were spiritually regenerated by his speech.他们听了他的讲话后在精神上获得了新生。
n. 摄政王；摄政者；州立大学董事会董事；统治者 adj. 摄政的；统治的 同义词:governor, ruler, ruling, dominant That base is strong in Virginia Beach , which is home to Regent University .这一支持在瑞金大学所在地弗吉尼亚比奇非常有影响力。
n. 政权，政体；社会制度；管理体制 同义词:government, power An " axis of evil " branded ripe for " regime change ".“邪恶轴心”“政权更迭”的时机已经成熟。
n. [医] 养生法；生活规则；政体；支配 同义词:government, disposal, ruling A regimen that suits one person will not suit another .适合这个人的饮食制度不一定适合另外一个人。
vt. 把…编成团；严格地管制 n. 团；大量 同义词:lots of, wealth, ocean, sea, mass The students were regimented into large groups for military training.学生们被编成大组进行军事训练。
n. 纪律；系统化；严格控制；团的编制 同义词:discipline, systematization We also examine about the regimentation and designation of slaves in Chin and Han dynasties .此外，第一章也系统论述了秦汉奴婢的类别、名称等问题。
adj. 回归的；后退的；退化的 同义词:degenerative, vestigial This method of portrayal emphasizes both the regressive nature and the time equivalence .这种图示方法既强调了海退性质也强调了同时性。
vt. 调节，规定；控制；校准；有系统的管理 同义词:possess, define, contain, manage, state We must try our best to regulate our expenditure.我们必须尽力控制开支。

n. 管理；规则；校准 adj. 规定的；平常的 同义词:governance, administration, management, supervision, control, specified, stated, usual, prescribed, ordinary As in mature markets , regulation plays a big role .与成熟市场一样，制度发挥着重大作用。
vi. 回流；回涌；反胃；反刍 vt. 使回流；使回涌；使反刍 同义词:back flow, inverse flow The water regurgitated as soon as the pump stopped.水泵一停，水马上就向回流。
vt. 使康复；使恢复名誉；使恢复原状 vi. 复兴；复权；恢复正常生活 同义词:repristinate, unmake, revive He was set free and rehabilitated as chief engineer.他被释放并恢复总工程师职务。
vt. 重讲；重新处理 n. 改变；略加修改的老作品 同义词:restate, modification, changing, alteration The spokesman has just rehashed the speech of the president.这位发言人只是稍加改动地又重复了一遍总统的演说词。
n. 排演；预演；练习；训练；叙述 同义词:relation, statement, training, discipline, practice It seemed like rehearsal of her own life , terrible in its vividness .它就象是她自己一生的一次排演，生动逼真得可怕。
vi. 统治；支配；盛行；君临 n. 统治；统治时期；支配 同义词:predominate over, to rule, governance, disposal, rule, dominance The Queen of Britain reigns, but she does not rule or govern.英国女王是国家元首，但不治国事。
vt. 偿还；赔偿 同义词:replace, tender Tell me what you have spent and I will reimburse you.告诉我你花了哪些费用，以便我还给你。
n. 退还，偿还；赔偿 同义词:satisfaction, payment, repayment Tell me what you have spent and I will reimburse you.告诉我你花了哪些费用，以便我还给你。
n. 缰绳；驾驭；统治；支配 vt. 控制；驾驭；勒住 vi. 勒住马 同义词:governance, disposal, rule, trace, possess, contain, regulate, bit, bottle They reined their horses to the left.他们勒马向左行去。
vt. 使转世；使转世化身 adj. 转世化身的 He believed he might be reincarnated as a woman.他相信他死后可能转世变为妇人。
n. 再生；化身 同义词:picture, regeneration, breeding, pink, rebirth One step in this self- realization might be the reality of Reincarnation .这自我实现的一步也许就是再生的现实。
vt. 加强，加固；强化；补充 vi. 求援；得到增援；给予更多的支持 n. 加强；加固物；加固材料 同义词:enhance, cement, muscle, supply, build up, strengthening, armoure The regular troops need to be reinforced.正规部队将需要增援。
vt. 使恢复；使复原 同义词:bring around The company reinstated him as chief engineer.该公司恢复了他的总工程师职务。
vt. 重申；反复地做 同义词:ingeminate, restate He reiterated the importance of good health in his speech.他在讲话中一再重申健康的重要性。
vi. 高兴；庆祝 vt. 使高兴 同义词:pleasure, be pleased, glad, pleasure, satisfy He often rejoices at other people's misfortunes.他常常对别人幸灾乐祸。
n. 高兴；欣喜；庆祝 v. 使欣喜（rejoice的ing形式）；感到高兴 同义词:festival, joy, celebration He often rejoices at other people's misfortunes.他常常对别人幸灾乐祸。
vi. 答辩；回答；重新聚合 vt. 再加入；使…再结合；再回答 同义词:reply, respond, answer I rejoined the company in 1999.我在1999年又重返连队。
n. 反驳；回答；（被告的）[法] 第二次答辩 同义词:contradiction, response, reply, answer "Dat Buck two devils rejoinder .巴克抵得上两个恶鬼哩。
vt. 使年轻；使更新；使恢复精神；使复原 vi. 复原；变年轻 同义词:renew, reinstate, be cured of, pull round He tried to rejuvenate himself by performing physical exercises each day.他试图每天进行体育锻炼以使自己返老还童。
vi. 重新点燃 vt. 重新点燃；再点火 同义词:reignite He blew hard on the ashes to rekindle the fire.他用力吹灰烬以便使火复燃。
vi. 故态复萌；旧病复发；再度堕落；再陷邪道 n. 复发，再发；故态复萌；回复原状 同义词:recrudescency, palindromia He relapsed into a thoughtful mood at once.他立刻又陷入沉思中。
n. 放松；缓和；消遣 同义词:entertainment, occupation, recreation Relaxation methods , such as meditation , are useful ways to bring your emotions into balance .放松的方法，例如：沉思，是有用的方法来让你的感情出于平衡。
vt. 把降低到；归入；提交 同义词:put in, hand in He has been relegated to the position of an assistant coach.他已经被降到助理教练的地位。
vi. 变温和，变宽厚；减弱；缓和 vt. 使变温和；减轻 v. 再借给（relend的过去分词） 同义词:fall, lower, moderate, allay She relented when she saw her husband bursting into tears.看见丈夫一哭，她的心就软了。
adj. 无情的；残酷的；不间断的 同义词:cruel, iron, ongoing, ruthless The second problem relates to the firm's relentless expansion .第二大失误则与公司无止尽的扩张有关。
n. 关联；适当；中肯 同义词:relationship, correlation, fitness, associations Companies try to pick partners with relevance to their business.企业在尽力选择同自身相关的组织作为合作伙伴。
n. 信赖；信心；受信赖的人或物 同义词:belief, confidence, trust, hope Yet there was a common ingredient in most failures : an over- reliance on wholesale borrowing .但是大部分银行的倒闭有一点共因：过度依赖大规模贷款。
n. 遗迹，遗物；废墟；纪念物 同义词:remain, vestage But burial rites in most of the modern world remain an expensive relic of 19th - century habit .丧葬仪式依旧袭19世纪习俗遗风，成本高昂。
n. 寡妇；残余物，残余体；未亡人 同义词:widow lady, scrap Objective : observe the curative effect and mechanism of inflammation of gastric relict treated with differential diagnosis.目的：观察并探讨残胃炎中医辨证论治的疗效与机制。
vt. 放弃；放手；让渡 同义词:desert, yield, quit She relinquished her claim to the property.她放弃了对财产的要求。
n. 滋味；风味；食欲；开胃小菜；含义 vt. 品味；喜爱；给…加佐料 vi. 有特定意味；味道可口 同义词:flavor, meaning, import, appetite, enjoy, favour She won't relish having to do the household chores every day.她不喜欢每天料理家务。

n. [数] 余数，残余；剩余物；其余的人 adj. 剩余的；吃剩的 vt. 廉价出售；削价出售 vi. 廉价出售；削价出售 同义词:leaving, arithmetical compliment, surplus, residual, odd, bargain sale, undercut, bargain sale The unsalable books are to be remaindered next week.滞销书将于下周削价出售。
n. 残余；遗骸 同义词:leaving, vestige It remains green during the cold , dark months of winter in the northern part of the world .它即使在在世界的北部经历寒冷黑暗的冬天几个月也能保持绿色。
adj. 可治疗的；可矫正的；可补救的 同义词:curable, rectifiable remediable problems remediable setback; not a crime but only a remediable blunder .可以补救的问题；可治愈的疾病；不是犯罪只是一个可以挽救的失误。
vt. 追忆说 vi. 回忆 同义词:live over, run back She likes to reminisce about her childhood.她喜欢回忆她的童年时代。
n. 回忆；怀旧；引起联想的相似事物 同义词:memory, recall William did not share his brother 's passion for reminiscence .威利并没有分享弟弟回忆往事的幽思。
adj. 怠慢的；迟缓的；不小心的 同义词:inattentive, logy The owner of the stolen car was himself remiss . He left the keys the vehicle.被盗骑车的主人自己也有责任，他把车钥匙丢在车上了。
n. 缓解；宽恕；豁免 同义词:forgiveness, exemption Then you can then look ahead to the hope of remission and recovery .然后你计划未来，希望病情缓解和康复。
vt. 宽恕；免除；减轻；传送；使恢复原状 vi. 汇款；缓和 n. 移交的事物 同义词:discharge, forgive, moderate, cash transfer, tone down His sentence of death was remitted by the government in 1999.他的死刑于1999年被政府赦免。
n. 汇款；汇寄之款；汇款额 Sure . Now here is the exchange memo and the application form for remittance .可以。好，请您填写兑换水单和汇款申请表。
n. 弛张热 adj. 间歇性的；忽轻忽重的 同义词:spasmic Two good shots, remittent , drawing wool collects deep feeling .两根棒针，上上下下，牵引毛线汇成深情。
n. 剩余 adj. 剩余的 同义词:surplus, residual, spare, remaining, surplus, residual, odd He has come to muster the beaten remnant soldiers.他前来收拾这些残兵败将。
vt. 改造；改变；改型 同义词:influence, fashion, shift, vary The army was remodeled last year.军队去年进行了改编。
n. 抗议；规劝；谏书 同义词:protest, obtestation I eschewed upbraiding , I curtailed remonstrance .我避免责备，少作规劝。
vt. 责备，告诫；抗议；表示异议 vi. 抗议，反对；进谏；告诫 同义词:correct, blame for, object, protest against sth He remonstrated to his wife that she was too careless.他向他的妻子规劝说，她太马虎了。
n. 懊悔；同情 同义词:feeling, compassion, sorrow, sympathy, pity FOR seasoned shoppers , " buyer 's remorse " is a familiar feeling .对购物的老手而言，”买了就后悔”是经常会有的感觉。
vt. 酬劳；给与报酬；赔偿 同义词:make good, indemnify All the workers will be remunerated for their services at the exhibition.在展览会上工作的所有人员都将得到报酬。
adj. 有利可图的；有报酬的；合算的 同义词:economical, profitable, paying, lucrative Is it necessary to decide remunerative work and meaningful work?是不是一定要在高回报的工作与有意义的生活中间做一个选择呢？
n. 新生；再生；复活 同义词:reconstruction, fresh, revival, renewal The second big obstacle that a nuclear renaissance faces is the problem of waste management .核能工业复兴所面临的第二大难题，就是核废料管理的问题。
adj. [解剖] 肾脏的，[解剖] 肾的 同义词:nephritic The units with no spontaneous discharge were activated by renal artery occlusion .夹闭肾动脉可诱发无自发活动的肾传入神经单位的放电活动。
adj. 新生的，复活的；复兴的 同义词:neonatal, newborn renascent oxygen is consumed for oxidizing metal anode to form metal oxide film .当形成足够厚的氧化膜后，阳极的氧化速度减慢，阳极表面才析出氧气。
vt. 撕碎；分裂；强夺 vi. 将……撕开；使……分离 同义词:rip up, tear to pieces Several wolves were rending a lamb to pieces.几条狼正在把一只羊撕扯成碎块。
vt. 致使；提出；实施；着色；以…回报 vi. 给予补偿 n. 打底；交纳；粉刷 同义词:introduce, present, prefer, file, advance, cosmetic brush He rendered a report to the commander-in-chief.他向总司令作了汇报。

n. 翻译；表现；表演；描写；打底；（建筑物等）透视图 vt. 致使；表演；打底（render的ing形式） vi. 给予补偿（rendr的ing形式） 同义词:translation, interpretation, description, performance, representation Revenue is the economic resources flowing into a business as a result of rendering goods sold and services during a given accounting period .收入是指在一个特定的会计期间由于销售商品和提供劳务而流入企业的经济资源。
n. 约会；约会地点；集结地 vi. 会合；约会 vt. 在指定地点与…相会 同义词:date, engagement, link up, make an appointment We'll rendezvous at the railway station tomorrow afternoon.我们明天下午在火车站会合。

n. 叛徒；变节者；脱党者 vi. 背叛；脱离 adj. 叛徒的；背弃的；脱离的 同义词:rat, traitor, tergiversate, turn one's coat, diastatic Besides all, he had an overseer -a great, tall , slab-side, two- renegade son of Vermont .除此之外，他还有一个监工--此人生得身材魁梧，腰细拳粗，是你们佛蒙特人的一个不肖子孙。
vi. 食言；违例出牌 vt. 否认 n. 出牌违例 同义词:eat his words, break one's promise, deny, disown He has never reneged on a promise.他从来不食言。
vt. 宣布放弃；与…断绝关系；垫牌 vi. 放弃权利；垫牌 n. 垫牌 同义词:break up with, finish with She renounced her claim to the property.她声明放弃她的财产权。
n. 声誉；名望 vt. 使有声望 同义词:prestige, fame He won renown as a pianist .他赢得钢琴家的声誉。

adj. 著名的；有声望的 v. 使有声誉（renown的过去分词） 同义词:famous, noted, distinguished, celebrated, famed ETON COLLEGE, the school that taught David Cameron , the Conservative leader , is renowned for its excellence .培养了保守党领导人戴维卡梅伦的伊顿公学教学成绩卓著。
n. 租金 vt. 出租；租用；租借 vi. 租；出租 同义词:letting, hire, lease out, hire out, lease out, hire out They want to rent a house by the side of the river.他们想在河边租一所房子。
n. 放弃；脱离关系；拒绝承认；抛弃；弃权 同义词:quitting, rejection Total dedication to God , renunciation of possessions , the family .对神完全忠诚，出家意味着抛弃全部的财产，还有家人。
adj. 可修缮的；可补偿的；可挽回的 同义词:compensable, reimbursable In one marriage , if one betrayed another in physical body , it is still reparable ;一段婚姻中，如果一方肉体背叛了，那还有挽回的余地；
n. 赔偿；修理；赔款 同义词:satisfaction, renovation He had to make reparation from his own property .他必须用其财产进行赔偿。
n. 机敏的应答；妙语；巧辩 同义词:punch line, bon mot Repartee is what you wish you 'd say.所谓妙语，就是你会说“我当时也那么讲就好了”的话。
v. 遣返 n. 被遣返回国者 The Japanese prisoners of war were repatriated to their homeland after the war.日本战俘于战后被遣返回国。
vt. 废除；撤销；废止；放弃；否定 n. 废除；撤销 同义词:yield, desert, negative, abolish, abolition, destoolment He believes that death penalty will be repealed sooner or later.他相信死刑早晚会被废除。
vt. 击退；抵制；使厌恶；使不愉快 同义词:refuse, roll back We repelled the enemy from the shores after a long hard struggle.经过长时间的艰苦战斗，我们将敌人从海岸击退。

adj. 排斥的；防水的；弹回的；令人讨厌的 n. 防护剂；防水布；排斥力 同义词:terrible, repulsive, protective agent, tarp In America socialism was still a " fresh " idea —a cherished dream for some ; a repellent spectre for others .在美国，社会主义仍是个“新鲜”的主张----是某人些珍爱的梦想，也是其他人挥之不去的梦魇。
vi. 后悔；忏悔 vt. 后悔；对…感到后悔 adj. [植] 匍匐生根的；[动] 爬行的 同义词:rue, regret, acrawl, creepy He has done wrong but repented.他做错了事，但已悔悟。
n. 悔改；后悔 同义词:penitence, compunction repentance is seldom true .事后忏悔很少是真实的。
adj. 悔改的；后悔的 同义词:resipiscent, regretful Note the sincerity of our repentant tears ; mingle in our simple sacrifice .注意我们真诚悔改的眼泪，和我们一同作纯朴的奉献吧。
n. 反响；弹回；反射；浮动诊胎法 同义词:reflection, resonance But the decisions taken in politics are unique in their reach and repercussion .然而在轻人们的影响和做出回应的范围内，他们在政治上作出的决定是其独特的。
n. 全部节目；计算机指令系统；（美）某人或机器的全部技能 They can all become part of the leader 's repertoire .这些风格都可能成为领导人傍身之技的一部分。
vi. 抱怨；不满 同义词:beef about, rail against It does no good for you to repine at your unhappy lot.你埋怨自己命苦是没有用的。

n. 更换；复位；代替者；补充兵员 同义词:restoration, substitute First rejecting negotiations , US finally agreed to a compromise : a two -year plan to develop a replacement for the 1997 Kyoto Protocol .在最先拒绝谈判之后，美国最终同意让步：发展一份可以替代1997年京都议定书的两年计划。
vt. 补充，再装满；把…装满；给…添加燃料 同义词:supply, to supplement Let me replenish your glass with some more wine.让我给你杯子里再添点葡萄酒。
adj. 充满的；装满的 n. [昆] 贮蜜蚁 同义词:filled, full, consumed That is the biggest task — not least because the euro 's history replete with failed attempts at doing so.那是很艰巨的任务，特别是因为欧洲的历史上充满了这种做法失败的历史记录。
n. 充满，饱满；饱食 同义词:filled with, fullness A baby vomits milk repletion .婴儿吃饱会吐奶。
n. 复制品，复制物 同义词:reproduction, ectype So do workshops that turn replica guns into real ones and sell them to street gangs .将模型枪改造成真枪并出售给街头黑帮的工厂作坊，也给了顾客他们想要的东西。
vt. 复制；折叠 vi. 重复；折转 adj. 复制的；折叠的 n. 复制品；八音阶间隔的反覆音 同义词:repeat, fold, read back, hammer, scored, reproductive, reproduction, ectype a replicated petal翻折的花瓣
n. 休息；睡眠；静止 vt. 使休息；寄托于 vi. 休息；座落；长眠；依靠；静卧；建立于 同义词:break, rest, sleep, rest, relax, relax, trust After lunch he reposed on the couch.午饭后他躺在长沙发上休息。
n. 贮藏室，仓库；知识库；智囊团 同义词:warehouse, stockroom This book is a repository of useful information .这本书里蕴含着许多有用的知识。
vt. 收回；取复；重新获得 同义词:recover, withdraw, resume She couldn't meet the payments,so they repossessed the car.她付不出分期付款，所以他们把汽车收回去了。
vt. 申斥；指责 n. 责备 同义词:charge, come down on, blame, thumbs-down We seriously reprehended his taking risks.对他的冒险行动我们严肃地进行了批评。
adj. 应斥责的；应该谴责的 Poor judgment is reprehensible , but not illegal .判断力低下是要受到谴责，不过构不成违法。
vt. 抑制；镇压（叛乱等）；约束 vi. 抑制；镇压 同义词:restrict, control, stay, choke back, to suppress He could hardly repress his tears.他的眼泪都忍不住快要流下来了。
adj. 镇压的；压抑的；抑制的 同义词:depressing, suppressive The US plans to freeze the financial assets of additional members of the repressive military regime .美国计划冻结该强制性军事政权附属成员的金融资产。
vt. 缓期执行；暂时解救 n. 暂缓；缓刑 同义词:stay of execution, probation, suspended sentence The prisoner condemned to death was reprieved for two years.判死刑的罪犯被缓刑两年执行。
n. 谴责；训斥；申诉 vt. 谴责；训斥；责难 同义词:hell, condemnation, condemn, denounce His parents will reprimand him when he shows them his report card.当他把分数单交给父母亲看时，他们将严厉申斥他。
n. 报复（行为）；报复性劫掠 同义词:retaliation, revenge Rumour had it (that) he was killed in a reprisal raid in the local area .谣传他在当地的一次报复性袭击中丢了命。
n. 责备；耻辱 vt. 责备；申斥 同义词:blame, thumbs-down, blame for, talk to The manager reproached the new salesgirl for her carelessness.经理斥责新来的女售货员工作上粗心大意。
v. 非难；拒绝；斥责 adj. 邪恶的；堕落的 n. 恶棍，无赖 同义词:turn down, pass up, evil, fallen, ill, black, ugly, tough, cad, varlet Such cramming method of teaching is now severely reprobated.这种填鸭式的教学法现在受到严厉的谴责。

n. 繁殖，生殖；复制；复制品 同义词:generation, breeding, propagation, get As a father of six , he might have added something about women 's role in the reproduction of the species .作为六个孩子的父亲，他也许还对女人在人类繁衍中起的作用说了些别的什么。
n. 责备；谴责 同义词:blame, thumbs-down The warmth of her smile belied the reproof .她亲切的笑容表明她的斥责并非真的。
vt. 责骂；谴责；非难 vi. 责备；指责；非难 同义词:rate, hop on, blame for, talk to The teacher reproved him for his coming late again.老师责备他不该再次迟到。
adj. 爬虫类的；卑鄙的 n. 爬虫类动物 同义词:poor, mean, base, dirty Being from Orion do Zetas contain DNA from the Reptilian race?齐塔人是从猎户座而来，DNA来自爬虫族吗？
vt. 拒绝；否定；批判；与…断绝关系；拒付 同义词:negative, refuse, deny She repudiated her only daughter.她与她的独生女儿断绝了母女关系。
n. 反感；厌恶；不一致，抵触 同义词:hate, variance He had a repugnance of all things to do with commerce .他厌恶与商业有关的一切事务。
adj. 讨厌的；矛盾的；敌对的 同义词:evil, adverse, rank, unpleasant, opposed The mere idea of stealing had been repugnant .光是偷盗这种想法就很令人反感。
vt. 拒绝；驱逐；憎恶 n. 拒绝；击退 同义词:refuse, negative, rejection, refusal They repulsed their enemy from the shores after a long hard struggle.经过长时间的艰苦战斗，他们终于把敌人从海岸上赶走。
adj. 排斥的；令人厌恶的；击退的；冷淡的 同义词:cold, ugly Dark energy is a repulsive force opposing gravity . It is thought to influence how dark matter clumps together .暗能量是与引力相反的一种斥力。有人认为它们影响着暗物质如何聚集。
adj. 声誉好的；受尊敬的；卓越的 同义词:remarkable, excellent, prominent, respected They are all intelligent , reputable men and all judges of good wine .他们都是聪明有为，声名卓著的人物和评品好酒的行家。
n. 名声，名誉；声望 同义词:credit, name, fame, celebrity, prestige Typical of the Scotch , Burns had a reputation for being funny and charming .彭斯是一名典型的苏格兰人，以有趣和有魅力而闻名。
n. 安魂曲；追思弥撒 Behind me , the Washington Symphony Orchestra is playing Mozart's Requiem .在我后面，华盛顿交响乐团演奏的就是莫扎特的挽歌。
adj. 必备的，必不可少的；需要的 n. 必需品 同义词:needed, necessity, want Mobs breed a requisite measure of complexity for emergent entities.群体产生出一种衡量突现事物复杂性的需求。
n. 征用；要求；申请书；引渡要求 vt. 征用；申请领取 同义词:do, desire, need, demand, commandeer, expropriate The local government requisitioned the peasants' horses for the troops.地方政府为部队征用农民的马匹。
n. 报答；偿还；报仇 同义词:payment, reward, return, repayment To The Coastlands He Will Render Requital .祂将针对海岸给予报复。
vt. 报答，回报；酬谢 同义词:return, render back to requite good with evil以怨报德
vi. 解除；废除；撤回 同义词:release from, want out The agreement on cultural cooperation between the two countries was rescinded on 30 April, 2002.两国间的文化合作协定于2002年4月30日废除。
n. 法令；布告；抄件 同义词:notice, act, ordinance, edict Puyi , who is just like an outcast, read out the abdicate rescript .如同丧家之犬的溥仪也随之神情沮丧地宣读了退位主诏书。

n. 相似；相似之处；相似物；肖像 同义词:image, conformity, likeness It is always going to be an approximate picture but he insists there is a " strong resemblance " with what happens in reality .这永远只会是一种大致的描述，但他坚称这与实际情况“非常相似”。
vt. 怨恨；愤恨；厌恶 同义词:hate, be down on His father seems to resent my being here.我呆在这里他的父亲似乎不大高兴。
n. 愤恨，怨恨 同义词:spite, hatred But they will offer more targets for insurgents to shoot at , and reinforce many Iraqis ' resentment of the occupation .而美军将给叛乱分子提供更多打击目标，也将增强许多伊拉克人对美军占领的怨恨。
n. 储备，储存；自然保护区；预备队；[金融] 储备金 vt. 储备；保留；预约 vi. 预订 同义词:store, repertory, stay at, save from, book for, make reservation You must reserve your strength for the tennis final.你必须为网球决赛保存力量。
adj. 保留的，预订的；缄默的，冷淡的；包租的 v. 保留（reserve的过去分词） 同义词:cold, saving, retained You must reserve your strength for the tennis final.你必须为网球决赛保存力量。
vt. 重新洗牌；改组；重作安排 n. 重新洗牌；改组 同义词:recompose, restructuring, reorganization The cabinet has been reshuffled recently.内阁最近进行了改组。
n. 住宅，住处；居住 同义词:home, accommodation This is my temporary residence .这是我临时的住处。

n. 剩余；残渣 adj. 剩余的；残留的 同义词:surplus, spare, remaining, surplus, odd In the end , no one could tell whether an experimental result was caused by those residual movements or the superimposed microsaccades .到后来，没有人能确定那些实验结果是由残留的眼球运动，还是由补加回去的微颤动所造成。
n. 残渣；剩余；滤渣 同义词:surplus, spare No poisonous residue after disinfection , safe and reliable .消毒后无任何毒害残留物，安全可靠。
n. 辞职；放弃；辞职书；顺从 同义词:compliance, demission His resignation was choreographed , and he was swiftly re- elected as party chairman .他的辞职是被编排过的，并且他很快被重新选为党主席。
adj. 顺从的；已辞职的；己放弃的 v. 辞职；顺从（resign的过去分词） 同义词:compliant, obedient He resigned his claim to the copyright .他放弃了对版权的权利要求。
n. 恢复力；弹力；顺应力 同义词:elasticity, elastic force It also reflects the resilience of domestic demand .调整过程也反映出国内需求的弹性。
n. [力] 共振；共鸣；反响 同义词:sympathetic vibration, reflections Tuning a radio or television receiver is an example of electrical resonance .调谐收音机或电视接收机是电共振的例子。
adj. 洪亮的，共振的；共鸣的 同义词:rotund, syntonous The outcome of these resonant perturbations varies .这些共振微扰的效果不一。

n. 凭借，手段；度假胜地；常去之地 vi. 求助，诉诸；常去；采取某手段或方法 同义词:instrument, shift, road, tool, implement, appeal, ask for help Many teachers and students resort to Beidaihe beach in the summer vacation.很多教师和学生在暑假中去北戴河海滨。
n. 尊敬的人；势利的人 Weather is respecter of politics .天气无关政治。
adj. 分别的，各自的 同义词:several, each The three methods described above have their respective merits .上述的三个方法都有它们各自的优点。
n. 呼吸；呼吸作用 同义词:breath, wind If the person is not breathing , try to find someone nearby who is able to do artificial respiration until help gets there .如果那个人没呼吸，试着在附近寻找会做人工呼吸的人，一直到援助到达。
n. 缓解；暂缓；暂时的休息；缓期执行 vt. 使缓解；使暂缓；使延期；缓期执行 同义词:remission, stay of execution to respite a sentence缓期执行判决
n. 辉煌；灿烂 同义词:refulgence, effulgence At the end , Late Empire had achieved a resplendence and wealth that could scarcely be surpassed .直到最后，“晚期帝国风格”就其富丽堂皇而论已成为难以超越的了。
adj. 光辉的；华丽的 同义词:magnificent, brave, gorgeous Palace really looks resplendent and magnificent .布达拉宫看上去真是宏伟辉煌。
adj. 回答的；应答的 n. [法] 被告；应答者 同义词:answering, accused person, indictee respondent was not acting bona fide .被告的行为不真诚。
adj. 响应的；应答的；回答的 同义词:answering But what if one side is a responsive mirror , just as the chameleon is, in part reflecting , in part generating ?那么，如果其中一面镜子具备了变色龙似的反应功能，既能反映又能生成图像会如何呢？

n. 恢复；赔偿；归还 同义词:recovery, satisfaction, retrieval, renewal, return The Italians had pushed for the restitution of 46 items , while the Getty had earlier offered just 26 .意大利政府一直催促博物馆归还其46件文物，可博物馆却只愿意还26件。
adj. 倔强的；难驾御的；不安宁的 同义词:obstinate, fractious When the singer was late , the audience grew restive .歌手迟迟不出场，听众变得不耐烦了。
n. [药] 恢复药，滋补剂 adj. 滋补的，有助于复元的；恢复健康的 同义词:tonic This my friends , is the wonderful world of Restorative Yoga .朋友们，这是一个很棒的养生瑜伽世界。
vt. 抑制，控制；约束；制止 同义词:possess, regulate, contain, manage, bottle She was so angry that she could hardly restrain herself.她气得几乎控制不了自己。

n. 抑制，克制；约束 同义词:checking, control, suppression, inhibition, constraint A third person in the house had been a restraint , and the moments alone with her husband had gained a sweetness by their comparative rarity .当时这屋子里的第三者曾经是他们的一种束缚，而她和她丈夫单独在一起的时刻能得到一种稀有的愉快。
n. [管理] 履历；个人简历；摘要 vt. 重新开始；重新获得 vi. 再开始 同义词:bio, abstract, brief, summary, record, recover, start over Will you please resume your seat?请您重新坐下，好吗?

n. 恢复；重新开始；取回；重获；恢复硬币支付 同义词:recovery, restoration, retrieval, renewal, comeback He welcomed the resumption last month of talks about migration , suspended under George Bush .他欢迎恢复上月关于移民的会谈，乔治•布什卸任时留下的问题。
n. 复活；再现；再起 同义词:revival, regenesis Diplomats hope to reinforce this co -operation before the bug 's expected resurgence in the autumn .外交官们希望在今年秋天病毒可能卷土重来之前巩固这种合作关系。
adj. 复活的；复苏的 n. 复活者 同义词:revivatory, redivious Then in the Pacific , looking also at free - world countries , we have a resurgent Japan .然后在太平洋，也来看看自由世界的国家，我们有一个复兴的日本。
vt. 使复活；复兴；挖出 vi. 复活 同义词:raise to life, renew, come back to life again, reflourish It is said that this medicine can resurrect the dead.据说这种药能起死回生。
n. 复活；恢复；复兴 同义词:recovery, restoration, retrieval, renewal, revival One that most people know is the story of Jesus' death and resurrection .大多人所知道的故事便是耶稣的死亡及复活。
vt. 使复苏；使复兴 vi. 恢复；复兴 同义词:reinvigorate, restore, recover from They resuscitated an old man who fell in a faint.他们使一位晕倒的老人苏醒过来。
vt. 零售；转述 vi. 零售 n. 零售 adv. 以零售方式 adj. 零售的 同义词:sell-through, resale This kind of chocolate is retailed at one pound a kilo.这种巧克力糖零售每公斤一英镑。
n. 零售商；传播的人 同义词:bania, tradesman A small retailer should compare prices with a similar store .一个小的零售商应与类似的商店比较价格。
vi. 报复；回敬 vt. 报复 同义词:get back on, get even with, get back on, get even with, get back at If you are rude to me, I shall retaliate with equal rudeness.如果你对我无礼，我就以同样的无礼予以回敬。
vt. 延迟；阻止；妨碍；使减速 vi. 减慢；受到阻滞 n. 延迟；阻止 同义词:dispute, let, stem, block, prevention, check, detention Shortage of labour power retarded our economic development.缺乏劳动力使我们的经济发展速度减慢。
adj. 智力迟钝的；发展迟缓的 同义词:backward The children 's emotional development had been retarded by traumatic experiences .孩子们的感情发育过程因精神创伤而受到阻碍。
n. 保留；扣留，滞留；记忆力；闭尿 同义词:memory, preservation, mind, hold, reservation The bonuses were retention payments .红利是保留性支付。
adj. 保持的；记性好的 So , the prosthodontic treatment for severe attritted dentition with retentive telescopic denture was suggested .因此以双重冠义齿做为牙齿严重磨耗病患之膺复治疗方式是可行的。
adj. 沉默的；有保留的；谨慎的 同义词:silent, cautious, mum Interviewers had often tried to sound him out on that war ; he was surprisingly reticent .访谈者常常试探他对这场战争的态度，他却一反常态，保持了沉默。
n. 网状，网状物；网目；网状组织 同义词:network, reseau A new type reticulation positive grid was studied.介绍了一种新型立体网状正极板栅。
n. 随行人员；扈从 同义词:lictor He strode past with his retinue of aides.他与他的随员们大步走了过去。
adj. 退休的；不善社交的；过隐居生活的 v. 退休（retire的ing形式） 同义词:emeritus, on the beach According to the new regulations,mining engineers retire at the age of fifty-five.按照新规定，采矿工程师五十五岁退休。
n. 反驳，顶嘴；曲颈瓶 vt. 反驳，反击 vi. 反驳，回嘴 同义词:contradiction, oppugnation, refute, disprove, talk back, answer sb. back He retorted that I was to blame.他反驳说这事全赖我。
vt. 追溯；折回；重描 同义词:go back, trace back They retraced their steps to where they started.他们顺原路又折回到他们出发的地点。
vt. 缩回；缩进；取消 vi. 缩回；缩进；撤消 n. 收缩核 同义词:recall, abolish, repeal rescission, take back The pilot found that the undercarriage could not be retracted.驾驶员发现飞机的起落架不能缩回。
n. 撤退；休息寓所；撤退 vi. 撤退；退避；向后倾 vt. 退（棋）；使后退 同义词:withdrawal, pullback, withdraw, bug out The enemy was forced to retreat from the city.敌人被迫撤出这个城市。
vt. 删除；减少；紧缩开支 vi. 节省；紧缩 同义词:delete from, expurgate, save, economize on They must retrench their expenditure for the purpose of making up the deficit.为了弥补赤字，他们必须压缩开支。
n. 报应；惩罚；报答；报偿 同义词:punishment, rod, payment, discipline, reward Compared with the S days , in other words , the level of retribution so far seems almost non -existent.换言之，与储贷危机时期相比，迄今的惩罚力度似乎可以忽略不计。
adj. 报应的；惩罚的 同义词:punitory, disciplinal He holds retributive punishment , while he is not against the punishment which had other aims .他主张报应刑，但不反对刑罚另有目的。
n. 检索；恢复；取回；拯救 同义词:recovery, restoration, renewal, salvation As a customer, you identify the book you want by using only the retrieval system .作为一个读者，你通过使用检索系统确定自己想要的书。
vt. [计] 检索；恢复；重新得到 vi. 找回猎物 n. [计] 检索；恢复，取回 同义词:restore, repair, recovery, restoration, renewal He retrieved the important letter from the waste paper basket.他从废纸篓里找回了那封重要的信。
adj. 倒退的；退化的；次序颠倒的 vi. 逆行；倒退；退步 vt. 使倒退 adv. 倒退地；向后地 同义词:reversionary, degenerative, reverse, stem, backward, sternforemost The troops retrograded from the front rapidly.部队迅速从前线撤退。
vi. 倒退，退化 同义词:reverse, step backward otherwise the relations will be undermined , become stagnant or even retrogress .背离和违反这个政治基础，中日关系就会受损，就会停滞甚至倒退。

n. 回顾，追溯 vi. 回顾，追溯；回想 vt. 回顾；追忆 同义词:review, recalling, to look back, look back on, to look back, look back on retrospect , it was right to let Lehman go, because it caused such a disaster .回过头看，让雷曼破产是对的，因为它引发了一场如此严重的灾难。

adj. 回顾的；怀旧的；可追溯的 n. 回顾展 同义词:nostalgic, reminiscent One quibble is that many investigations of genetics and behaviour have relied on participants' retrospective reports of their earlier psychological states , which are often inaccurate .一种批评的说辞认为与基因和行为相关的许多科学研究依赖于参与者对他们过去心理状态的回顾报告——这经常是不精确的。
vt. 修补；翻新；修改 n. 改进；换新鞋面 同义词:modify, piece up, improvement, reforming, enrichment to revamp an old motorcycle把旧摩托车拆修翻新
n. 启示；揭露；出乎意料的事；被揭露的真相 同义词:exposure, message But for many she was a revelation .但对许多人而言，她是出人意料的。
n. 狂欢；欢宴 同义词:orgy, whoop-de-do Below the sound of revelry continued .楼下寻欢作乐的声音不断传来。
n. 报复；复仇 vt. 报复；替…报仇；洗雪 vi. 报仇；雪耻 同义词:vengeance, retaliation, revanche, get back on, get even with, right a wrong He revenged the murder of his father.他报了杀父之仇。
n. 税收，国家的收入；收益 同义词:taxes, income, proceeds, yield Being the company 's main source of revenue , critics say , it is hardly a model of openness and transparency .批评者说，作为公司的主要收入来源，它很难被视为一个公开和透明度的模型。
adj. 回响的；反射的；起回声的 同义词:reflected, catoptric a reverberant room ; reverberant booms of cannon .有回响的房间；回荡着隆隆的炮声。
vt. 使回响；使反射；使弹回 vi. 回响；反响；弹回；不断发生后效 adj. 回响的；反射的 同义词:rebound, ring, sound, reflected, catoptric The entire valley reverberated with the sound of the temple bells.整个山谷回荡着庙宇的钟声。
n. 崇敬；尊严；敬礼 vt. 敬畏；尊敬 同义词:dignity, sanctity, honor, fear, regard, worship The name of Albert Einstein is still reverenced by the scientists all over the world.爱因斯坦的名字仍然受到世界各地科学家的崇敬。
adj. 虔诚的；恭敬的；尊敬的 同义词:religious, good, dear She said the word artist with a gentle , understanding , reverent smile .她说作家一词时面带高雅，理解和虔诚的微笑。
n. 幻想；沉思；幻想曲 同义词:reflection, fancy, fantasy, meditation Autumn is a season for people to generate infinite reverie .秋天是一个让人产生无限遐想的季节。

n. 背面；相反；倒退；失败 vt. 颠倒；倒转 adj. 反面的；颠倒的；[篮球]反身的 vi. 倒退；[桥牌]逆叫 同义词:failure, loss, contrary, losing, defeat, bottom up, head over heels, upside-down, perversive, retrogress, step backward Please reverse your examination paper.请把试卷翻过来。
n. 逆转；回复；归还；[遗] 隔代遗传；[法] 继承权 同义词:feedback, heritage, succession, restoration, return The reversion frequency is increased by the addition of mutagents .逆转的频率靠加入诱发变因素而增加。
vt. 辱骂；斥责 vi. 辱骂；谩骂 同义词:abuse, tongue They feared that he would revile them if they displeased him.他们害怕如果把他惹恼他会痛骂他们。
vt. 使…复活；使…复兴；使…恢复生气 The Chinese light industry was revitalized in the 1980's.中国轻工业在20世纪80年代重新振兴起来。
adj. 可撤销的；可废除的 同义词:cancelable, voidable Any payments are discretionary , non- binding revocable for future years .所有支付均为酌情支付，无附加条件且将来几年可撤销。
n. 取消；撤回；废除 同义词:cancellation, withdrawal On revocation under this Chapter , the donee is obliged to return the goods .依本章规定行使撤销权的，受赠人负返还动产的义务。
vt. 撤回，取消；废除 vi. 有牌不跟 n. 有牌不跟 同义词:recall, unsay He revoked his previous decision.他改变了以前作出的决定。
vi. 反抗；反叛；反感，厌恶 vt. 使反感；使恶心 n. 反抗；叛乱；反感 同义词:strive against, come out against, sicken, resistance, hate, rebellion It was reported that some of the king's troops had revolted.据说有些王室军队已经叛变。

adj. 叛乱的；背叛的；讨厌的 v. 反叛，造反；起反感（revolt的现在分词形式） 同义词:evil, rank I 've always had an overwhelming compunction to confess , to reveal the most revolting details of my existence to others .我总是有着需要为之忏悔的压倒性的良心的谴责，来向别人暴露我生活的最令人厌恶的细节。
vi. 写狂想文；作狂想曲 vt. 狂热地说；把…写成狂想诗文 She kept rhapsodizing about your new fashions.她不住地热烈赞扬你的新潮服装。
n. 狂想曲；狂诗 同义词:capriccio Jacky Cheung, the leading actor of [July Rhapsody ] can't go because he has some other work to do .至于男主角张学友则因有工作在身未能赴会。
n. 修辞，修辞学；华丽的词藻 adj. 花言巧语的 同义词:trope, eloquence, smooth-tongued, plausible I may not offer rhetoric , but I do promise results .我不会用美丽的修辞，但我保证给出满意的结果。
n. 人造钻石；莱茵石（一种假钻石） 同义词:synthetic diamond Love the rhinestone necklace , it give the simple style a little glamour .很喜欢这个人造钻石项链，它给简单的造型增添了一点小华丽。
n. 大黄的叶柄，大黄 Uh, rhubarb . - Oh , me , too .呃大黄（药）。-哦我也是。
adj. [生物] 有节奏的（等于rhythmical）；间歇的；合拍的 n. 韵律论（等于rhythmics） 同义词:intermittent, cadent Music is a rhythmic poem that inspires .音乐是触发灵感的韵诗；
n. 肋骨；排骨；肋状物 vt. 戏弄；装肋于 同义词:costa, sparerib, fool with, kid They often ribbed her for her accent.他们常常拿她的口音开玩笑。
adj. 下流的；言谈粗俗的 n. 言谈粗俗的人；说下流话的人 同义词:dirty, blue Man , a greedy tyrant , ribald , hard and grasping .男人，一个贪婪的暴君，下流、严厉、一心攫取。
adj. 摇晃的；虚弱的；患佝偻病的 同义词:weak, shaky Small farming towns like Huron rickety at the best of times , are now desperate .像休伦这样的小型农业城镇，在经济最好的时候也岌岌可危，现在更是穷途末路了。
n. 山脊；山脉；屋脊 vt. 使成脊状；作垄 vi. 成脊状 同义词:mountain range, cordillera to ridge the land垦地作垄
adj. 普遍的；流行的；盛传的 同义词:widespread, popular, universal, fashionable, going Meanwhile , component prices are plunging , overcapacity is rife and margins are meagre .同时，组件价格上升，生产能力过剩常见，边际利润微薄。
n. 步枪；来复枪 vt. 用步枪射击；抢夺；偷走 同义词:musket, steal away, spirit away Such new arms are rifled.这种新枪炮都加有来复线。
n. 裂缝；不和；[木] 裂口 vt. 使断裂；使分开 vi. 裂开 同义词:crack, split, separate, unhinge, gap, seam, spring off The fog is rifted.雾散了。
n. 装备；钻探设备；服装；[船] 帆装 vt. 操纵；装配；装扮；装上索具 同义词:equipment, clothing, arm, garment, wear, man, guide, manipulate Our boat has been rigged up with new sails.我们的船已装配好新的船帆。
n. [物] 硬度，[力] 刚性；严格，刻板；僵化；坚硬 同义词:stiffness, starch The beam has a constant flexural rigidity .该梁具有常数弯曲刚度。
n. 冗长的废话 adj. 冗长的 同义词:rigamarole, interminable, verbose I 've never heard such rigmarole .我从来没听过像这样的长篇废话。
n. 严厉；精确；苛刻；僵硬 同义词:precision, stiffness Specially trained in logical rigor , they are experts at tracking down subtle biases .严谨的逻辑是哲学家的专业训练，他们的专长就在于找出细微偏见。
adj. 严格的，严厉的；严密的；严酷的 同义词:strict, rigid, precise, severe, tight Science needs more competition between hypotheses and ever more rigorous tests as well.科学始终需要各个假说之间的竞争和严格的检验。
n. 壳；外皮 vt. 剥壳；削皮 同义词:shell, skin, crusta, pare And finally , we have lemon , lime and orange rind .最后，我们还需要柠檬、酸橙和桔皮。
n. 小圈；长卷发 同义词:circlet But why that ringlet on your brow ?但你额头上怎么有卷发飘动？
vt. 漱；冲洗掉；漂净 n. 冲洗；漂洗；[轻] 染发剂；染发 vi. 冲洗掉；漂净 同义词:gargle, irrigation, hair dye She rinsed her hands quickly before eating.她吃东西以前很快洗了一下手。
adj. 暴乱的；狂欢的；不受约束的；放荡的；茂盛的 同义词:independent, free American schools at the time were riotous affairs .那时的美国学校比较混乱。
vt. 撕；锯 vi. 裂开，被撕裂 n. 裂口，裂缝 同义词:saw, gap, seam, crack, split He ripped the letter immediately.他立刻把信拆开。
adj. 可笑的；爱笑的；引人笑的 同义词:ridiculous, laughing The results can be risible .而其结果可能很可笑。
adj. 败坏风俗的；近乎淫猥的 BEIJING ( AP ) -- This investment turned out to be as risky as it was risque .北京（美联社）——这项投资最后证明是冒风险的，因为它是淫秽的。
n. 仪式；惯例，习俗；典礼 同义词:ceremony, tradition, convention, usage, institution How he did this again and again , like some animal courting rite in an old zoology text .他一遍又一遍重复这一动作，好像老动物学教科书里写的动物求偶的仪式。
n. 仪式；惯例；礼制 adj. 仪式的；例行的；礼节性的 同义词:tradition, ceremony, convention, usage, service, routine, ceremonial A tired diplomatic ritual will play out once again .一场疲惫的外交仪式将再次上演。
n. 铆钉 vt. 铆接；固定；（把目光、注意力等）集中于 同义词:clinching, focus on, root He riveted those steel plates together.他把那些钢板铆接在一起。
adj. 吸引人的 n. [机] 铆接 v. 用铆钉固定；集中于…（rivet的ing形式） 同义词:attractive, absorbing Perkins 's tale is a riveting one and Kirstin Downey tells it at a cracking pace .贝金斯的故事是引人入胜的，克里斯•多尼在讲她的故事的时候层层递进娓娓道来。
n. 小溪，小河 同义词:creek, burnie I see you hold the edge of your skirt strid rivulet .我看见你提起裙裾跨过小河。
n. 柔软的羊皮；杂色马；红棕色 adj. 花毛的；用绵羊皮革装订的 同义词:reddish brown Mohrgan Fel and three other Imperial Knights protecting Roan Fel 's decoy .摩根•费尔及其他三名帝国武士奋起保卫罗恩•费尔的替身。
n. 长袍，礼服；制服 vi. 穿长袍 vt. 使穿长袍 同义词:uniform, cope In the early morning,she robed and went out.一清早她穿上衣服就出去了。
adj. 强健的；健康的；粗野的；粗鲁的 同义词:healthy, crude, gross, fine, rough a robust faith坚定的信念
adj. 啮齿类的；咬的，嚼的；侵蚀性的 n. [脊椎] 啮齿动物 同义词:corrosive, erosive, gnawer This small rodent can scoop out a long , narrow tunnel in a very short time .这种小啮齿动物能在很短的时间里挖出一条又长又窄的地道来。
n. 鱼卵，鱼子；牝鹿，獐 Roger wondered what else he could transform into roe .罗杰想知道他还能把什么东西转换进鱼卵里去。
adj. 流氓的；恶作剧的，淘气的 同义词:scampish, blackguardly the captain was set adrift by his roguish crew .船长被他的流氓船员放逐了。
vt. 搅浑；惹怒 vi. 动荡；喧闹 n. 小股汹涌的急流 同义词:rile, rub the wrong way, whoop up She roiled the wine in his presence.她当着他的面把酒搅浑。

adj. 欢乐的；喧闹的 n. 申斥；责骂 同义词:convivial, noisy, talking-to, opprobrium So exclaims Professor Munakata at the outset of a rollicking adventure set at the British Museum , in the form of a manga , or Japanese cartoon .宗像教授在一个以大英博物馆为背景的刺激的冒险故事的开头惊呼。这是一部漫画，即日本卡通。
n. 新手 同义词:freshman, noob, first-timer " You can't do that , sir , " objected rookie nurse .“先生，您不能那么办，”这位新来的护士反驳道。
n. 栖木；鸟窝；群栖的禽鸟 vi. 栖息；安歇 vt. 使…栖息；为…提供歇息处 同义词:perch, perch He was the quintessential old-school trader who worked his way to the top and ruled the roost .他是个信奉经典学院派理论的交易员，从公司底层干起，一步步走到今天。
n. 公鸡；狂妄自负的人 同义词:coq, chanticleer A donkey heard a rooster crow in the field .驴子听见公鸡在田地里啼叫。
n. 花名册；执勤人员表；逐项登记表 The flight crew roster was issued on the 20th of the month .此份航班乘务员登记表是本月20号公布的。
adj. 旋转的，转动的；轮流的 n. 旋转式机器；[动力] 转缸式发动机 同义词:rolling, revolutionary The group opened the hospital, the Rotary Eye Institute of Navsari, in 1970 .该组织在1970年创办了纳夫萨里扶轮社眼科研究所。
n. 死记硬背；生搬硬套 同义词:rotte There were about forty children to a class , sitting at double - desks and learning rote .每个班有四十名学生，用的都是双人桌，教学特点是死记硬背。
adj. 洪亮的；圆胖的 同义词:resonant, chubby Mrs. Butler was sitting rotund complacency at the foot of the table .巴特勒太太心安理得地坐在桌子的末端。
adj. 迂回的，绕道的；圆滚滚的 n. 迂回路线；环状交叉路口 同义词:indirect, derious I entered the village by the little roundabout lane .我由一条迂回曲折的小径进了村。
vt. 击溃 vi. 搜寻 n. 溃败；暴动 同义词:wallop, search, hunt for, insurrection, sedition Our baseball team routed the Sea Gull by a score of 15 to 6.我们的棒球队以 15 比 6 大败海鸥队。
vt. 漫游于；漂泊于 vi. 流浪；飘忽不定 n. 流浪；徘徊；粗纺线 同义词:vagabondize, stray, vagrancy, vagabondage He roved over the sea in search of adventure when he was young.他年轻时曾遨游海上，寻求惊险和刺激。
adj. 吵闹的；粗暴的 n. 粗暴的人；好吵闹的人 同义词:tumultuous, clamorous, roughneck, churl The teacher made the rowdy class quiet down .老师使这吵闹的班级安静了下来。
n. 皇室；版税；王权；专利税 同义词:crown, majesty Mixing royalty is perhaps a fitting end to a hectic seven days for New Jersey 's new prince.在忙乱了七天之后，会晤皇室可能是这位新泽西州新长官最合适的放松了。
adj. 橡胶似的；有弹力的；坚韧的 同义词:tough, resilient His rubbery look , and penchant for wild and extreme behavior has given him a notoriety he delights in.他那似橡胶的眼神，以及对狂野和极至行为的酷爱，令他名声远扬，乐此不疲。
n. 碎石，碎砖；粗石堆 同义词:crushed stone, rockfill The town has twice been rubbled in battle.这个城镇曾经两次毁于战争。
adj. 红润的；透红的 同义词:beet-faced His rubicund face expressed consternation and fatigue .他那红通的脸显得又惊惶又疲乏。
n. 皱；普通人；大量 vt. 弄皱 vi. 变皱 同义词:lots of, wealth, ocean, sea, body, crush, crumple The lower hem of his new overcoat rucked up.他的新大衣的下摆起皱了。
n. 帆布背包 No beach umbrella and rucksack are allowed to be carried during outdoor labor .室外劳动或工作时请勿打遮阳伞、背包。
n. 船舵；飞机方向舵 A life without a purpose is a ship without a rudder .一个缺少目标的人生就如同一艘无舵的船。
adj. 红的；红润的 adv. 极度；非常 vt. 使变红 vi. 变红 同义词:beet-faced, ruber, extremely, badly, highly, greatly, too, redden, go red, redden The face was strong , big- boned ruddy .脸是结实红润的，颧骨高高的。
adj. 基本的；初步的；退化的；残遗的；未发展的 同义词:elementary, basic, fundamental, essential, primary What would be the utility of the rudimentary beginnings of such structures ?这种构造，在其最初的幼稚的阶段能有什么样的用途？
n. 入门；初步；基础知识 同义词:alphabet, ABC Businessmen he lectures to do not even know the rudiments of doctrine .他传教的那些实业家们甚至不懂教条的基础知识。
vi. 后悔；悲伤 vt. 后悔；懊悔 n. 芸香；后悔 同义词:repent, be down in spirits, regret, repent, repentance, penitence You will live to rue the loss of such a good opportunity.对失去这么好的一次机会你将来总有一天会后悔的。
adj. 可怜的；悲伤的；悔恨的 同义词:poor, wretched The rueful if inevitable step of a country running low on political capital will not be mistaken as a positive beginning .如果一个国家的政治资本不可避免的越来越少，那么悔恨将不会被误认为是一个积极的开端。
n. 恶棍；流氓；无赖 adj. 残暴的；凶恶的；无法无天的 同义词:tough, cad, atrocious, tyrannical A person once was a ruffian .一个人曾经是痞子。
vt. 弄皱；触怒；扰乱；迅速翻动 vi. 起皱；烦恼；连续地轻敲 n. 皱褶；生气；混乱；连续轻敲声 同义词:disorder, upset, trouble, worry, vitality, animation, pet, chaos, disorder The wind ruffled my hair.风吹乱了我的头发。
adj. 反刍的；沉思的 n. 反刍动物 同义词:reflecting, regurgitant very small hornless deer -like ruminant of tropical Asia and west Africa .热带亚洲和非洲西部非常小的无角形似鹿的反刍动物。
vt. 反刍；沉思；反复思考 vi. 沉思，反刍 同义词:chew the cud, remasticate, meditate on, be deep in thought A cow ruminates its food.牛反刍它的食物。

adj. 默想的，沉思的；爱反复思考的 同义词:reflecting, contemplative He has unnerved them with his swashbuckling fight against corruption , and exasperated them with his ruminative style of management .沃尔福威茨大张声势的反腐败斗争已经让他们身心疲乏，而其沉思式的管理又让他们格外恼火。

vt. 检查；搜出；仔细搜查；翻找出 n. 翻找；检查；查出的物件；零星杂物 vi. 翻找；仔细搜查 同义词:examine, inspect, review, inspection, examination, checking, monitoring, hunt throw I rummaged all the drawers before I found my ballpoint pen.我翻遍了所有的抽屉才找到我的圆珠笔。
vt. 弄皱；弄得乱七八糟 vi. 弄皱；变凌乱 n. 皱褶；皱纹 同义词:crush, crumple, rivel, goffer, rugosity You mustn't play in your new skirt, you'll rumple it.你千万不要穿着新裙子去玩耍，你会把它弄皱的。
n. 喧闹；骚乱 同义词:disturbance, disorder, turbulence Max : Let the wild rumpus start !麦克斯：让野兽家园崇焕生机。
n. 破裂；决裂；疝气 vi. 破裂；发疝气 vt. 使破裂；断绝；发生疝 同义词:fracture, cracking, fracture, crack, crack, fracture, stop The diplomatic relations between the two countries have been ruptured.两国外交关系已经断绝。
adj. 农村的，乡下的；田园的，有乡村风味的 同义词:country, sylvan Rural children face the same risks as city children .乡村孩子和城市孩子面临同样的危险。
adj. 乡村的；纯朴的；粗野的；手工粗糙的 n. 乡下人；乡巴佬 同义词:robust, gross, rough, country, bush, peasant, provincial, countryman It had an outer gate , and a rustic approach.房外有个院门，和一条简陋的小径。

adj. 秘书的；书记的；部长的 同义词:ministerial, clerical Yes , she runs a secretarial agency from home .是的，她在家里经营一个秘书公司。

adj. 宗派的；偏狭的；党派心强的 n. 属于宗派的人；宗派心强的人；宗派主义者 同义词:provincial, denominational, factionist Certainly his underlings dislike the sectarian style Mr Wolfowitz seems to share with the man who appointed him .无疑，他的下属们都不喜欢他要与任命他的人共享利益的宗派主义风格。

adj. 世俗的；长期的；现世的；不朽的 n. 牧师 同义词:chronic, long time, standing, eternal, lay, minister, priest, preacher Indonesia prides itself on being a secular state that happens to have a Muslim majority .印尼人认为，该国是世俗国家，恰巧穆斯林占多数，他们对此感到自豪。
adj. 安静的；沉着的 vt. 给…服镇静剂 同义词:quiet, composed, calm, steady, tranquil When I retire I want a sedate life but for now , I enjoy the noise and pace of the city .我退休以后想过一种平静的生活，不过现在我喜欢城市的喧闹和节奏。
n. [药] 镇静剂；能使安静的东西；止痛药 adj. 使镇静的；使安静的 同义词:killer, tranquillizer, calmative The sedative had left him with an acute headache , and his stomach was raw.镇静剂的药性过了，头里痛得厉害，胃内有如针刺。

adj. 久坐的；坐惯的；定栖的；静坐的 This prosperity has bought a sedentary lifestyle and a sugary diet , which may have triggered a genetic predisposition to diabetes among Arabs .繁荣带来了凝滞不动的生活习惯和嗜糖的饮食结构，在阿拉伯人中这容易诱发高血糖的遗传倾向。

n. 围网；拖地大网 vt. 用围网捕捞 vi. 用围网捕鱼 同义词:purse net The strand of that island was its first boundary wall, Seine its first moat .这小岛的河滩就是巴黎最早的城廓，塞纳河就是它最早的沟堑。
adj. 地震的；因地震而引起的 Japan and the United States have invested in computer technology to monitor and analyze seismic activity .日本和美国已经投入资金运用电脑技术来观测和分析地震活动。
n. 自信；自作主张；一意孤行 同义词:assertiveness, assuredness Too much self- assertion is begging each other 's charity .过多的自作多情是在乞求对方的施舍。
n. 沉着，泰然自若 同义词:aplomb, composedness The self- possession of that man had somehow induced a corresponding state in myself .这个人镇定自若，似乎使我也相应镇定下来了。

adj. 衰老的；变老的；老化的 同义词:decrepit, anile There are three main classes of cells that accumulate in the body during aging to a supernumerary degree: fat cells , senescent cells and certain types of immune cells .在老化期间有三个主要类型的细胞过分积累于身体中：脂肪细胞、衰老细胞和某些类型的免疫细胞。
n. （中世纪贵族的）管家，总管 同义词:chamberlain, majordomo The seneschal was an old stern man .管家是个严肃的老人。
adj. 高龄的；老衰的；高龄所致的 After Alzheimer 's disease , vascular dementia is the second leading cause of senile dementia .紧随阿耳茨海默氏病之后，血管性痴呆是导致老年性痴呆症的第二大原因。

n. [基医] 衰老；高龄；老态龙钟 同义词:senescence, consenescence It was premature to conclude , he added , that drinking wine or sake slowed the deterioration of brain functions in the elderly , or warded off senility .他补充说，现在就得出饮用葡萄酒或米酒会延缓老人脑功能退化或防止衰老这样的结论，还为时过早。
n. 感觉；轰动；感动 同义词:consciousness, feel The paper and the meeting did not cause an immediate sensation .这篇论文和这次会议没有立即引起轰动。

adj. 轰动的；耸人听闻的；非常好的；使人感动的 同义词:immense, lurid The Master always frowned on anything that seemed sensational . "The divine ", he claimed , "is only found in the ordinary ".大师总是对看上去耸人听闻的事情蹙眉。他主张：”神圣的东西，只在平凡中找得到。
adj. 感觉的；肉欲的；世俗的；感觉论的 同义词:lay, mundane Animals deal only sensual pleasure and are by instinct impelled to seek it .动物只有感觉的快乐，本能推动它们去寻求这种快感。
n. 好色；淫荡；喜爱感官享受 同义词:lechery, lasciviousness At the beginning there had been little true sensuality in it .起初，这里面绝少真正的情感。
adj. 简洁精炼的；警句的，富于格言的 同义词:epigrammatic, aphoristic " Oh , for God 's sake , don't sententious , " Bertha interrupted fiercely.“啊，看在上帝的份上，别这么开口闭口搬弄警句吧，”伯莎不客气地打断他说。

adj. 有感情的；有感觉力的；意识到的 n. 有知觉的人 同义词:aware, conscious Sure , You fight Evil , but when Was the last time you showed a " concern for the dignity of sentient beings "?没错，你与邪恶作战，但你最后一次表现出“对于生命体的高贵品质的关心”是什么时候了呢？
n. 哨兵；岗哨 vi. 放哨 vt. 设岗哨 同义词:piquet, watcher, keep watch to sentry the front door of a factory在工厂正门站岗守卫
n. 败血症，[医] 脓毒病；腐败作用 同义词:septicemia, blood poisoning Shock , sepsis , acidosis , hypoxia , and so forth , are treated .对休克，感染，酸中毒，缺氧等应加以治疗。
adj. 败血症的；[医] 脓毒性的；腐败的 n. 腐烂物 同义词:corrupt, putrid, ulcer Treatment of septic shock is properly based on prevention .感染性休克的真正治疗在于预防。
n. 坟墓；圣物置放处 vt. 埋葬 同义词:tomb, lasthome, bury, tomb A flatterer 's throat is an open sepulcher .拍马屁者的喉咙就是打开的坟墓。
adj. 阴森森的；坟墓的，丧葬的 同义词:funeral There was a sepulchral atmosphere in the room .房间里有一种颇为阴沉的气氛。

adj. 时髦的；华丽而俗气的 同义词:modern, fashionable, tony, in, stylish The brightly-coloured caps prevent accidental scratches and damage to furniture - and have the added advantage of looking snazzy .这种漂亮的指甲盖可以阻止小狗划伤家具，而且外观看起来也很华丽。
vi. 溜；鬼鬼祟祟做事；向老师打小报告 vt. 偷偷地做；偷偷取得 n. 鬼鬼祟祟的人；偷偷摸摸的行为；告密者 adj. 暗中进行的 同义词:steal, informer, confidential informant, under-the-table to sneak into the laboratory偷偷潜入实验室
adj. 鬼鬼祟祟的；私下的；卑鄙的 v. 潜行（sneak的ing形式） 同义词:poor, private, mean, base, dirty to sneak into the laboratory偷偷潜入实验室
vi. 嘲笑，冷笑 vt. 嘲笑，冷笑 n. 嘲笑，冷笑 同义词:laugh at, make a mockery of, laugh at, deride, derision, sarcasm to sneer at one's pretensions对某人的主张报以轻蔑的一笑
adj. 伪造的；卑鄙的；暗讽的 n. 赝品；骗子 同义词:poor, false, mean, base, dirty, fraud, sharp Her new boyfriend is a snide merchant .她的新男友是个奸商。

n. 窃笑；偷偷的笑 vi. 吃吃窃笑；暗笑 同义词:titter, smile to oneself The unfeeling Toad broke into snigger , and then pulled himself together and tried to look particularly solemn .癞蛤蟆窃窃地笑了，实在是麻木不仁，他笑过之后振作起来，故意显得特别庄严的样子。

adj. 势利的 同义词:dicty The motive behind such words is austere rather than snobbish .使用这些字样的动机是庄严肃穆而非趋炎附势。
vi. 调查，窥探 n. 私家侦探，到处窥视；爱管闲事的人 vt. 窥察，窥探 同义词:probe, examine, mouse, sherlock, private detective, pry about, pry into She always snoops on me.她总是窥探我的情况。
adj. 傲慢的，自大的；目中无人的 同义词:arrogant, assuming, haughty Snooty He 's too snooty to associate with his old friends now he's rich .他现在富了，竟妄自尊大不屑与老朋友来往了。
n. 随风飘飞的雪；被风刮在一起的雪堆 A huge snowdrift is blocking the entrance to the driveway .大雪堆阻塞了汽车专用道的入口。
vt. 冷落；严厉斥责；掐灭 n. 冷落；斥责；突然的停止 adj. 制动用的；短扁上翘的 同义词:absent treatment, denunciation, fetch-up to snub somebody by ignoring him(or her)故意不理睬某人
adj. 舒适的；温暖的；紧身的；隐藏的 vt. 使变得温暖舒适；隐藏 vi. 偎依；舒适地蜷伏 n. 舒适温暖的地方；雅室 同义词:comfortable, pleasant, warm, easy, hidden, lock, pocket, nestle up The small room snugged with the fire burning.生上火后，小屋变得暖和舒服了。
vt. 使舒适温暖；紧抱；偎依 vi. 偎依；舒服地蜷伏 同义词:press, nestle up, nestle up to snuggle up in the sofa躺在沙发上
vt. 吸收，吸入；沉浸在（工作或学习中）；使……上下湿透 vi. 浸泡；渗透 n. 浸；湿透；大雨 同义词:absorb, drink in, dip in, sink, drenching, downfall The clothes should soak for a quarter before washing.洗这些衣服之前应浸泡一刻钟
adj. 湿透的，浸透的 v. 浸湿（soak的过去分词） 同义词:sobby, wringing, drenched The clothes should soak for a quarter before washing.洗这些衣服之前应浸泡一刻钟
adj. 冷静的，清醒的；未醉的 vt. 使严肃；使醒酒，使清醒 同义词:cool, philosophical, disenchant to sober somebody up令某人清醒
n. 清醒，冷静；节制；严肃 同义词:levelheadedness, calmness Through helping others , members reinforce their own sobriety and build up self- esteem .通过帮助别人，会员们加强了自我节制并逐步树立了自尊心。
n. 绰号 同义词:agname, epithet Owen smiled about the" Argentina killer " sobriquet .他对“阿根廷杀手”的绰号一笑了制。
n. 社会名流 I could be your socialite .我可能是你的社会名流。
n. 短袜；一击 vt. 重击；给……穿袜 adv. 正着地；不偏不倚地 adj. 非常成功的 同义词:bobbysocks, anklet, pound on, gang bang, smack-dab to sock one's little brother给小弟穿上短袜
adj. 浸透的；浑身湿透的；浸过酒的 vt. 使浸透；使迷糊 同义词:permeant, soppy, besot Don't sodden the tablecloth.别把桌布弄湿了。

adj. 浸水的；透湿的；沉闷的 同义词:tedious, waterishlogged If we keep the soil soggy , the root hairs rot and we won 't realize that we are killing our plant until it is too late .如果我们一直保持土壤潮湿的话，这些根须便会腐烂，当我们意识到我们正在残害它们的时候一切都已太迟。

n. 安慰；慰藉；安慰之物 vt. 安慰；抚慰；使快乐（过去式solaced，过去分词solaced，现在分词solacing，第三人称单数solaces） 同义词:comfort, relief, consolation to solace one's friend with soothing words用宽慰的话安慰友人

n. 恳求；教唆；诱惑 同义词:prayer, suit The experiment conducted to study on seed germination of L. (superscript *) L. formolongi by using PEG solicitation and low temperature soakage .本文对新铁炮百合进行了种子发芽的研究试验，试验采用PEG引发处理和低温浸润的方式。
adj. 热切期望的；热心的；挂念的 同义词:eager, keen, enthusiastic They were very solicitous and attentive to detail .他们非常细心，十分注意细节。
n. 团结，团结一致 同义词:unity, consolidation He has campaigned under the slogan " independence and solidarity ".福田康夫的竞选口号是“独立和团结”。

adj. 孤独的；独居的 n. 独居者；隐士 同义词:alone, neighborless, hermit, anchorite Inside every solitary machine one day will be a swarm of non- mechanical things .将来有一天，每一台单独的机器内也会有一大群非机械的东西。
n. 孤独；隐居；荒僻的地方 同义词:privacy, loneliness He passed twenty - four years in solitude .他在孤独中度过了二十四年。
n. 独奏；独唱；独奏曲 adj. 独奏的；独唱的；单独的 vt. 单人攀登；单独驾 vi. 单独表演；放单飞 adv. 单独地 同义词:alone, independent, isolated, separate, sole, solely, alone, individually Let hime solo, and you go along.让他一个人演独角戏吧，你就陪衬一下。
n. 偿付能力；溶解力 But cash is not easy to come by for big institutions with concerns about their solvency , as Lehman's collapse showed .但是现金对于这个大型机构来说很难获取，因为随着雷曼的垮台，人们担心其偿还能力。
adj. 有偿付能力的；有溶解力的 n. 溶剂；解决方法 同义词:resolvent, impregnant, menstruum How do you close this cash flow gap and keep your business solvent ?怎样缩减这些现金流量额的差距来为公司找到出路呢？
adj. 躯体的；肉体的；体壁的 同义词:material, carnal Somatic cells of angiosperms enter a regenerative phase and behave like embryos .被子植物体细胞进入一个生殖阶段，而且其行为象胚。

adj. 忧郁的；昏暗的；严峻的；阴天的 同义词:severe, blue, dark, lowering The mood at the outset was " deeply somber , " Sullivan reported , but eventually the two teams got down to business .据沙利文报告，开始时的气氛是“极端阴沉的”，但后来双方还是谈起正经事来了。
adj. 催眠的，想睡的 同义词:hypnogenetic, soporiferous The noise of the stream had a pleasantly somnolent effect .小河潺潺的流水声有宜人的催眠效果。
n. 奏鸣曲 He played a piano sonata of his own composition .他演奏了一首自己创作的钢琴奏鸣曲。
n. 响亮；响亮程度，宏亮度 Repetition brings sonority .重复带来音响。

adj. 复杂的；精致的；久经世故的；富有经验的 v. 使变得世故；使迷惑；篡改（sophisticate的过去分词形式） 同义词:complicated, experienced, involved, detailed, exquisite, mystified He has now been sophisticated.他现在已变得老于世故了。
n. 诡辩；诡辩法 同义词:casuistry, quiddity Sophistry won't alter facts .诡辩改变不了事实。
n. 催眠剂；安眠药 adj. 催眠的；想睡的 同义词:hypnagogue, sleeping pill, somnolent, hypnogenetic His voice had an soporific effect .他的声音具有催眠作用。
n. 女高音；最高音部；女高音歌手 adj. 女高音的；童声高音的 Amanda: Tell your parents that the performer is a renowned soprano who seldom tours .告诉你父母演出者是一位很少巡回演出的著名女高音。
n. 魔术，巫术 同义词:medicine, conjuring Copy target instant or sorcery spell . You may choose new targets for the copy .复制目标瞬间或法术咒语。你可以为该复制选择新的目标。
adj. 肮脏的；卑鄙的；利欲熏心的；色彩暗淡的 同义词:poor, mean, base, dirty This was the first in the sordid series of mistakes which was to cause her to fall so low.这是她所犯下的一连串卑鄙过失中的第一个，它将使她堕落到如此卑劣的境地。

n. 盐汁；腌货 vt. 腌制；弄醉；把…浸入水 vi. 被浸透；喝醉 adv. 扑通地 同义词:salt away, salt down, get drunk, be in drink, kerflop, kerplunk The diamond ring was soused into the fishbowl of water.那只钻戒被扔进了养鱼缸的水里。

adj. 至高无上的；有主权的；拥有最高统治权的；不折不扣的；极好的 n. 君主；独立国；最高统治者 同义词:wonderful, excellent, famous, super, great, emperor, monarch Everyone is talking about sovereign wealth funds .人人都在谈论主权财富基金。

adj. 强烈的；疾行的，疾驰的 n. 打屁股；拍击 adv. 显著地 v. 拍打；严厉斥责（spank的ing形式） 同义词:intense, burning, sharp, consuming, keen, slapping, remarkably, notably, prominently, noticeably, markedly, slapping He heard a horse approaching at a spanking trot .他听到一匹马正在疾步驰近。

n. 火花；朝气；闪光 vt. 发动；鼓舞；求婚 vi. 闪烁；发火花；求婚 同义词:A FRAME, scintilla, stimulate, launch, lift, drive, spirit, offer, coruscate Their eyes sparked with green in the dark night.在黑暗的夜里，他们的眼睛会发出绿色的闪光。
n. 闪耀；火花；活力 vt. 使闪耀；使发光 vi. 闪耀；发泡；活跃 同义词:energy, vitality, spring, vigor, fire, flare, shine on The stars sparkle in the dark sky.夜晚的天空上星星闪闪发光。
adj. 稀疏的；稀少的 同义词:exiguous, infrequent Outside this central area , the cells rapidly become more sparse .其他靠外部的区域，细胞迅速变得稀疏。
adj. 斯巴达的；斯巴达式的 n. 斯巴达人；勇士 Didn't you notice Spartan brevity in his speech ?难道你没有注意到他讲话的那种斯巴达式的“简短”吗？
n. [临床] 痉挛；抽搐；一阵发作 同义词:fit, tic spasm of introspection soon turned into a blame game and Mr Badawi was forced to say he would resign .刚抽完内省之风，一场互相指责的闹剧旋即上演，巴达维也被迫宣布辞职。
adj. 痉挛的，痉挛性的；间歇性的 同义词:convulsionary, twitchy Bronchospasm -- Bronchoconstriction , or the sudden narrowing of the smaller airways, of spasmodic nature.支气管痉挛--支气管狭窄，或突然缩小，呈痉挛的症状。

n. 洪水；一阵；大雨；突然迸发 同义词:flood, blast Police are investigating a spate of burglaries in the area .警察正在调查这一地区发生的大量盗窃案。
n. （调和、涂抹用）抹刀，小铲；[医] 压舌板 同义词:spudder She level the surface of the cake mixture with a metal spatula .她用金属铲抹平了蛋糕配料。
n. 卵；菌丝；产物 vt. 产卵；酿成，造成；大量生产 vi. 产卵；大量生产 同义词:child, creation, fruit, create, egg laying, oviposit, mass production Many sea fishes spawn in rivers.许多海洋鱼类是在淡水河里产卵的。
n. 矛，枪 vt. 用矛刺 同义词:pike to spear two enemy officers to the death枪挑两名敌军军官

n. 细节；特性（specific的复数）；详情 同义词:characteristics, details, traits, particulars The emotions roused by the fight for the chocolate - maker go far beyond the business specifics , however .然而，对这家巧克力制造商的争夺所激起的情感远不止生意那么简单。
n. 样品，样本；标本 同义词:pattern, swatch The problem before us is where we can find specimen .我们面前的问题是我们在哪儿能找到标本。

n. 徒有其表；华而不实；似是而非 同义词:Beauty without virtue is a rose without fragrance, garishness These optimal products hold the following features : speciosity / uniqueness / novelty /high- quality / reasonable pricing / multi-functional .其产品造型独特，新颖、质量可靠、价格合理、多功能装置于一体，是新一代最理想的产品。

adj. 似是而非的；外表美观的；华而不实的；徒有其表的 同义词:purple, colorable However , the idea that the way to prevent " confusion " is to keep users from getting information about their exposure seems specious reasoning at best.然而，这样的想法如何防止“混乱”是为了避免让他们接触的资料似乎充其量似是而非的推理用户。
n. 灰尘；污点；小颗粒 vt. 使有斑点 同义词:dust, dirt, dapple By such behaviour he's specked the honour of his family.他的行为玷污了他祖上的名声。
adj. 壮观的，惊人的；公开展示的 同义词:tremendous, incredible Africa will host its most spectacular global event in 2010 : the football World Cup in South Africa .非洲将主办其在2010年最引人注目的全球事件：在南非举办的足球世界杯。
n. 幽灵；妖怪；恐怖之物 同义词:shadow, ghost No man , if he be truthful , can say that the specter of war is banished .没有人，如果他是真诚的，能够说战争的幽灵已经被消除。
adj. [光] 光谱的；幽灵的；鬼怪的 同义词:ghostly, phantasmal What is spectral acceleration ?什么是谱加速度？
n. 光谱；频谱；范围；余象 同义词:extent, boundary, region, territory, area Several different names have emerged to characterize different parts of the spectrum .几个不同的名称用来表示电磁波谱的不同部分。
vi. 推测；投机；思索 vt. 推断 同义词:guess, venture, understand, conclude This is the method that we have been speculating about.这正是我们一直在思考的方法。
n. 投机；推测；思索；投机买卖 同义词:theory, guess, projection The latter way refers to speculation .后一种方法指的是投机。
n. 洞穴学 His interest in the kindred field of speleology was promptly revived .他感兴趣的领域的骨肉洞穴学的迅速恢复。
vt. 拼，拼写；意味着；招致；拼成；迷住；轮值 n. 符咒；一段时间；魅力 vi. 拼字；轮替 同义词:possess, invite, court, secure, cycle, grace, while, charm, period of time, turn taking Sorry, would you please spell your name?对不起，你能不能拼写一下你的名字?

n. （英）灌木林；小树林 同义词:grove, shrubbery There are forest spinney , open woodland , plough field , grass and rock around the Great Wall .长城周围的土地利用类型主要有有林地，灌木林，疏林地，耕地，荒草地和裸岩。
n. 老姑娘；未婚女人 spinster is very sad .那个老处女很悲伤。

n. 螺旋；旋涡；螺旋形之物 adj. 螺旋形的；盘旋的 vt. 使成螺旋形；使作螺旋形上升 vi. 盘旋；成螺旋形；螺旋形上升（过去式spiraled/spiralled，过去分词spiraled/spiralled，现在分词spiraling/spiralling，第三人称单数spirals，副词spirally） 同义词:screw, helix, helical, gyroidal The eagle spirals up into the sky.鹰盘旋着飞上了高空。

n. 不顾；恶意；怨恨 vt. 刁难；使恼怒 同义词:regardless of, hatred, make a difficulty, exasperate Don't spite him. He's only a kid.别为难他，他还是个孩子呢。
adj. 泥泞的；容易溅开的；遍布斑点的；引人注目的 同义词:attractive, dramatic We dreamed of doing something big of splashy , something significant .我们都梦想郭作一番大事业，作有意义的事情。

= spleenful
adj. 辉煌的；灿烂的；极好的；杰出的 同义词:brilliant, excellent, wonderful, famous, prominent She chose the most splendid gown she had, and took out her jewels .她从衣饰中选出最华丽的一件长衫，取出她的珠宝。

n. 碎片；微小的东西；极瘦的人 vi. 分裂；裂成碎片 vt. 使分裂；使裂成碎片 同义词:debris, chip, to split, split up, tear, disrupt I don't know who has splintered the plates?我不知道是谁把盘子都给打碎了?
vt. 分离；使分离；劈开；离开 vi. 离开；被劈开；断绝关系 n. 劈开；裂缝 adj. 劈开的 同义词:leave, quit, leave, quit, get out, crack, cleavage, cloven, cleft to split a log into two把木头劈成两半
vi. 挥霍；卖弄 n. 挥霍；炫耀 vt. 挥霍；夸耀 同义词:piss away, to squander, display, profuseness, air, sport, consume We'll splurge on a trip in France next year.明年咱们去法国挥霍玩个痛快。

adj. 海绵状的；轻软的；多孔而有弹性的；有吸水性的 同义词:flossy, fleecy Marrow is the spongy center inside of bones .骨髓存在于骨骼的海棉状中心部位。
n. 自发性；自然发生 同义词:spontaneous generation, abiogenesis He offered hope spontaneity in a country in a drowning in its own passivity .他对于一个沉溺在消极之中的国家提出了奋发自强的希望。
adj. 自发的；自然的；无意识的 同义词:autonomous, mechanical, natural, initiative You can pick up your story the next evening at this spontaneous bookmark .第二天晚上你可以凭借这自然产生的书签继续跟进你的故事。

n. 运动；游戏；娱乐；运动会；玩笑 vi. 游戏 vt. 游戏；参加体育运动；夸耀 adj. 运动的 同义词:movement, entertainment, exercise, campaign, game, air, make a display of, athletic, kinetic They Sported for a while, and then went to bed.玩耍了一会儿，他们便上床睡觉了。
